Reviews.Title: “Quirky urban oasis in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for conference in early March. Rooms are on outside with a nice lush tropical atrium. Rooms are oddly shaped (long and narrow) with a nice terrace with a soaking tub on it. Bathroom was very nicely appointed and large. Internet and email connections in the hotel were not good. Many attendees at our conference complained about it. Nice rooftop pool and bar, though the view was not great. Hotel is across the street from Cocowalk. Tip: park at Cocowalk for $10 instead of paying $26 for valet at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal experience”
Reviews.Author: N0_moss
Reviews.Content: I had a phenomenal stay at the Mayfair. The hotel just feels so "fresh" compared most places in Miami, it might have been the spa feel and jungle-like vegetation. The rooftop pool is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Little Hood”
Reviews.Author: miwohl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really cute neighborhood with lots of little shops and restaurants. I only stayed one night and booked on Priceline since I wasn't going to be there. While I named my price, I would stay there again if I had to be in the area. I liked: 1) Great, huge bathroom 2) Location is fun if you need to be in that neighborhood 3) The restaurant was great. I had a great salad and wood-fired pizza for dinner 4) Really clean room and great, comfortable bed What I didn't like: 1) The pool is located on the 5th floor roof and they blast the music during the day. I can appreciate that they're trying to create a party vibe but it doesn't really work for them. 2) My room was on the 5th floor so I got a lot of that noise when I was trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in coconut grove , but expensive for an outside miami beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: fidjistar
Reviews.Content: We took like last time a deluxe double suite. The room is very big , and confortable , but they are a lot of little things that each time drive us crazy !! button to switch on or off the light etc .. you have to get in the big bathroom and get wet even if you just want a bath and not a shower .. the interior very zen is nice to see and the swimming pool on the roof nice, but it closes to early to really enjoy it .. you have a little mall in front of the hotel , nice but very small. It's a nice place to stay but you need a car to move.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Smells!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn R
Reviews.Content: We checked into a parlor "suite". What a joke. It looked like the leftover storage closet, with worn out furniture that reminded us of old rattan patio furniture with new cushions. There was food stuck to the rattan, the "suite" smelled of mildew, there were no movies in the bedroom, to watch something, you had to sit in the living room on the uncomfortable, worn out stuff. The ceilings were so low it made you feel as though you were walking into a room with 7 foot ceilings, (standard ceiling height is 8 feet). The closet door was placed so that putting your clothes in it was difficult, there was a support column in the bedroom that you had to walk around to get to the bed. Work had been done in the room and it had a patch job on the wall that was left unfinished. They just stuck a couple screws into plywood and covered the hole. Called the front desk, they kept saying they would call back in a couple minutes, we finally grabbed out suitcases and left. Drove down the street and stayed at a competitors hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, Relaxation & Zen in the midst of "Happening" Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: NY2FLGrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely LOVED staying for a weekend at this hotel!!! It was a very charming and tranquil place from the moment you enter the lobby, yet just outside you are amidst the always happening atmosphere of Coconut Grove...one of the most fun places in Miami. You can walk to everything in "the Grove" so you don't need your car...and we parked across the street at the outdoor Coco Walk shopping plaza (with movie multiplex) for only $10 per day when you pay cash. The hotel's live bamboo gardens & waterfall in the center atrium of the hotel as well as all the lush plants and landscaping everywhere make you feel like you are on a tropical island. We had total privacy on our balcony room which had a Japanese hot tub, because of all the lush plants. We loved the decor, the granite floors and the aromatherapy bathroom amenities were top notch. The rooftop bar and pool area (salt water!) with cabanas is fabulous! A great place for a cocktail at sunset. The pool is big enough to do laps & on a Monday morning we were the only ones there. We had dinner at their restaurant...food and ambience was excellent with a free glass of wine for each of us, courtesy of a coupon from the hotel in our room. We will definitely book this hotel again...next time we will try the spa. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Something Old, Something New”
Reviews.Author: ConstantMotion
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is a mixed bag. Too old to completely renovate but of what money they have, they try their best. The Mayfair doesn't compare well and can't compete with newer hotels in the Miami market. The layout is strange; it is, basically, a hotel from the 80's. But it is 4 star in many ways. You will be comfortable and we found it very quiet and enjoyable for sleeping. Rooms are large, if a bit dark. Some things, like the rooms, are well kept. Others, like the fitness facility, are not. We did not eat in the hotel but those street level venues looked very good and that is probably where the management is spending money. They do sell through Hotwire/Expedia and that's good. At a discount ($215 per night) it is a reasonable value. You have other choices if you can spend more. The location is great. In Coconut Grove, there is a complete shopping, dining and movie area across the street. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a nice location but seriously NEEDS updating!!”
Reviews.Author: SwolfWI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Mayfair Hotel and Spa to round out our honeymoon trip after a Caribbean cruise out of Miami. This was the 3rd time I'd stayed at the Mayfair. The first 2 stays happened about 5 years ago (July 2007) and I liked it enough to try it a 3rd time, even after reading a lot of bad reviews on the decline of the hotel. Let me just say that the hotel was in need of updating back in 2007, however, at the time, I found it to be fairly clean and enjoyable nonetheless and the prices were fair, given the wear. In my mind, the two main things this hotel has going for it is 1) location in beautiful Coconut Grove and next to CocoWalk. 2) private balconies with nice hot tub. Any other hotel with a in-room jacuzzi would cost considerably more and hotels in South Beach are also far more expensive. HOWEVER, Mayfair--you seriously need to update this hotel!! It doesn't even need a major overhaul--a fresh coat of paint, new accent pillows, bedspreads, and furniture cushions would do wonders AND your housekeeping staff need to take some time to do DEEP cleaning. Corners, highs and lows, and some freshening to reduce the high Florida humidity musty smell. The rooms are spacious, I've never had a problem with the cleanliness of the hot tub except to say that they charge for filling (that's fine--I can live with that) but if that's the case and we're staying 2 or more days, please ask if we want it re-filled the next day when it's cleaned!! I also love the bath products and the nice TV's but my main issues were the horrible musty smell, overall dirtiness in the "not so obvious" spots, and the general wear and tear of the room, including "rain" shower head which was so old and clogged that only half the holes were clear to spray. As much as I really was rooting for this hotel due in large part to the unique rooms and gorgeous atrium, I was disappointed and won't be back unless I hear they've updated. If they do that, I'd be back for sure. I did report the smell to the front desk and they were very attentive and sent housekeeping/maintenance to try to fix it but all they did was re-clean the floor. This did very little but I appreciated the effort. Offering me a different room might have made a bigger impression on me and would have made my stay a lot more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very tropical looking”
Reviews.Author: seekAdventures
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Mayfair Hotel & Spa in February 2012 for 3 nights. The room was very spacious and the bathroom as well. On the very private balcony they had a hottub/jacuzzi. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood. Right across from the hotel is Cocowalk shopping center. The hotel has a pool & bar on the roof terrasse which was very convenient. Breakfast was included with our corporate rate and it was served in the adjacent Italian restaurant (next to the lobby). It was served buffet style and had everything one needs. The hotel staff & restaurant staff was very friendly & polite. I loved the very tropical look / design of the hotel. Lots of neat detail to the architecture. I would definitely go and stay at this hotel again. The only downside was the noise level at night...I sleep with ear plugs, but I still could hear the music / karaoke singing(???) from a bar close by... I never really figured out where the music actually came from. (We stayed in room 440 - the Mallard Suite)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luis C
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute booking to this hotel and ended up being a pleasant surprise. Hotel is sort or like an old Hacienda, decorated with contemporary furniture, with nice corridors and a beautiful pool. Rooms were big and very well taken care of. Service was excellent and there are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area for night life.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs a little fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: Megustaviajar007
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair has a good location in Coconut Grove. Its staff is friendly and helpful. We had a leak in our bedroom toilet and it was promptly addressed. The mattress a bit soft in the middle and the bed linens were not too comfortable. Otherwise a big, clean, comfortable room. The woodwork in the corridors needs care, is somewhat run down as well as the inside of the elevator. Close to restaurants. Somewhat expensive if you consider it is not up to its best.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable! Great staff, location is good but stay close!”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist and choose to walk around at night ( or day) make certain you do not venture in the wrong direction. The grove is next to a very high crime neighborhood. Othe than that- the hotel is nice, I liked my room,not anything to rave about but clean and well appointed... the hotel has a rooftop pool which also has a bar. Very nice! The grove has a ton of places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but...”
Reviews.Author: FloatsomeJetsome
Reviews.Content: It is not a new hotel. The elevator squeaks a bit. There is a little wear and tear here and there but the rooms are large and the interior spaces are beautiful. The roof top pool and bar is great and the location right in the middle of The Grove. We price lined into our room at an amazing price. It was a real value. Even at the published rates I'd be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to hold small to medium size conferences”
Reviews.Author: Mayabue
Reviews.Content: The environment is out of this world, with a very organic Gaudi-esque arquitecture and vegetation inside. They have a large ballroom with plenty of natural light to accommodate any type of conference format. They also have smaller conference rooms and a beautiful atrium where you can hold receptions, meals, etc... The staff was very friendly and helpful and ensured that all details, from setting to catering to AV equipment, of our workshop were looked after. Everything turned out very smoothly and well. I

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag: Mostly bad.”
Reviews.Author: Chelseaguy68
Reviews.Content: I felt I had to review this hotel as it has gotten so many positive reviews and I really don't understand why after having stayed here for 5 nights. The entire hotel feels dated and the architecture and design is just strange. I couldn't tell if it was going for a caribbean feel, an Incan fortress, or a Turkish prison. Let's start with the rooms: The rooms, while enormous suites, are designed with angles that make the rooms feel totally disconnected. The biggest problem for me was that the rooms were very long and narrow and at the end of the room was a balcony that was covered in lattice and vegetation. This results in the rooms having absolutely no direct sunlight and zero view. Who wants to look out of a long, narrow space into a view that look like bars of a prison. Just awful. Secondly, while the balconies are big with a sofa and a private Japanese soaking tub, the tub looked like it was last used in the 1960s, and who wants to sit on a balcony and look out at nothing? To be fair, the rooms themselves did have a lot of great amenities such as a flat screen in the bathroom, a fully stocked bar, and tons of closet and drawer space for clothes. The Property Grounds: The hotel itself is built with a big open air courtyard, but because of the odd design there are not many places to sit and enjoy it. The glass elevators are definitely in need of repair and redesign as is the whole tired property itself. The restaurant was just okay. The breakfast was not bad, but in order to get back to the rooms from the tiny gym you had to walk through the restaurant, so as you are dining you get to enjoy a parade of sweaty guests in their work out gear. Not pleasant and again speaks to the odd design of the place. The rooftop pool space is amazing. Without question, the best aspect of this hotel, but not nearly enough for me to recommend that anyone stay here. With cabanas, a bar, a good sized pool, this space is really great. Unfortunately, I was here on business and it rained every day so I could only enjoy it for a few hours the day I left. The spa is also a plus. I got a fantastic massage and the relaxation area and changing rooms are very nice. Service: Service was sort of a mixed bag as well. Not many smiles and a fair amount of attitude among on the front desk staff and some of the valets. That being said, the waiters were very nice, but in general, not the level of service you'd expect for a hotel at this price point. Location: The location was good for Coconut Grove, if you want to be across the street from Coco Walk. However, It was quite loud both at night and in the early morning with trucks. Oh, one last thing. The Wireless connection was terrible. So slow I could barely use it and it often didn't work at all. The excuse: it was raining. Really?! All in all, I'd say don't waste your money here and stay at a different hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: infl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in January 2012. The actual room was very large clean and nicely decorated (rm 526). We didn't have any problems with noise. The rooftop bar was attractive, but slow. We enjoyed the hot tub in the room so bring your bikini! Yes, it looks old but it was fun! Calling for ice was annoying, but thanks to Tripadvisor we planned around it. Internet connection was poor, but again thanks to Tripadvisor we brought our own wireless router. The gym was tiny and poorly equipped so we paid for a few days at Shaqs 24 fitness gym with was a very short walk across the street. Cocowalk seems to be dying out, but we are in our late 30's so we didn't miss the party crowd. I'm pretty picky and I was impressed with the Mayfair. The trip was business, but we threw in some pleasure! I wouldn't stay here on vacation because I'm a beach girl, but in my opinion it's a safe place to stay. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hot spot? maybe in a distant past”
Reviews.Author: LC2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mayfair hotel for a few days for a conference. It is old hotel but it does not have that charm that some old hotels carry. It was rehabbed but rooms had a horrible smell due to humidity. You can hear everything that happens in a corridor. Service is not consistent. On a positive note, mattress was comfortable. There are better options in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel that went above and beyond my expections!”
Reviews.Author: lauren s
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair Hotel in Coconut Grove won me over all again after I had dinner there the other evening. I had a wonderful meal with my husband, and ended up leaving my Louis Vuitton handbag with 3 US passports and $2,000.00 in cash on the back of my chair. The worst part was I didn't realize it till the next day and I called the hotel in a panic. I was so impressed!!! The had my purse with all of the contents at the front desk! I was incredibly impressed with the manager and the way she handled the situation. I think Mayfair is a wonderful spot with a residential feel that is within walking distance of all you would want to do in Coconut Grove! The rooms are spacious and The Mayfair Coconut Grove will always be Five Stars in my book!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star rating is a joke!”
Reviews.Author: legate68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated 4 star and that is the reason I chose to stay here. It was so outdated, loud and overpriced. Next time I'll stay at The Sofitel or The Doubletree. This hotel is also a $40 cab ride one way to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, posh hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ripplebear
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms and the clean them twice daily.spartico restaurant and the rooftop bar had nice drinks and pizza. I also received free drinks while staying. Juralique spa was great. The steam room was super steamy. Love the atrium. Beds are very comfy. My only complaint is that the Japanese soaking tub only had one jet that worked. However we spoke to management and were not charged. All the staff with whom I interacted were friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Franco53703
Reviews.Content: This architectural gem is discretely located in Coconut Grove, right behind the popular (and much improved) Coco Walk shops and restaurants. We did not use their well-known spa facilities, which many guests certainly come for, but we can say that every aspect of our stay was pleasing; in fact, we'd want to make this our hotel in the Miami area if we could. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, the restaurant is very good, and the rooms are extremely comfortable, quiet, and relaxing. The bathrooms are unlike any others I have seen--worthy of a five-star rating. Unfortunately, some Tripadvisor reviews have given this hotel a low rating because of problems they've had with vouchers for the spa. But I don't think it is fair to rate this high-quality establishment for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience for wedding”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair hotel is a beautiful and charming property which is why I had my family and friends stay here for my wedding in Coconut Grove. Unfortunately, that was a terrible mistake. I wrote a letter to the general manager and will summarize my points below: Front desk staff extraordinairly rude and did not speak English well ( I live in Miami so I am used to the local culture); not only rude but extremely disorganized and lazy Room service-food was cold and staff did not speak English to understand request for ketchup and Perrier Housekeeping-if you want to sleep in, this is not the place. The noise travels on the marble floors and the housekeeping staff are extremely loud in the hallways in the morning. Additionally, I requested extra towels the day of my wedding. I had to ask 3 times and it took 3 hours. The rooms are large, nice and clean but the hot tub on balconly did not work and they could not fix promptly. Overall, the customer service was so poor at this property. I travel over 50% of the time for business and have never experienced such poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: N L
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mayfair for our ceremony, wedding reception and hotel stay after the reception. The food was amazing - much better than typical reception food (even at nicer venues). The team that set up the ceremony site and reception room did a great job. Everything was taken care of and done right the first time and without the need for correcting anything. I was being charged much more at other venues for much lower quality service and no-name brand liquor. Very highly recommended for wedding ceremony and reception - especially if you are looking for something that doesn't look like the typical, boring white reception room.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Randi K
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels more European than American and you definitely know you are not in the usual chain hotel. Beautiful tilework is everywhere and the entire hotel feels exotic. The room was large and the bathroom had a great sunken tub. The location was fantastic -- just across the street from Cheesecake Factory, Starbucks, etc. as well as local cafes and clubs. It was great mix of urban neighborhood meets chic boutique hotel. We would definitely recommend and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lrosa99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, pre-cruise. Hotel was modern and nicely decorated. Location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Count on having a great experience”
Reviews.Author: econometricsquant
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Mayfair a couple of times now. It is an "off the map" gem in Miami. Particularly during the holiday season, Miami hotel room prices get nutty. The Mayfair is a great value for this time of year. No, it's not in glitzy downtown, but Coconut Grove gives you that feeling that you're still around the big shots of Miami - even though they've all aged, ha! The location is excellent, as the Coco Walk right across the street has everything you want from Starbucks to Cheesecake Factory to shopping to more local, hip dining joints. The service is top notch and even the restaurant and bar inside the hotel offers great food and drinks. My favorite part is the open air setting. As soon as you walk out of your room, you're surrounded by the lush South Florida fauna in the hotel courtyards and atriums. This really is a charming place. Rooms are very spacious and very modern. The bathrooms are very roomy and well appointed. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Experience for daughters wedding was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jdknj
Reviews.Content: Many movies have been made, many stories written, many TV shows produced about the hoorors of preparing for a wedding and the problems of the event iteself. Our daughter was married at the beautiful mayfair Hotel and Spa in Coconut Grove and the experience we had was out of this world. Everything went off perfectly...it was a night to remember! We attribute the success to lots of hard work by the management and staff who went out of their way to ensure the event went as planned. We cannot thank them enough and we would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone for future weddings or special events

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, comfy & huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel608
Reviews.Content: First impression when walking into this hotel: "What is the funky theme in this place??" For real, you will be asking the same question. I still did not figure it out, possibly a Frank Lloyd Wright type of thing(Straight edges, darker wood fixtures etc. Other People said Raiders of the Lost Ark, lol. First impression when walking into our hotel room: OMG this room is HUGE. Living room with wicker furniture, flat screen tv and 4 person dining table. Then I walk into the bedroom, it is like an L shaped room with a hot tub, bathroom, and bedroom, smaller closet with fridge, and a dresser. Both the Bedroom and Bathroom had flatscreen televisions. Everything was very white in the room. This hotel is a little bit dated, but it's not bad at all. You can tell by the type of tile used. The fixtures, and the outside hallways, and the wood fixture on the wall. They make it comfy for you though by supplying bathrobes and slippers bc it's all tile. This place is also pet friendly and you pay a $50 fee. That includes a dog bed, food and water dish, and dog biscuits. Another nice touch. Service was great for the front desk, the concierge, and valet parking. They answered our questions correctly, took care of making sure our tv worked, we had extra towels, and they brought our luggage downstairs and brought our car to us each time. How sweet, treated like kings and queens. This hotel is in walking distance of some side walk cafes and boutiques and a small mall with a few stores, most importantly starbucks. It is a nice walk when you have a dog bc they have a walking trail by water and a nice park. If you want to go to South Beach, or chill on the beach by Key Biscayne it's like 15-25 minutes so make sure you have a car or you will not have much to do. We chilled at their roof top pool pretty cool, nice temperature and comfy chairs, pool bar, but it just closed too early, at dusk. The front desk suggested Jaguar restaurant to us as a place to go for dinner. We did that, and it was very good, nice modern and pet friendly. Check this place out for a stop going to the keys, or a little weekend getaway. It will be relaxing and nice. Just keep in mind just bc it is dated doesn't mean it's not great. It was nice, clean, and most people there were efficient, respectful, and helpful. The reason I placed this hotel as average instead of very good is bc the cleaning people had thrown out one of my Xmas gift bags. It had some small xmas presents in there, but not too valuable so I did not want to make a huge deal of it, but watch your stuff. The second reason is bc I was using my $20 credit for the hotel restaurant. This was included in my groupon getaways package - suite, free valet parking and $20 credit for the hotel restaurant. One of the managers failed to read my certificate and said that it was expired. After that, he retracted it, but did not apologize. Other than that, the experience was fine, but not extraordinary or memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Comfortable with Wonderful Ambience”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent for American Express and had not been to Florida before. This hotel was recommended to me by another travel agent, so I booked several rooms for myself and my family over the holidays. We all loved the hotel, which was something special. Looks Mayan, but was built in the 80's. The rooms are large and comfortable. Every one of the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Carmen, the Chief Concierge, found a wonderful car service, which we had take us around to some of the various attractions. The location is close to everything. If you want a special experience, in the Miami Beach area, stay here. Thanks, Anne, VIP Travel Counselor

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic locale.....”
Reviews.Author: jmorg8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayfair for a night during the holidays, for a wedding. The location is superb, centrally located within Coconut Grove and easy to catch a cab to head out to outside attractions. The rooftop pool is great, with cabanas, bar and fireplace, with a cozy seating area. The restaurant downstairs has a happy hour with 1/2 price apps-tried several of them and they were very tasty! Rooms were nicely-sized, with a patio & private hot tub. Bathroom was not so clean and the floors needed a hard scrub-my feet were dirty just from walking around the room. Bed was comfy and no noise from the outside, which was nice. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PaulMcD
Reviews.Content: Really nice, big room with a tv in the bathroom and a jacuzzi on the balcony. DO NOT get a room near the pool, loud music until late.

Reviews.Title: “I would visit Mayfair over and over again.”
Reviews.Author: Gajalbar G
Reviews.Content: Pros: If you like nature-inspired ambiances, I would highly recommend Mayfair. The design of the hotel is creative and romantic. The hotel room was spacious, well-furnished, and groomed. The hotel's location in Coconut Grove is safe and ideal for casual walks. The staff is very friendly. Cons: The view from the hotel is nothing special. If you plan to go to South Beach, the cab ride will cost you $20-30.

Reviews.Title: “Something amiss at The Mayfair.”
Reviews.Author: Ben T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently picked The Mayfair Hotel and Spa as a romantic getaway, close enough to the attractions of Miami Beach yet some distance from the nightly action the area is famous for. Having visited Coconut Grove a few years before, this seemed a well located spot to further explore the beaches and amentities of this popular South Florida destination. We were very disappointed in the service that The Mayfair provided and the seemingly indifference of the management team to see to the needs of all their guests. In contrast the attitudes and the responsiveness of staff working the 'shop floor' from bar staff, cleaning staff, pool attendants and concierges were exemplary. They could not be more helpful. The major problem with this property is its uncomfortable split between being a boutique hotel and/or events and conference centre. The two do not mix well and often the needs of the regular paying guests are overlooked or ignored in the rush to secure the corporate buck. There is a noise factor from the events in the internal courtyard and conference rooms and the rooftop pool and patio is frequently made unavailable due to some corporate sponsored event. Management did not make any concession or apology to the disturbed or displaced guests who booked their stay at the hotel hoping for a peaceful and intimate getaway. The hotel is also in need of a serious makeover as parts are looking quite shabby. We would not recommend this property for anyone seeking an enjoyable stay in this area. There are at least two properties close by which would offer a much better service and in more comfortable surroundings. The water-cooler talk is that the Mayfair is about to undergo a change of ownership . This might explain some of the inconsistencies in service found there. If this the case I would hope the new managers will restore a quality of stay for all levels of guest on the property. Repeat business is the key to staying successful in this industry. We will not return to The Mayfair until it finds what it is sorely missing, overall respect and a quality and consistency of service.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Raymond N
Reviews.Content: Upscale, spacious well appointed rooms, clean, very pleasant staff, enjoyed Spartico, cool rooftop pool and bar. In the heart of Coconut Grove close to local shops and dining. Returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venue!”
Reviews.Author: Barry J
Reviews.Content: The Greater Miami Chamber of Commerce hosted its Holiday Reception for our premium members at the Mayfair Hotel & Spa on the roof top pool area. What a fabulous venue, combined with warm and attentive hospitality by hotel staff. It's a unique, classic Miami location that can't be compared to typical hotels. A very special place and certainly should be on your list for hotels to visit and to host events. Barry E. Johnson President/CEO Greater Miami Chamber of Commerce

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tenis M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means a 4 star hotel. Though in the Miami vicinity there is no access to the beach only access to Coco Walk which is a rundown mall that has seen its glorious era at the end of 90's. Coconut Grove is a residential area so there is not much you can do there so plan to have or rent a car. The hotel was decent, fairly clean room and bathroom but old amenities (the TV remote was broken and the battery compartment had a scotch tape to hold the batteries). The service was ok-ish - overall I would say this is a 3 star hotel that deserves no more than 100/night dollars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with below average employees”
Reviews.Author: Veronica H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with husband and daughter. The girl at check-in was cold and unfriendly and almost brushed me off when I asked her some questions. I had the misfortune of meeting her again at Reception the next morning and the aloof, indifferent attitude was there again when I asked for directions. We also had difficulty getting help with booking a shuttle and had to do it ourselves after we were incorrectly told 'there is no shuttle to Cocoa Beach'. A quick search on the internet found Florida Shuttle (and they were another drama!) who accpet online and phone bookings. Apart from the great dining in CocoWalk, there is not much in this part of Miami and it's impossible to get around without a car. We spent a fortune on taxis as nothing of interest to us was within walking distance. Got room at great price through Hotwire, but I wish I had paid more and stayed in South Beach area. As for the Hotel itself, the room was a good size with comfortable beds and ample storage. The balcony, albeit roomy and private could do with a good clean and upgrade of the lounge chair. The bathroom was lovely as was the rooftop pool area and bar staff. The lifts are old and sound like they're about to break down. All in all, this is not a 4 star property and I would not stay here or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyrigg
Reviews.Content: Balcony, hot tub, roof top pool all sounded great! This hotel is in a non descript area of Miami. The reception staff were unwelcoming to say the least. In about 1981 this was probably quite a funky hotel - its not now, but it was cheap. The entire decor is very tired. There was a lot of noise outside - glad I had ear plugs. Restaurant staff were friendly and room spacious.

Reviews.Title: “odd hotel in noisy location”
Reviews.Author: lydele t
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is old, quirky and does not deserve the four star rating. The internet does not work in the rooms, the balcony only looks at bamboo sticks and the hot tubs are from the 60's and they charge a "set-up" fee for you to be able to use them. The parking is exhorbitant, the soundproofing non-existent. The hotel is in the heart of Coconut Grove and if you plan to party until dawn then this is the place for you to come as the noise from the street will keep you awake until then and you won't be able to find anything open until 11:00am. Oh, yes, the bed is very comfortable but that is the only positive thing I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing wedding weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Annie Z
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Coconut Grove, Fl the first week of December and all our guests stayed at the Mayfair. When initially trying to block rooms we had a bit of a rocky start, however the General Manager, Bruce, was more than helpful, and in the end, the hotel, staff, and and overall experience completely exceeded our expectations. The hotel is beautiful and all our guests loved the open-air feel. In addition, all the rooms are suites, and we could not have asked for better amenities. The staff; from the cleaning crews, to the valet, to the culinary team that put together our rehearsal dinner on the rooftop, were all amazing and did everything they could to make our time stayed there unforgettable. My mom loved the hotel so much, she has already re-booked for February when she will come to visit! Thank you Bruce and the rest of your staff for all your help!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: ER1108
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately only stayed here for one night on our way to Miami Beach. We arrived without a reservation and when we asked for the room rate at first it was a bit too expensive for us, also because we arrived quite late in the afternoon and wanted to leave early in the morning again. The lady at check in was really friendly and gave us a 30 USD discount on the room rate! We had a standard room which was just great! A huge bathroom (with TV), a huge patio with a Japanese bathtub. Unfortunately our time schedule did not allow us to use it. We had a short swim in the pool which is on the roof top of the hotel and has a splendid view. The atmosphere up there is just amazing with a bar, lounge and a chimney. Very nice indeed! The hotel in general is very beautiful and has an Asian touch to it. Location is good as it's just opposite a shopping mall and there are many restaurants around. We had breakfast in the hotel which was good but I would not eat there again as it was simply too expensive. For parking overnight they charged 28 USD. All in all, I wish we could have stayed longer as the hotel is very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: Pvazz824
Reviews.Content: I held my daughter's wedding reception at the Mayfair a few weeks ago and the overall experience was excellent. From my first meeting with the catering director I knew I was going to like this place. She was very accommodating and helpful, she worked with me and my budget to where everybody was happy (and I didn't have to serve chicken), and she even suggested a florist that was exactly what we were looking for (after having met with 4 others that just didn't get what we wanted). The food at the reception was EXCELLENT, I received many, many comments from our guests about how they "had never had such amazing food at a wedding reception." The architecture and interior designs of the hotel are beautiful, the chandelier in the ballroom is exquisite and from what I've heard from our out-of-town guests, the rooms were very nice as well. During the reception, the catering manager was there (almost by my side) the whole time and anything I needed he'd make it happen instantly. The whole staff was very accommodating and pleasant ... right down to the the parking attendants. Also, the fact that it's located in the middle of Coconut Grove was also a plus to our out-of-towners. I've been to the Spa on a previous occasion and I also loved that experience. Again, the staff is extremely pleasant, professional and accommodating, they were able to squeeze me in for a pedicure and I did not have a previous appointment. I highly recommend the Mayfair Hotel and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cdblues
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Mayfair Hotel before... It is like we remember. Very romantic, you walk everywhere. We got the Florida package that include the Hot tub set up, parking, and breakfast. All for under $200. Yes the rooms are starting to show age, and the sliding glass doors were really hard to open. We could of changed rooms, but were already settled and did not want to pack up again. This is definately a romantic get away for couples, not so much for kids. We had an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base Camp for Exploring Coconut Grove!”
Reviews.Author: aicwebmaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mayfair for two evenings this past weekend to attend a wedding. We were quite taken by the Gaudi-esque architecture and the fact that they offered suites with Japanese soaking tubs. We stayed in the Periwinkle Suite - space was more than adequate, bathroom was quite spacious with marble throughout. All necessary items were available in the room, 42" flat screen with DVD player, coffeemaker, ironing board and mini fridge. Balcony was also a nice size, though it's time to replace the lounging bench. Jets in soaking tub were basically useless but the temperature was nice in contrast to the cool December evening. Dinner at Spartico Saturday evening was fine though there are definitely better choices just outside the hotel which is across the street from Coco Walk. If you're there on the weekend, the buffet breakfast at Spartico will satisfy most. Rooftop pool deck affords spectacular views of Biscayne Bay and the bartender was great! We found the staff to be friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable - no complaints! For some reason many of the better hotels and resorts in Coconut Grove seem to be hoarding ice! While I do enjoy being waited on hand and foot, I really have no problem leaving my suite walking a 100 yards and filling my own ice bucket when I need ice!!! It seems to me a waste of time to have hotel employees wasting time fetching ice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel NOT So Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: janice282
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel - beautiful and clean. But the staffs weren't so friendly nor helpful. Housekeeping didn't even replace our used up toiletries and when I needed to get a ginger ale for my husband in the middle of the night b/c he wasn't feeling well they just said there is no vending machine and nowhere to get it. Didn't try at all to be a bit helpful, the answer was simple no. Other than that, loved the Cocowalk which is right in front of the hotel with a movie theater and some shops and restaurants and it was about 30min drive to South Beach area. Their pool area is really nice with lounging area and a bar (all on the rooftop). The balcony with jacuzzi is wonderful - there is $30 charge if you actually want to use the jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but for the parking rates”
Reviews.Author: meyerinsac
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline and expected sub-par treatment because of that. I was wrong about that. The room was excellent and even had a hot tub in the balcony. We did not use it as it has a 30$ activation fee. The service was very good as well. The hotel is supposedly over a hundred years old but still looked very beautiful. The hotel has a restaurant which looked good as well but we didn't get an opportunity to eat there. The only downside would be the parking which is almost 40$ for an overnight stay. I would recommend parking at the parking garage opposite as it is 17$ for an overnight stay. For a shorter period though the parking at the hotel is much cheaper. I would highly recommed it, if you are willing to pay extra for the parking

Reviews.Title: “The Good the Bad and the Noisy”
Reviews.Author: katherineincanada
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline, , which I will not do again. After emailing the hotel twice and not receiving replies, my husband phoned them about our room preferences. At check-in, they informed us that we could not have a fridge, or ensure us a quiet room. Not a good start. Eventually, the concierge, Carmen, found our emails and assigned us a room with a fridge. This is a 1930's era hotel, with interesting architecture and a great location. The rooms are large and the bathroom is very large and has tub and shower. However, this is not a 4* room. It needs to be updated (floors, doors, furniture) before it could be classified as 4*. The house keeping team kept it clean and it was always ready upon our arrival. There are three major issues at this hotel. The first is the extremely poor and unprofessional attitude of the management, who were never in evidence, unless they were arranging an event. The second issue the pool. There were multiple events every day of our stay at this property and many of them took place at the pool. Therefore the management closed the pool for 5 of the 7 days we were there. We were never told of these pool closings ahead of time,(as extremely poor communication is the rule here). We would arrive at the pool and a sign would be posted saying-"Event today. Pool closed. Thank-you for your patience." On the last two days of our holiday, the sign said "Pool closed for repair November 21 & 22 for repairs. By this point, we had had enough. We contacted the concierge, Ignacio,(who was professional and helpful) and asked him to arrange for us to use another pool. This took about an hour and required a letter from the manager, Gloria, which allowed us to use the pool at the Sonesta,(a superb hotel). Never have I worked so hard on a holiday, just to go swimming. On the two days when their pool was open to guests, we endured loud voices of the people planning their events for the next day. After that, there was a 2 hour photo shoots in the pool. On our last morning, we listened to a worker repairing the bar with an electric sander. The pool attendant had not been informed of this work, either and the bar staff arrived to an empty bar. The third issue here is noise. Some of the events here took place in the inner inside courtyard below the rooms. Many were loud and one (a dog fashion show-only in Miami), lasted until midnight. This is a very noisy hotel. There is also street noise from the clubs on the streets below. The one good thing here is the young staff who work so hard to please guests. We appreciate and want to compliment Ignacio, the concierge, Aaron, the superb bar-tender at the pool,(who is from New Orleans and made us beignets at home adnd delivered them to us,Raul, the professional and polite pool attendant, Nicole, another delightful pool bartender and Alexa, who to helped us at the when we mentioned the noise. These people work very hard we appreciated them. As for Juan, the pool supervisor, who ignored me and fobbed me off to a young server, when I was concerned about the noise,he was rude, ambivalent,and should not work with people. This hotel is not a hotel. It is an event centre, where guests are a mere frill and have no rights or priviledges. Avoid this property at all cost. We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: mikokittykat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 10 yr wedding anniversary. We also stayed here for our wedding night. We told the front desk prior to our arrival and they gave us a free upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite. The room was wonderful and the bathtub/jacuzzi was awesome. The rooftop pool and bar were great to lounge at. Quiet and private. My only complaint was the bed in the suite. It was not as comfortable as I would expect for a suite. Other than that, the location and hotel were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair Fun”
Reviews.Author: Yankeeteacher
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even the driver for the hotel was sweet and kind as he drove me back to the airport. Food was very good. Bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. When I called housekeeping, they came up to my room immediately. It is right across the street from Coco Walk with lots of trendy shops and restaurants like Cheesecake Factory and Starbuck's. It was nice to take daily strolls around a safe area. I would go back to the Mayfair in a New York minute. I also treated 2 friends to the spa and they both said it was unbelievably excellent. The best massage ever!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Clinton C
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. I purchased a Travelzoo voucher for my wife for her anniversary that was supposed to include lunch and a day pass to the pool. I booked the appointment 6 months prior. I spoke to the spa the day prior to ensure everything was in order. We drove all the way down from West Palm Beach (2 hours). When we arrived we were informed that the pool was closed for a private party. I was told by the manager on duty to phone the general manager, Belkis Espinoza, and she would do something in lieu for for my wife. However, when I spoke to Belkis Espinoza she refused to do anything.

Reviews.Title: “Needs TLC it must have been a very cool spot and really has potenial”
Reviews.Author: HomerLucy
Reviews.Content: Great location in grove, awesome pool,when open! Stayed thursday until Sunday and the pool was closed Thursday afternoon into evening and Saturday from 2 pm till late in the evening for private parties. not happy , when you book a hotel that highlights their rooftop pool you do want to have it open.lots of unhappy guests. Rooms were ok,soaking tub was dirty /old.deck furniture was torn.would not go back!

Reviews.Title: “park at Garage 8”
Reviews.Author: BROOKSTER69
Reviews.Content: Park at Garage 8 2850 Oak AVE and save yourself cash I spoke to locals and thats where they park.

Reviews.Title: “Great to have a corporate event”
Reviews.Author: aj s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to have corporate event. Management is very flexible and accomodative. The food was excellent and every guest that stay ed was very happy about their rooms, especially the suites. The northerners that flew in loved that fact that the ballrooms open into the courtyard, it is not every day that New Yorkers or Chicagoans get to experience sun and palm tree during the middle of a corporate event. It is also a great location for entertaining clients as there are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual and cool!”
Reviews.Author: dkoenemann
Reviews.Content: The decor at this hotel was interesting and our room was sweet with a large tub/shower, separate toilet area, comfy furniture and private balcony with a Japanese soaking tub. Good value...unfortunately, we were there over Halloween and Miami does.love.those Halloween parties! It was so loud all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items, disgusting room”
Reviews.Author: saira2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel several weeks ago. Although listed as a 4 star its a very out dated hotel. Our bed had dirt marks & hair on it, the toilet was left unflushed and the cups had been unwashed. we called front desk and they sent house cleaning after 30 minutes to clean it up. We requested to change rooms as we are a family of 4 (2 children under 2) and 2 adults and need two beds in the room and they gave us a room with one queen size bed which was very difficult for us 4 to sleep in. The new room we moved into was cleaner although floors looked as if they were never mopped as kids ended up with black soot on the base. After we left we realised we left or stolen (who knows) several items including a video camera. I emailed the hotel and NEVER received a response. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: RafaelGCPP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mayfair between Oct 18 and Oct 25. The hotel is beautiful, very well located, and although they had a party on the pool on a Saturday night, the room isolation was good enough for the noise not to bother us. All the hotel employees were extremely nice and polite. The hotel was selected via Priceline.com, so the rates were amazing. The cons: 1) Wifi access was only possible in one small area of the lobby. Anywhere else, including rooms, it did not work. Nothing to do with signal strength, but some weird configuration on the routers would not the devices acquire IP addresses. 2) The room was clean, but not pristine. The room smelled like mold mixed with some kind of benzene based cleaner. It was worse when the A/C was off. 3) The disappearing towels: on one day we did a round-trip to Disney's Epcot and back (4h each way!). Arriving around 11:30PM, we found out that we had only ONE bath towel for us two!! As a result I had to use my wife's wet towel to dry myself... The next day, we found two bath towels, but now, no hand towels... 4) No ice machines, so you cannot bring your own beverage without having to call room service for ice. 5) The cherry on top: a false fire alarm woke us up around midnight Oct 19th. After 16h of flight, we were exhausted, and had to wake up in the middle of the night to abandon our room. After it became clear it was a false alarm, we went back to our room, to be awaken again, fifteen minutes later by another false alarm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Weird style, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: mencos1
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline's name your own price which usually gets me amazing hotels at deep discounts, in the lines of Westins, Sheratons, Hyatts, etc. I visited their website before my trip and was very excited as it seemed to be a very luxurious upscale place. The lobby area while very small is pleasant and did live up to what I saw on the website, very minimalistic and modern, although the entrance door is carved wood with a very intricate design of a mermaid or something similar. The second experience was the elevator - dated, old, smelled and I felt I was going to get stuck in it. Then the corridor to the room, with wooden inlays on the walls reminded me of a swiss chalet and the open-court layout with stone carvings reminded me of a Maya-inspired beach hotel in Cancun. Then the room was minimalist again, huge, seemed plain and the sheets, towels and cushions on the living room were torn, old and looked dirty. Another oddity was that the coffee maker and dryer were in the bathroom... but there was absolutely no power outlet in the whole bathroom, except behind the TV which has hanging high on the wall so it wouldn't work anyways (I even looked behind the toilet for an outlet). On my last morning I saw what I thought was a mosquito on a pillow but it was a tick, so I killed it, packed and left. Another thing is that the housekeeping staff had no idea about check-outs, they woke me up every single day to ask if I was leaving that day! I think this hotel has had a couple of owners who have changed the style and it's now a horrible mix of styles. GOOD THINGS: great location, friendly staff. I let Priceline know of my experience so that they take them off the 4* category list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Looking Hotel but many design faults”
Reviews.Author: Sunpillar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great looking and gorgeous. Personal hot tab for each room. But there are many design faults. I have to get in to bath tab to fill the hot water. The closet cannot open completely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Amatos391
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is very well located in the heart of Coconut Walk in Coconut Grove. It is an old hotel but with very beautiful details and spaces. It is walking distance from many shops and restaurants. If you have a car, they do have parking for a daily fee of $26. The rooms are spacious and do not have rugs so everything that happens in the floors above, you can hear. It is the noisiest hotel we have ever stayed in. We called security in many occasions because they had a party, a big party next room. They did nothing, they even told us they have private condo rentals and they did not have any control over those rooms. Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Property a little tired”
Reviews.Author: wmn9
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here. The location is right next to Cocowalk, in the heart of Coconut Grove. The roof bar is very nice, with a little pool. The room was a bit plain and a little tired. Reminded me of a few rooms I stayed in India, and Far East. If you go ask for a room that doesn't over look Cocowalk, because it stays loud and busy late. We upgraded to the Japanase Soaking Tub. It was a little small for two. The jets didnt work.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnificent Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is one of the most beautiful hotels in Miami. It is located in Coconut Grove and has many shops and things to do within walking distance. We held a meeting there and my team was very pleased with their rooms and the catered food was delicious. What was especially nice is that when you walk around the hotel, you almost forget you are in a hotel because the environment is so exotic. The sound of rushing water from the Asian Garden and all the bamboo and plants puts you in a different frame of mind. The staff there was also very helpful, pleasant, accomodating, professional and dealt with any last minute requests in a timely fashion. The only thing that would improve the hotel would be for them to have a dedicated airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: Gloria M
Reviews.Content: I just returned tonight from a 6 day stay at the Mayfair. I had a business meeting there but was so impressed I stayed a few extra days. I found every member of the staff, from bell men, housekeeping, bartenders, servers, concierge, to be very sincere in making my stay pleasurable. The food, although limited, was very good but there are so many other choices a short walk away. My wife and I agreed that we can't wait to return. Make sure to enjoy the rooftop pool/bar and the pizza and pasta at Spartica.

Reviews.Title: “The Mayfair: Simply The Best Hotel In Miami”
Reviews.Author: KeysTripHolidayIsle
Reviews.Content: Recently, I had my 25th High School Reunion in South Florida. My best friend came down with his family. Atfer the reunion, we decided to spend some time in Miami. We selected the Mayfair. Words can't express how happy we were with this choice. Our wives were stunned by the 'Uber-Cool' Decor. You truly feel as if you are in a movie. The interior combines cutting-edge design with class. Very tasteful, yet exciting. The rooms were luxurious. The bathrooms were spacious. Best of all, our rooms each had a jacuzzi on the balcony, which overlooked the tropical atriu. it gave the appearance of bathing in a rain forest. Next, the Mayfair's pool is located on the roof. It overlooks both the Miami Sky-Line and the water. To call it exotic and cool is an understatement. White Bungalo tents suround the pool with comfortable couches. A DJ plays cool music, and the drinks are cold. Once again, you are left with the feeling that you are the star of an episode of "Miami Vice." Finally, the staff were helpful, and the food is delicious. If you want a romantic, exciting get-away that encompasses the best Miami has to offer, the Mayfair is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LAMitchell
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel. Staff were very friendly, pool area is great and the rooms were good. We had the Japanese tub in the room filled and it was brilliant. The hotel is directly opposite the Coconut Walk shops and is beside all the boutique shops, bars and restaurants in the area and is within a 10 min walk of the marina.

Reviews.Title: “The Mayfair - a gem in the Grove!”
Reviews.Author: TheBot77
Reviews.Content: Just had one night at this lovely hotel and loved every short minute. The service is super efficient and staff really helpful, knowledgeable and friendly - but in the right amount of each and not overbearing. The room that we had was HUGE - so big in fact that I think the bathroom was bigger than my whole appartment! Very well appointed, clean and spacious. The hotel seems to be heavy on the design side of things if you like that and feels really comfortable as you wander around. We even had a hot-tub on the terrace!!! From what we experienced the hotel is quiet without overbearing music or noise. Roof-top pool is lovely and suspect that it's a bit of a "cool kid" haven at the weekend or holiday time - but that's not a bad thing as it looks very chic and you get some great service at the bar matched only by the view. Didn't eat there or use any business facilities - but imagine they are all above par. Location we thought was good with easy access to The Grove and Coral Gables with some really nice restaurants and bars very close by. In terms of constructive feedback - not really that much to write about. Maybe the location isn't great for the beaches and the hotel a bit "corporate" but that's picking at things. It's a great location, great hotel and well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Plan an Event at the Mayfair - Be Overwhelmed with Service!”
Reviews.Author: sally l
Reviews.Content: We held a Couples Retreat at the Mayfair and our expectations were surpassed in every way. We were treated so courteously by all the staff helping plan the event. Christina Lewis was our main contact to get all of the details set and she made it a pleasure! Her professionalism with a smile was always present and our event was a success! The meeting rooms and the sleeping rooms were beautiful and the food was excellent. Thanks also to Manny and Jose who took care of us during the event. From beginning to end - this was a great place to host an event. Thank you Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel with so much personality! A must while in the area!”
Reviews.Author: quedeville
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, walking distance to Coco Walk, its shopping and restaurants. The hotel was built like a fortress with a gorgeous atrium and magnificent lush plants and tile fountains. The rooms were spacious with nice amenities and a marble bathroom. Our patio was covered with greeneries and had a hot tub. The hotel has aged very well and gave you a feel of being in the 60's in Havana. I loved everything about it! The rooftop pool bar is not to be missed for a gorgeous sunset with Cuba Libre! Be aware that it closes at 8:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not the Ritz, but definitely not the Holiday Inn either ...”
Reviews.Author: Dawkito20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair at the last minute due to a glitch in our travel schedule. We booked our room through Hotwire to get the best value. After traveling for days, the bed/shower was a welcome sight. We spent most of our time in the room and here's what we thought: * Room: Great value as far as space is concerned. The rooms are all technically suites. Our room included a bathroom (with soaking tub/shower combo), King-size bed, sitting area, outdoor lanai with Japanese soaking tub (we didn't use because it didn't look all that clean and cost $30 to have filled with water). * Bed: The hotel decorated the room with a ton of decorative pillows (which you immediately toss off the bed because they never get washed), but there were only two pillows! There was also one hidden in the closet. They were also standard size pillows --- not King-size. Seemed odd to me that they would skimp on their guests' comfort this way. There should have been six if using standard-size or four if using King-size. * Service: An ice bucket was provided in our room, leading us to believe an ice machine was around the corner. We walked the entire perimeter of our floor, not finding an ice machine anywhere (by the way, the architecture of the hotel is pretty neat ... Asian-inspired, most of the hotel is open to the outdoors). We called the front desk to ask where the machines are located. They informed us that there are no machines, but they would bring some up to our room (kinda defeats the purpose of the ice bucket!). After 45 minutes of waiting for our ice, we cancelled our order. No apologies were given by the staff --- pretty unacceptable. * Bathroom: While large, it didn't seem luxurious. It was like any other hotel bathroom. Towels were discolored and there weren't a lot of them. In fact, I think there were only two large towels per adult. We called housekeeping for more towels ... Luckily, they were more responsive than the front desk and we received them within 15 minutes. Despite the inconveniences we came across, it was a pleasant experience because we were beat from traveling. Would recommend it as a good place to go, but only if booking on Hotwire (or comparable site) and getting for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel in the Grove”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: The location next to the Coco Walk can not be beat for those who frequent Miami. While the initial impression may be that of an "older" hotel, the charm and overall experience are second to none in Miami. The staff and food were excellent and courteous. The rooms are spacious and built surrounding a beautiful open atrium with a rooftop pool and bar that have spectacular views! I also experienced the Spa and the massage was outstanding, quiet and professional! If you are visiting Miami, and not wanting the partying atmosphere of SouthBeach, you should consider this hotel as it is centrally located and easy to get around. Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “THE MAYFAIR HOTEL AND SPA WAS THE GREATEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: marianhite
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT! In every way possible from the time we drove up to the time we left. The hotel itself was simply gorgeous in their decor. The food in the restaurant was delicious and the waitstaff were so attentive to our every need. Our room was the best room I've ever stayed in. Two large bedrooms, two full baths, a living room w/ a huge flat screen tv, a nice table to eat at, a private patio w/ a Japanese soaking hot tub, and even a piano in our room! The rooftop pool and bar were also a lovely place to go and see the view. We had our own personal cabana also w/ a flat screen tv and comfortable couch and chairs. There are wonderful little shops and eating establishments right outside the door of the hotel, so there was no need to drive anyplace unless you wanted to. The front desk staff were more than accommodating and helpful. Everything was spotlessly clean and the bed mattress was very comfortable, All in all, this was by far the best experience I have ever had in a hotel. We loved it so much that we're going back next year and taking friends with us! Thanks to a fantastic staff at a fabulous hotel! Marian Burns and Ed Dolan, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bizyman
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I was a little nervous because the price was hard to beat, but took the chance. No regrets! The hotel was beautiful. Built around an open atrium courtyard. Older but well kept and clean. Great room, nice bath, clean and comfortable bed. The roof top pool/bar was a great place to hang out at sunset. Location couldn't be better. Tons of great little restaraunts, coffee shops, bars and even a movie theater within five minutes. A 24 hour fitness across the street if you like a "real" gym. Didn't have a car and didn't need one for my three day stay. This place is a real find in the Miami market. I'd take it over So Beach any day, unless you are strictly in town to hit the beach and party.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel and were very impressed by how beautiful the hotel was. Attention was paid to every single detail, and the soap and shampoo smelled so good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: dzuniga
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay with my girlfriend. The hot tub in the room was great. Location was wonderful as we did not have to drive any where and restaurants were great. Rooftop pool made us feel like celebrities. We are definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: ibskine
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Mayfair and it was fabulous. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly. We really enjoyed the hot tub. Even though you are right in the middle of town it is very private. We ordered room service one night and it was not up to expectation. The chicken parm sandwich was soggy and made with a processed chicken cutlet. However, the turkey club was outstanding. This trip we booked the 60 minute getaway package that included massages for us both at the spa. The spa was great - and the massage was the best I have ever had. The hotel is within walking distance to alot of restaurants as well as the Improv Comedy Club (which is worth checking out). We will definitely stay here again - especially since our pet is always welcome. Thanks Mayfair for a great mini vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fun Pool, Great Location, will be back”
Reviews.Author: hardballer26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for a Friday and Saturday night in Aug and had a blast. The rooms are very large and comfortable, all with a balcony. Large bathroom with 2 sinks and small tv. Excellent place to get ready as a couple. Very soft pillows (bring my own though), comfortable bed, quiet air conditioning. Pool was a plus and had a DJ playing house music, it was a lot of fun. Found it on a "no-name given" website for very cheap, it was an extreme value. It was an additional $100 to use the private seating next to the pool and $26 a day parking. Overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: gina s
Reviews.Content: nice hotel,we loved everything about it!! very elegant and the staff was amazing. we had a great time there ,the only downer was the jacuzzi was kind of old and broke down twice but must say that the guy who came to set it up was one of the coolest persons we meet at the place his name was hoolio or something like that..we are definitely going back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy pool with gorgeous view of coconut grove downtown and the waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: shannon33133
Reviews.Content: We don't own a pool so having the opportunity to visit the rooftop pool at mayfair through their limited program "Pool therapy" ha been wonderful during the hot summer months. It is a cozy pool with gorgeous view of coconut grove downtown and the waterfront! The pool staff has been very kind, helpful and professional. Raul helped me this weekend, and he did a pretty good job, making me and my family feel welcomed at the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it looked on Expedia”
Reviews.Author: frannisoph
Reviews.Content: Hotel quirky - great public areas but disappointing room and very uncomfortable beds. Swimming pool area was like a nightclub at 4pm - really really loud music that was constant and inappropriate at that time. It put us off and we left. I was really disappointed as the hotel bills itself as luxurious which it really wasn't. Our room was dark and gloomy and rather tired. Won't be back. Doral Golf Resort FAR, FAR better with far friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical hotel for business but works nicely”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: While most downtown hotels in Miami were either full or charging ridiculous prices in late January, my colleague and I decided to find a stay in the Mayfair in Coconut Grove. The hotel was a bit dated but had an exotic tropical appearance. It is situated in a nice, lively neighborhood and just a few steps from the Coco Walk which had some restaurants and shops. My king bed room was large (big bathroom with TV) and I think every room like mine has a small terrace with a spa tub which I just didn't have time to enjoy. The hotel is about 15 min drive from downtown Brickell so it's not that really far from business. A good alternative for those business travellers who don't want to spend too much on the downtown luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tired ,Needs some TLC not a 4 star at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: epc2
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair was a good hotel in the 80's but it needs some TLC , Air conditioner was noisy , old furniture , dark rooms ,stained sheets. I've stayed at 3 star hotels that are way better than this one , IMHO this is not a 4 star hotel at all more like a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “We had a comfortable stay... great service!”
Reviews.Author: iglebar
Reviews.Content: Our business stay was very convenient. The hotel is located in a fun part of town and the service we were provided with was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Can't Wait to Go Back.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler33410
Reviews.Content: Do not miss out on this unique opportunity to experience the culture and history of Coconut Grove, while staying in this luxurious and elegant hotel. Everything was perfect. The rooms were spacious and inviting, the restaurant fantastic, and the rooftop pool and lounge area, with views of the bay, unforgettable. The service was equally amazing. We recently stayed at the Mayfair Hotel for the purpose of business, although over the weekend, and the experience exceeded our expectations. An added bonus was to discover restaurants, shopping, and other things to do within a block or two of the hotel. In addition to being located in Coconut Grove, the hotel is also a short distance from Coral Gables and 10 - 15 minutes from downtown Miami. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair a forgotten flower”
Reviews.Author: RoadHogCharlestonSC
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting at the Mayfair in Coconut Grove Fl. What a pleasant supprise. Not that I didn't expect a nice hotel but it was beautiful. Walking distance to may fine restaurants and watering holes. The interior is old school and just great. Many fine architechural details. Restaurant at the hotel is very good. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant week at the Mayfair.”
Reviews.Author: tenderloinmaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair in Coconut Grove, Florida for a week and enjoyed it all. The valet and bellmen were polite and efficient. The entrance door opens by motion sensors. I never once had to open the door manually. Front desk personal were polite and check in was quick. My bags were delivered to my room and shirts were hung up. The room was very clean, everything worked fine, a.c. quiet and cool. I used the pool area almost each day the water was refreshing and the pool staff would bring around lemon water with ice for free. Also used the exercise room a lot and had had no problems. Along with all the staff the maids were efficient and always had a smile for you. I dinned at the restaurant about 3 times, good quality and a fair price, service was good. I had shared my stay with the G.M. Mr. Bruce and told him I would write a review well it took two months for this to occur. I am a C.I.A, F.I.U. grad of Culinary Arts and Hospitality and this property was well received on this end. Enjoy your trip .

Reviews.Title: “Saved some cash after South Beach, comfortable if a little tired 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AshleyPollak
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to stay on our way to the Florida Keys from South Beach after New Years Eve. The Mayfair is a comfortable if a little tired 4 star hotel. Based on the prices we were spending on South Beach you can get a great deal on price here if you do the right web searches. In general all the key components were here a comfy bed in a great sized room, with a balcony leading out onto a hot tub (which costs extra to use). I imagine if you came here in the 80s this would have all been the height of luxury, but now although the plants in the courtyard have grown beautifully and the sheets and towels are plush - it is about time that the dated tubs are replaced along with the doors and some of the corridor decoration updated. The pool on the roof is not huge, but big enough for a few lengths. It seems a little ridiculous that they are trying to charge for cabanas on the roof as if they're on South Beach... we opted for loungers. All in all the hot tub is fun - especially with the ridiculous amount of bubbles they put in when they set it up for you, we slept well and our wallets were happy after a splurge at South Beach..

Reviews.Title: “Great place for corporate events!!”
Reviews.Author: LBTurnerMedia
Reviews.Content: Last week we had a 3-day event for approx. 35 corporate guests and it went great! The staff was very accomodating especially with all the last minute changes. We had about 20 guests stay in the hotel and they were all very pleased with the accomodation and location. They truly enjoyed the uniqueness of the hotel especially since it's far beyond the cookie cutter of other hotels in Miami (or in the states in general). We used the Crystal Ballroom all three days and although we were supposed to have a reception on the rooftop lounge, because of the weather we were moved to the Havana Room which was perfect. The staff was very helpful and kind, which is very hard to find. Side Note: The gratuity was not over the top, as others have mentioned, because this is a tourist area! Also, many places already include gratuity because of the amount of international guest traffic received in Miami and it is not custom in all places to tip a certain amount. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND IT TO EVERYONE FOR PERSONAL AND BUSINESS EVENTS. ESPECIALLY SINCE IT'S ALSO PET FRIENDLY!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but way over the top on gratuity charges”
Reviews.Author: Travelcopuk2
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at this hotel. The room was very pleasant and well appointed. If you do book make sure you get the hot tub on the balcony set up on your first night. It is a really good way to soothe aching legs after a day at the mall. For some reason the room maid kept taking the hot tub towels and not replacing them so I kept having to ask for more. The service is generally ok BUT there is NO WAY that it is worth the 18 % added to the restaurant bills. I would have happily left 10% for the adequate but not outstanding service. I suspect this is the hotel's way of bulking up the less than impressive wages they pay. The hotel is in a good location and the concierge guys were really helpful. The nearest Starbucks in Coconut grove is worth a mention. I have never visited such a disorganised establishment. I went there 3 time and they either got my order wrong or forgot to complete it on all occaisions. Why did I keep going back? For the pure entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Tired”
Reviews.Author: travelbug791
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Mayfair are a very nice size and the beds are very comfortable. The room it self needs some updating as it looks worn and smells stuffy and old at times. The hot tub on the balcony is a nice touch but they are old. The Hotel is so unique but really it needs to be worked on as it is starting to look tired. There are lots of places to eat around the hotel so I didn't get a chance to try the restaurants. The service staff was great but the front desk wasn't as helpful. My room phone was not working properly and i could only call the front desk if i need something. They often forgot what i needed or would cut me off when transferring my call.

Reviews.Title: “A true Pet Lovers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: imshepp
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair Holel & Spa is truly a hidden jewel. The hotel is warm & frendly ... particularly a true pet friendly hotel. The accomadations are superb. A great room with a hot tub on the balcony is very soothing at the end of the day and even a midnight dip. Very relaxing before bed. The Spa is first class with a wide variety of services to choose. The restaurant has a very nice menu and serves a wonderful breakfast and again is pet friendly. The pool & cabanas on the top deck is great and provides a fully stocked bar and food service. Considering that the hotel is pet friendly, it is cleaner than many hotels that restrict or completely bar pets. She was provided a bed, a food/water bowel and snacks. Best of all we did not have to lock our dog in the room. She was welcomed in every part of the hotel we visited. The most outstanding feature of the Mayfair is its staff. They are all frendly and personally take an interest in your satisfaction. We spent a long weekend and utlized one of their many packages. We had a very enjoyable stay and plan to return soon. It will be difficult to return to reality on Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4th of July Weekend at the Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: BocaFAU
