Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair with friends over the 4th of July weekend. Both families had two young children (10 & 11, and 5 & 8). We had a great time. Service was excellent, rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. Our room even had a piano, to my daughter's delight. We rented a cabana and hung by the pool all day on the 4th and will likely go back next year and do the same. My son said it was "the most relaxing day ever."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: nezperceindians
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a short family vacation for the holiday to Miami. The hotel was beautiful and located in a great area for shopping and restaurants. We didn't do much running around, we spent most of our time enjoyng the rooftop pool and bar. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. They were alway asking what they could do for us to make our stay enjoyable. I also visited the Spa for a facial, which was very relaxing and nice. The Spa staff was very friendly. We also had breakfast every morning at Spartico. The food was good and the staff was very friendly. This was a very nice get away and we would definately visit again. The service was great and the rooms were beautiful. Great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definately be visiting again SOON!”
Reviews.Author: SummerFun0704
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this beautiful hotel. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel. We had breakfast every morning at Spartico in the hotel...good foold and very nice staff. We spent a lot of time relaxing at the rooftop pool and bar. The staff was very courteous, attentive from the moment we stepped off the elevator and into the pool area. We shopped and had dinner at the local restaurants. The room was gorgeous, spaceous and relaxing. We will definately be visiting this hotel again due to the awesome customer service that we received. If you are ever in Miami, this is a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel for future stays”
Reviews.Author: peace31
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and Customer Service at the front desk were not very friendly. I was advised when I booked my room in May that I would be charge a special rate for the conference, however, when I checked in they advised me of a higher rate. Which the young lady was not very accomodating on checking into this matter either. I was also told I would be charged a deposit of $200.00 as opposed to the going rate in most hotels of a $50.00 deposit. For this to be rated as a (5) star hotel, the service was very poor and the rooms were just ok. In the evenings the room had a very stale stinch in the air and the floors were extremely dirty. I would not recommend this hotel for future stays. It will certainly be my recommendation that the conference coordinators not use this hotel in the future. The Ritz Carlton is not far from this hotel, try them out instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very intimate and close to activities”
Reviews.Author: sparerib62
Reviews.Content: this boutique style property was very opulent and the staff were very helpful and friendly.The room was spacious with lots of amenities like LCD TV , snacks and drinks.The hotel is located across from the Coco Walk Mall with several restaurants, bars and a cineplex. Weenjoyed being able to stay out late and feel quite safe and we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Mildew + Fire Alarms”
Reviews.Author: Slobass
Reviews.Content: I used Shatner to get a discount rate and thought this would be a nice hotel. The suite was spacious, but reeked of mildew and you could see the horrible patch job on the wall where there was water damage. Since I was only there to sleep, I didn't bother trying to switch rooms. Their website made note that the rooms have DVD & CD players, but I had to call to get one in the room. The fellow was up very quickly and had it up and running in a snap. So, they seem to have a good support staff before 11pm. After 11pm, I can't say the staff is 100% reliable. There was a fire alarm at 11:30pm and as the guests were exiting the building a group of guests were exiting a bus in front of the hotel and entering the lobby - with the flashing alarms and recorded voice saying to exit. The only hotel staff visible was the Valet and he did not have any idea what was happening. The night manager eventually made his way out and it looked like this was his first fire alarm, which is to say he had no experience dealing with this sort of situation. Luckily, it was a false alarm. Had it been a real one, I fear it would have been a catastrophe. Suffice it to say, I will not return to this hotel and will be sure not to select the area if I'm looking for a spot near Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility”
Reviews.Author: haugenc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Coconut Grove with Cocowalk next door and plenty of fine restaurants and places of interest. The staff is very professional and go out of their way to make everything just right. Every room is clean, nicely decorated and most all have a jacuzzi on the patio! Downtown Miami is 10" away but you will really enjoy the area in the Grove! The rooftop pool is the best with a long bar with flat screens to watch the games, fireplace at night, and private covered cabanas each with chairs, and TVs as well.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Casanova143
Reviews.Content: We planned a girls day and I'm happy to say it couldn't have been in a better place. The Spa at the Mayfair is an excellent choice. Everyone was very courteous and accommodating. We started the day at the roof top pool, and then went to the spa. We each had different services that day. I had a 90 minute massage and foot scrub. It was excellent. The massage therapist was named Orlando and he too was extremely nice and courteous. One of the great things about the Mayfair is that it is very central to many restaurants and stores. We ended up staying the evening in one of their suites and walked to dinner that night. Woke up the next morning and did a little shopping across the street. I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a getaway. Whether youâ€™re coming from out of town or even for us locals from Miami, itâ€™s a an excellent choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: lje0105
Reviews.Content: We spent our 36th anniversary at this gorgeous hotel located in Coconut Grove. Not only did the staff take care of our every need but they went above and beyond with little "extras" to surprise us on our special occasion. The hotel was magnificent. The food was outstanding and the spa was an oasis. We were well attended to by the manager, Audi, our cutie little morning gal who took care of our breakfast was a ray of sunshine each morning. We had massages by 2 very knowledgable women. My husband said it was the best massage he had ever had! The concierge was full of information and suggestions. I can't say enough about our 3 day stay except what we told everyone....."We will see you again!"

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service...Stay At The Ritz Carlton/Coconut Grove!”
Reviews.Author: spk23
Reviews.Content: I won't bore the reader with our "tale of woe", so I'll keep it short. Suffice it say, this hotel won't win any awards for good customer service. We had a room in a bad location and several items in the room weren't in working order. We asked to be moved, which they said they would try to accommodate. I followed up several times but was never given an answer either way. The staff kept telling us they were "working on it" but they never called us back. After another loud evening (Comedy Club across the street) and a loud morning (leaf blower at 7:30am...on a Sunday!) we decided to check out. We moved to the Ritz Carlton nearby. The Mayfair charged us for the additional night even though we had checked out. Very bad service and business practices. However, we were awarded with an upgrade to a wonderful suite at the Ritz Carlton. It was my birthday, so it was a nice "present".

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird_Travels
Reviews.Content: Negatives: We had problems with the jacuzzi in our room. It did not work so we had to switch rooms. The floors in both rooms were dirty. You had to wipe your feet off before getting into bed as the floors do not have carpet on them. Half of the exercise equipment did not work. The phone in our room didn't even work. It took them two days to send someone over to fix it. Wireless internet didn't work in 95% of the room. You had to go to a certain area of the room to get service. Over night parking at the hotel cost too much. Positives: The location is great. Next to lots of restaurants and a wonderful book store just a few feet away which was a great place to have your morning coffee and read the news paper. Good morning pastries and other home made items as well. Cheaper over night parking a block away which saved us some money. The pool was nice. Overall: C+

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Beautifully Designed”
Reviews.Author: farrlynn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the very last minute, for a one night stay. I wasn't exactly sure what to expect, but the hotel is beautiful! Gorgeous and unique design, spacious suites and bathrooms. We didn't spend a lot of time there or experience any of the amenities, but I would definitely return. This hotel is centrally located within Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back ... Jurlique Spa”
Reviews.Author: 11GUAVA12
Reviews.Content: Found a local deal online for the Mayfair Hotel & Spa ... it included, for $99, a 60 min. massage, 30 min. facial, comp. valet parking, lunch at the rooftop pool, and access to the spa all day. It comes in the form of a voucher that expires in 6 months. It was the best $99 I have spent in a long time. Jurlique Spa is a very unique spa and it was soo relaxing. The staff was top notch - off the charts. I have been raving about Jurlique since I left. Please ask for Belkis -- she is the best massage therapist I ever had and Anna gave an amazing facial. They both customized my treatment to suit my needs/preferences. Both paid close attention to detail and do a phenomenal job. Paul, the spa owner was soo accomodating and really made my visit comfortable, very pleasant, and so enjoyable. I can't wait to go back. It was, by far, the best spa experience I've had in Miami!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to host a business event”
Reviews.Author: Doug-Goldner
Reviews.Content: We recently held a week long training event at the Mayfair hotel. We held it in one of the board rooms and had 6 attendees. Every aspect of the event went perfectly. Guests were incredibly happy with their rooms, the entire hotel staff bent over backwards to be helpful, and the location allowed our attendees to experience coconut grove without needing to rent a car. First class service, professional staff, and a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. Would definitely use the Mayfair again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: bojane
Reviews.Content: i liked the looks of the hotel, was very clean, very romantic, and i never had to wait on an elevator. the service was very good. felt like i was being doted upon. everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. i will stay here again. loved the fact that the waitress remembered what my husband liked for breakfast. location was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Mayfair has become my favorite stop over”
Reviews.Author: waterbuzz
Reviews.Content: Leave the trendy, see and be seen South Beach scene and step into a tropical enclave of European elegance and sensuality with American amenities. Sitting in Miami's Coconut Grove district.is a small, luxurious hotel that is my very favorite - The Mayfair Hotel and Spa. The Mayfair greets you at check-in with a lovely flute of chilled champagne. That is just the beginning of it's beguilement. The suites are both tasteful and exotic. Rich with handcrafted furniture, handcrafted tile, no one suite is the same. I especially enjoy breakfast there - a coffee lover's wake-up of croissants and fresh fruit with cream. Pure heaven. The staff will spoil you. I know I can rely on them to magically appear with my every wish and desire. Small, personal, elegant - a wonderful, intriguing accommodation conveniently in the best part of old, old Miami. Highly recommend the Mayfair for an intimate, offbeat yet elegant stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROMANTIC SPOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmalyNarvaez
Reviews.Content: When we were booking for our vacations I came here to "TRIPADVISOR" and read all about the MAYFAIR HOTEL & SPA. And let me tell you guys, make my reservation and spend my vacations at MAYFAIR was the BEST DECISION we ever made. The service, the value, the quality, the room service, the roof pool, the people that work there......EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!!! our Room was PERFECT.......It's a hotel specially for couples (my opinion). Is perfect for you and your partner to spend time out of the routine of everyday and have a very relaxing time. I did not use the Spa, but for sure is very good as well. Everything is very close to the hotel, also the airport. We HIGHLY recommend the MAYFAIR HOTEL & SPA. Do not read the bad recommendations, they just have a BAD HAIR DAY!! LOL ............

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Coolest Hotel I Have Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: KeysTripHolidayIsle
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair exceeds all expectations. I've traveled all around the world, and it is simply the coolest, hippest hotel I have ever seen. The interior design, combined with the lush landscaping and open design, has to be seen to be believed. My room had a balcony with a hot tub and a day bed that resembled something I'd expect to find in Tahiti. If you're interested in a fun, romantic weekend, try the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: augustfinn
Reviews.Content: You know after reading these review it would seem that this is not a good hotel to stay in but after our visit we could not disagree more! I came on this website to tell people about how much we enjoyed our stay and how accomodating the staff was to us and then read some of these recent posts and was really surprised. I know that no hotel is perfect, and yes they could use some renovations to be honest, but we did not have any problems with cleanliness or equipment malfunction. The rooftop pool was awesome(Jorge just might have been the nicest person we met), our spa treatments were great (my girlfriend loved Anna and I thought Eva was probably the best massage I ever had). We loved the neighborhood with all the great bars and shops. This is not your typical hotel, and thats what we liked about it. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel for group and events; service level second to none”
Reviews.Author: mariareimpell
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mayfair Hotel over a series of hotels in the area for a group and a series of small events we were organizing. From the very first time we got in the hotel, we got excellent service. Everyone was very professional, friendly and respectful. The rooms were very spacious and beautiful. Every area of this hotel is spectacular, from the lobby, to the inside gardens, to the roof top pool... this was our favorite place. The food was great, at their Restaurant and at the event we held at the hotel. The personnel was always ready to help. Our client was very happy with the hotel selection and with the service they provided.

Reviews.Title: “Looks gorgeous at first and from far away, get up close and it's just gross.”
Reviews.Author: 46516Tripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair recently for a wedding. This hotel at first is VERY pleasing to the eye. Beautifully decorated, lovely water sounds trickling througout. Every room is a bit different but smartly furnished. Nicely re-done bathrooms with large screen TV's in both the "main" room and bath. Very plush comfy beds. Then the idea of a balcony and soaking tub - wonderful. Then the reality sets in once you start unpacking your bags. Your feet turn DARK BLACK from the flithy floors. You open the door to the balcony and a rat trap is sitting right there for you to gaze adoringly at. The soaking tub was the most foul disgusting thing I had ever seen. Never in a million years would I have paid the $30 extra to fill it to sit in that filth. The bathroom had a nice little counter with a coffee pot and condiments for coffee - - but there was no outlet to plug it into. Any events they have in the open air spaces send loud sounds right into your room - forget a nap and if you have kids NEVER stay here. The roof top pool, again great in theory, has some cool elements, but the floors are filthy, no one really picks up or cleans up towels. You aren't sure if the lounge chairs that have a towel on them for the past 4 hours are actually being saved by someone or if the staff is just too lazy to pick them up. We had no problem with getting the room we reserved, though many people at the wedding did. The location, however, is awesome. The owners of Mayfair need to get this straight. This could be an AWESOME hotel. It has all of the right elements going. Location, space, relaxing but cool vibe, but they have LONG way to go. The clientele that they are going after expects MUCH MORE than this. I don't want to feel gross and disgusting walking barefoot. I don't want to see dirt and hair in every corner of the hotel. CLEAN UP. For the kind of hotel this SHOULD be, I should be able to lick the floor. I mean seriously. It should be gleaming, but foul and disgusting. Wouldn't stay here again until it's under new ownership or management.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very good, but the spa, i dont recommed it.”
Reviews.Author: Raquelbrito02
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, clean and spacious, the service good, the location perfect, with a lot of restaurants and entertainment at a waking distance, What a i dont like was the spa, Evreyithing was clean, but we were 3 couples and the fruit basket had only 1 apple, the water for the tea wasn't hot, we have to ask for fresh drinking water, the massage bed was uncomfortable. i just think that for the price that they charged us they could have a better service.

Reviews.Title: “I was slightly disappointed ...”
Reviews.Author: Mayernl
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and 2 children. We walked into our room & were so pleased with our room. We had two double beds & requested a rollaway. That evening we noticed that the springs were popping through the mattress. My daughter ended up sleeping on the floor. the next day we requested them to replace the rollaway but that was not possible. We ended up buying a blow up bed at Target. The noise level outside is quite high. Try not to have a room by elevator as we heard some guests complain about the elevator bell. The breakfast buffet is very bland. The fruits seemed from the previous day and we noticed the waitress put two old toasts, that were forgotten about in the toaster, into the bread basket for someone else to pick up. We had good experiences with Julio, engineering, and Tameka, front desk! They were both professional & pleasant. The hotel itself is located in a prime location. If only the staff were a bit more serviceable & carry smiles. Also, please make sure before u book that the pool is open in the afternoon. We sadly couldn't use the pool 4 out of 5 nights. This did not help for us with our kids. The decision is yours. Last piece of advice, park around the back of the hotel for less then hotel valet parking of $26 per 24 hours. I paid $15 there.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my beautiful memories of my wedding!”
Reviews.Author: jimenezm
Reviews.Content: I hosted my wedding at the Mayfair. From the very beginning of my planning process it was a mess. They changed the person in charge three times throughout the process and everytime they did not have the proper information from the previous person. It took harrasing phone calls and e-mails to get a response for very important questions. When it came time to pay my final bill for the event, they kept charging me more than they were supposed to. Thank God, I noticed their mistakes! We had 16 room blocked for the wedding and the day of the wedding everyone was waiting around for their rooms. They were not getting the type of rooms they had requested months in advance. My father was basically told to "figure it out" when he was being given a king size bed for a family of four (adults). My brother-in-law was told he had to pay now an additional $30 to get a double bed room even though that is what he had reserved. On the day of my wedding when I was supposed to be enjoying my day and getting ready, those were the issues I had to deal with. The final straw was after the wedding when I receive a notification from my bank that the Mayfair Hotel had charged me almost $6,000 more than they were supposed to! My final bill for my event was supposed to be only $59.00 and they charged me close to $6,000! I will never go back to this hotel in my life. They made way too many mistakes and their professionalism is lacking. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are beautiful. However not cleaned properly. The floor was filthy! Thank God we had a group rate because the price they are asking for a night is definitely not worth it! I do not recommend staying at this hotel and I definitely do not recommend anyone hosting an event at this hotel. If you are looking for the least stressful experience during a wedding this is not the place! I now look back at the place where I should have only fond memories of because it is the place were I got married with disgust!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Wasa747
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! I felt like disinfect my 7 month old baby after our stay. At first we had to get a new room due to an awful smell in our suite. This they were helpful with. In our new room, the glass doors to the balcony that looked like a jungel were worn and fuilty, there were hair (!!!) in the jacuzzi and the furnitures in the room that once was white were now yellow. The housekeeping didn't bother emty the dustbins, and the general cleaning was quite poor. The Mayfair Hotel and Spa needs a facelift and is absolutely not worth its 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “My jaw hitting the floor as we walked into our suite...”
Reviews.Author: Jessika128
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel only through a top secret (wink-wink) vacation auction website. I decided to go ahead and give it a try since we are from Florida, and opted to stay in the state for our honeymoon to eliminate stress after our big day. I was a little nervous since I had some odd belief that this was a small, boutique hotel, and Miami can be hit or miss on the quality of the area... however, as we drove into the valet area- with all of wedding flowers and luggage in tow- my eyebrows raised over the ornate woodwork and beauty that the lobby presented. We were greeted warmly by both the valet and front desk staff, who congratulated us on our honeymoon. As we went up the elevator- overlooking the open atrium area (definitely NOT small by any means), we walked out and down the hallway. Every single door was made of detailed, carved wood, and each had a name- such as the Magnolia Suite, or something of the sort. As we rounded the corner, we approached a double-door entrance, it dawned on me this was our room. I felt like I was in "The Hangover" as we walked in to see marble floors, a column in the middle of the room, a huge garden tub/spa, separate living room/dining room, flat screen tvs in each room, including the bathroom, etc. As if the room wasn't enough, our bellhop was extremely resourceful and insightful, suggested a couple of local restaurants to visit, and places of interest. When we called for ice, it arrived in less than a minute, and was followed up by a call from the front desk to make sure we received it. The hotel is situated next to Coconut Grove's Cocowalk shopping/restaurant plaza- which has every large chain retailer/restaurant you can desire. As well as smaller, unique restaurants- such as the Jaguar- which offers delicious ceviche spoon samplers and white sangria, while sitting outside people watching. We also had breakfast at the hotel's attached restaurant, which had a wide variety of fruit, pastries, juices, etc. In the afternoon, we sampled their pizza- which was truly delicious! We also had booked a spa package, including a couples massage. The facilities were gorgeous, relaxing, and the staff absolutely amazing. Also, the rooftop pool had cabanas, an outdoor fireplace, and bar. The ultimate in indulgence and relaxation! Every detail about this stay was incredible and I cannot wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW Service”
Reviews.Author: Mario6969
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Mayfair hotel for a small 2 day meeting, the minute I came through the door there was a bellman giving a warm welcome and offfering to help me with my bag. Check in was a breeze and I was off to my room, and what a room it had so much detail although you could see the wear & tear it actually gave it a "vintage feel" Went down to their restaurant which has an Italian theme and the pizza was delicious and they had very good happy hour specials and the service was quick and helpfull. Then I went to check the surrounding area called coco walk and wow with all that next to the hotel and at walking distance you basically do not even need a car everything is there. Next couple of day's I was in my meeting event right there inside the hotel and the staff was incredible the food was delicious but overall the surroundings of where the meeting room was located, WOW you felt like you where anywhere but inside a hotel on a conference. I will come back on vacation with my family for sure, 100% highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nevaeh86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayfair on our honeymoon. It was beautiful! I loved having the jacuzzi right on the balcony! The rooms were very nice as well. I loved how open the hotel was too, it was very nice. The valet parking is very convenient, however expensive. The room service was great as well. Great drinks at the hotel bar. The bartender even gave us a few free long islands!! Overall loved the Mayfair and will return when back in Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet return”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel a few years ago but I wanted to report that all is still great at the Mayfair. This year I organized a meeting here and I must say our overall experience was good, and my guests were also pleased with the rooms, meeting space and food. Since I last visited they've changed the restaurant to feature brick oven pizza. Although I did not try it personally, others mentioned it was tasty. My room was located on the 3rd floor and although noise from the Grove is an issue, I wasn't disturbed much and it was St. Patrick's Day! However, I was exhasuted so that may have been a factor. My suite did not have a balcony but not a big deal for me. If you're looking for a boutique hotel without the stuffiness, chose the Mayfair. Ideal for a ladies weekend or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need maintenance”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: It was good to come to Coconut Grove after 3 nights on Miami Beach. The hotel is very centrally located but still relatively quiet. I had a suite which was far from impressive. The interior was worn and the furniture not very comfortable. Bed was excellent. The bathroom had a large shower head in the bathtub but the poor water pressure made this feature relatively useless. Breakfast buffet was OK, nothing spectacular. All in all I paid too much for too little.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the Spa"”
Reviews.Author: EM0040
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but I would not recommend the spa. It cost me $108 for a manicure and pedicure. They did the manicure first (which is usually not the case) and the pedicure second. After the pedicure, I was kind of pushed out the door - and my pedicure was immediately messed up. I had to go back twice to have them fix it, which they were obviously not pleased with and the owner was yelling at the woman doing the pedicure to go get the next customer. For $108, I expected a much nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel that needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: travelfunaddicts
Reviews.Content: This hotel in located across from the hopping Cocowalk in Coconut Grove and it is a tropical delight. Open and airy atriums, lots of foliage and fountains. The rooms are very large with marble floors and well appointed baths. The window glass in my room was fogged on the outside and looked like they needed a serious cleaning. My main complaint is the elevators. They are in serious need of renovation. Slow, buttons don't work or light up, can't tell if the car is going up or down, just not a happy experience getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: soriguana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in February 2011. Both rooms (we had requested 2 beds but had to stay for 1 night in a one bed room) were almost identical. Rooms were clean and VERY large in a somewhat odd shape (trapezoid?). Rooms are plain looking with smooth beige tile floors, white walls, high ceilings, some wood trim/headboards. There was a cute seating area in the room with couch, coffe table and chairs and another round table with chairs. There is an outside patio off the sliding doors with no view (a white wall) that let in some (not a lot) natural light. Very comfortable beds. The bathrooms are beautifully updated and large. Neither room got much natural light, they felt cool and damp-ish. Room had a large flat screen tv, not many free channels to choose from. Front desk responded immediately to requests (new iron, more towels, help opening sliding door). Hotel was not noisy, apparently they did away with a disco that used to be there. Very good breakfast. All rooms are dog friendly (no carpet). The rooftop heated pool is lovely, there is a bar and outdoor fireplace there as well. Not a large space but very nice. Staff friendly and helpful. Overall a nice stay. Parking - the best $5 lot we found was one block from the hotel on Florida and Mary st. Well lit, close, large, fully paved, seemed more secure than some others.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings....not sure what to think ???”
Reviews.Author: KBailly
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a fantastic location in Coconut Grove. My husband and I stayed over Valentine's weekend, and we both had mixed feelings. You're impressed by the hotel as you're walking to your room. You're pretty much always outdoors until you get inside your room. The reason we booked it, was the fact that they had an outdoor jacuzzi in every room. When we requested the jacuzzi set-up, we were told that the jacuzzi of the room we were in was not working. A half hour before our dinner reservations, we had to move to another room (which was not fun). They were very helpful in setting all of this up. We did, in the meantime. request ice for our room and, a half an hour later, still no ice. We had to go get it ourselves. The rooms, for some reason, appeared dirty. The floor was especially not as clean as we would like. The jacuzzi (although an awesome concept), was not that clean either. The setup (which was $30) was just two robes put next to the jacuzzi. We asked them to set this up while we were gone and my husband even called in the middle of our dinner, and yet when we returned to the room, no jacuzzi setup. We had to call to have them come and do it. Overall, for the price, I don't think it is worth it and we probably won't be returning. The hotel has potential, but it needs renovations and a new cleaning crew!

Reviews.Title: “Hello 1980s”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterjon
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel as a fresh alternative to the bustle and high prices of south beach. While the location is certainly tranquil and the rooms are clean and spacious the hotel hardly lives up to it's hype or borderline fictional website. First off, the deception of calling the hotel an "all suite" hotel is pretty insulting. If the logic is that a balcony make the room a suite then I suppose that little room with the shower and toilet qualifies as a spa. Please. The overall feel of the hotel is early 1980s pre-Miami Vice "cool" and my suspicion is that the dark lighting and carpets are more to hide stains. The hotel is noisy at night. Not "people having a good time party" noise but weird scary industrial noises. Very frequent weird industrial noises. Front desk staff seemed pretty inept charging the credit card for the advertised room rate despite the reduced (and still too pricey) rate on the form. As of this writing still working things out with the card company. This place is definitely not one I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: traveljoy001
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite nice: spacious, appealing dÃ©cor, clean. However, despite the fact that the staff was courteous, the service was disappointing from our arrival to our departure. We had just ended a cruise and so arrived at the hotel around 10:00 a.m.â€”much too early for the 4:00 p.m. check-in time. At the front desk, we asked that they call us on our cell phone when the room was ready. We walked around the area, had lunch, and then went to the hotelâ€™s rooftop bar to pass the time. Called the front desk at 12:30 and it was still too earlyâ€”no problem. Around 5:00 we called and asked about the room. It was ready, but we never received a call informing us of this. The Japanese soaking tubâ€”part of our New Yearâ€™s Eve splurgeâ€”only achieved a lukewarm temperature. To the hotel staffâ€™s credit, they sent maintenance people up right away to make adjustments, even though it was 12:30 in the morning. Water still hadnâ€™t gotten hot after the suggested hour of heating time, so we called the front desk again at 1:30 a.m. We were assured the set-up fee for the tub ($30) would be removed from our bill. Upon checkout, the fee was still there and we had to ask to have it deleted (which they did). By the way, the soaking tub is just a plain, ordinary hot tub. The hotel siteâ€™s photo shows a beautiful tub with candles, flowers, plants, and rolled towels. Ours was a bare tub, sitting on a bare balcony. Our last evening at the hotel, we called the front desk to ask for a taxi to be waiting at 4:30 a.m., as we had an early flight. Quickly realizing that might be cutting it too close, we called the front desk only ten minutes later to change the request to 4:00 a.m. The same person answered the phone and said she would note the change. The morning of our departure, there was no taxi at 4:00 a.m., nor was there one at 4:30 a.m.; one arrived around 4:45. On the plus side, Coconut Grove is a lovely community to walk around in, with lots of restaurants and shops. We had an amazingly delicious brunch at Le Bouchon du Grove. We also had a quite good dinner at Green Street CafÃ©. Itâ€™s always full of folks for a reason: good food, great wait staff. The restaurant attached to the hotel, Sparticus, was pleasant as well; we enjoyed the pizza and the bartender's friendly banter. If you want to go to downtown Miami or to South Beach, a bus driver explained how to do it easily. Take one of the inexpensive local Coconut Grove buses to a train stop (such as Government Center) and take the train from there. Save money by purchasing a Miami-Dade Transit â€œEasy Ticketâ€� at the train station.

Reviews.Title: “superb excellent value for great quality”
Reviews.Author: alscar
Reviews.Content: stayed here over Christmas beautiful rooms large and very good facilities. Pool was lovely great sunbeds warm. Great location was a great bookshop next door with cafe. Historical national park nearby to walk to really great place.

Reviews.Title: “IT SADDENS ME TO WRITE THIS!”
Reviews.Author: STARBANK
Reviews.Content: We love the Grove and have stayed at the Mayfair many times over the years....this last visit will be our last. The Mayfair is like the titanic steaming toward the iceberg. It used to be top notch with pofessional staff and great accommodations...Current staff were poorly trained and immature. No one seemed to be in charge. Rooms dirty, bed and bath linens long overdue for replacement.. Broken and patched furniture lights that did not work...phone out of order.... Porch tiles filthy as was hot tub which -despite repeated visits by maintenance - never worked properly.. The Mayfair needs someone to take charge, hire professional staff. The Mayfair needs to be scrubbed down, cleaned up and rooms completely refurbished...or more long time customers like ourselves will be taking to the lifeboats!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Miami sights”
Reviews.Author: BGM10
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve in the Mayfair Hotel, which is a beautiful, luxury hotel near Miami City Hall and historic sights. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and well appointed and the facilities, including rooftop swimming pool, terrace, and bar to watch the fireworks, were all perfect. The breakfast was great, too. Definitely a thumb's up!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed- looks better than it is.”
Reviews.Author: sbitran
Reviews.Content: When I entered this hotel, I was thinking, "This is going to be a fantastic stay!" But looks can be deceiving. The lobby was decorated in a tropical and flowery fashion. There was parking, but it cost $26 per night (We parked at the Coco Walk across the street for $14). It looked very inviting and gave a nice impression. The first flaw I encountered was that the hotel was strangely shaped. I could never really figure how to get around the hotel- I kept walking in circles (and running into a broken elevator) trying to get to my room. The only way to get to the gym is to walk through the restaurant, which is fancy- unpleasant to walk through in your exercise clothing. The first time I saw the room, my daughter said, "They must have spent so much money decorating the lobby that they must have gotten lazy on the room." What she said is completely true. The room was nothing special. First of all, I was staying with my family, so I needed at least two beds but there was only one, which was described by the receptionist as a king size-however, I am quite sure it was a queen. I then ordered a roll-away (for $20) for my son, and my daughter slept on the floor. Next, when I opened the porch door, I saw a "japanese jacuzzi", which wast empty and required an activation fee of $30. The worst part of the room was the bathroom - it had a horrid odor. I really don't want to describe what it smelled like. I got through my shower (which was actually good) as quickly as possible to escape the reeking bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place where you want to come back”
Reviews.Author: agaagusia
Reviews.Content: For the first time in Miami and staying in such a nice hotel. Everything was briliant. Room was amazing(we never had such a big TV).The bathroom was really big with a TV.On the balcony was a japanees jacuzie that you could use for an extra charge. The room was cleaned every day. Room service available. Breakfast not included in the price but it was possible to buy breakfast for ca. 17 dolar. breakfast really good. The hotel has a SPA and a pool. I will come back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Unique, Nice”
Reviews.Author: Lola13th
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night. It is an older hotel, but was clean, the staff was polite and helpful, and the rooms were clean and well appointed. Noises could be easily heard but I had no problems sleeping. Overall, I found this hotel to be a neat and enjoyable experience and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay near coco-walk shopping”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl131313
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was very beautifull. The room was quite big, and the bathroom was very well equiped. The bathroom had a shower and a bathtube, and very well positionned mirrors. The pool and the sundeck were very nice. I used the sundeck, and the view of the beach was breathtaking. The personnel was very helpful. The location was very good. It's accross the street from the coco-shops, and a cinema. It was quite far to get to the metrotrain. Car parking was quite expensive but there is a public parking a street away, thatis much more affordable. On weekends I could hear the music from a neughboring club, but for the other days the nights were quite.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptably Quirky, But Not Worth Repeat Stays”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: I spent a Friday and Saturday night at the Mayfair Hotel "& Spa" in November and had an okay experience. This is advertised as a 4-star property, and despite the quirky features throughout, does fit the bill. The hotel is entered off the valet driveway and there are no dedicated sidewalks, which means pedestrians and cars get to fight it out. The main entrance has only a single-width door, which is problematic any time one person wants to enter when another wants to leave (i.e., most of the time). The front desk area is surprisingly small, and the lobby consists of a bench and small elevator bank. Turns out there is an attractive inner courtyard, but getting to said courtyard is not at all easy. The "suite" I stayed in was the same size as an comparable hotel room found in any other 4-star hotel in the U.S., so don't let the name fool you. The tabletops were dusty, as was the floor, so I get the impression that maid service doesn't have an eye for detail. The bathroom was very attractive, but I was not enamored with the half-open tub design. There was a patio with a hot tub, but I did not use either because I spent most of my time outside of the hotel. Despite the landscaping, the patios front right onto the street. The Mayfair parking garage charges an outrageous $24 for overnight parking. I parked in the MPA structure a block away and paid $5. The Coconut Grove business district is right across the street, so there are several attractive sidewalk restaurants to choose from for dinner. The area's nightlife, however, leaves something to be desired. I didn't find street noise to be especially problematic most of the time, but then again my room faced to the north, away from the center of the action. However, I was mildly annoyed by the wedding reception that occurred in the courtyard, as there was no way to block out the noise of the festivities from my room. Design fail! There is a rooftop pool, but it closes at sunset. Major bummer. The rooftop bar has potential, but I took a look both nights of my stay and it was dead. Who wants to drink alone? Overall, this hotel isn't worth it unless you get a super deal from one of those bidding sites or really want to be in Coconut Grove. Otherwise you can get something better for the same price somewhere else, even in tourist-rich South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel- Shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: HampshireCouple10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in early November. Previous entries helped with regard to the parking and we left our car in the parking lot opposite the hotel. We were then told we had been upgraded to a suite. This was absolutely fabulous- two very large rooms, both with flat screen TV's and, best of all a hot tub in the main bedroom. In terms of cleanliness, the rooms were fine- cleaned thoroughly every day. What was odd was that they would not clean the hot tub. So every day I had to clean it before we used it!! Sadly, what did spoil the stay significantly was the noise levels. We did have ear plugs, but the noise coming from the leisure complex opposite and the roof on occasions, was completely unacceptable. This happened Thursday to Sunday and did not stop until 0300. One evening, we were kept awake by motorbikes as well. i appreciate that this is to a degree beyond the control of the hotel, but it is such a shame. I did use the rooftop pool, which was totally decadent, and the service there was excellent. In terms of the local area- well there are a few shops, but these are quite small and specialised- not the best place to stay if you do not have transport to get around. Just down the road from the hotel is a beautiful harbour as well.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Courla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in november 2007 when the rooftop pool wasn't yet build, but the jacuzzis on each balcony were. Mine has a leak and I ended up soaking the restaurant one floor down - seriously. But the room was awesome. Great bathroom too. Delicious breakfast, beautiful lobby, etc great great hotel

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel but has a noise issue.”
Reviews.Author: Lecia006
Reviews.Content: My room was located on a side that has a club and they BLASTED music outside on the weekend until midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, comfort, and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: carolinajimbo
Reviews.Content: (10/8-10/2010) My stay at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa was great. The location was ideal with great restauraunts and bars within the vacinity. Additionally, during my stay, Im not sure how regular this occurs, but my friends and I were openly welcomed to a party on the pool deck where we had a great time. Very classy w/ a spectacular ambiance and great cause (breast cancer).

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel you can imagine in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SebD_UAE
Reviews.Content: We travelled there and took two 'suites' for 10 days.We travel a lot, and it was not our first trip to Miami so we can compare a bit with other hotels in the city. Some of the personal is really nice and outgoing, I'm speaking about the car valets who are really sympathic and do their best to help the customers at any time, for the rest of the personal, they give you the feeling of being completly transparent and a cash cow. The noise in the rooms is horrible, the personal keep slaming doors even in the middle of the night. The rooms were dirty, the bed linens really old, still had traces from at least a previous customers and smelly, the bath was not even clean when we arrived, and it's not isolated to our room, because we rented two of those at the same time, and the problem was in both of them. For the breakfast, it's really nice if the manager is there, otherwise be prepared to hunt for food. Definitely doesn't worth its value, but the location is really central.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the mayfair”
Reviews.Author: pwsellsprint
Reviews.Content: I never read the reviews until after i purchased my hotel. I was a bit nervous, but our experience was wonderful. We pulled up to the hotel and it was beautiful on the outside and inside.. I saw the complaints about the hotel parking so i asked Our valet he ended up giving us plenty of options for cheaper parking rather then paying what the hotel had offered. We had some time to kill so we went to get lunch he also gave us plenty of local restaurants to eat at.. They held our luggage and gave us a phone call when our room was ready. Our suite was beautiful.. We loved the doors, the tv's in the bathroom and bedroom .. our outside patio was beautiful. I fell in love with the pool area, it had a beautiful cabanas, pool is only 4 feet deep, but the pool area is beautiful. Tons of beautiful furniture.. I especially loved the big fireplace and the sitting area around it.. beautiful! We rented a cabana for a day, and loved it. i had read on here that it was several hundred dollars which is not true. it was $35.00 1/2 day or $70 for the whole day.. The manager of the hotel talked with us to make sure that we were happy, at the pool area we received amazing attention which i would have expected at a resort. They waited on us hand and foot.. We ate pool side two times and the food was great. the hotel is located next to the cocowalk and close to tons of great restaurants. We loved the mayfair, and the coconut grove area. It's has it's own special energy in which we loved.. it was a little more laid back then south beach, but 15 - 20 minutes from it wasn't bad. The hotel is completely open in the middle and has an atrium atmosphere so when it rains, it rains into the middle of the hotel. This might explain some of the noise issues that others have complained about. We had an issue the one night, due to a wedding reception being held on the roof. It went on until 2:00 pm.. fortunately for us, it was only one night, and we just dealt with it. We would definately stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the heart of Coconut Grove.”
Reviews.Author: Ali_from_Tauranga
Reviews.Content: First off this hotel is in a great location and is adjacent to Cocowalk shopping area with lots of restaurants and bars closeby. Our suite was very roomy and had good aircon (which was needed). The bathroom was well appointed with both bath and shower and TV, however the lighting could have been better for makeup application. The bed was very comfortable as were the room furnishings. The patio was a nice touch, though it was too hot to sit out there. There was a microwave in the room which was handy. The pool area was nice though nothing special, the cabanas were available for hire, which seemed a waste as didn't see them being used. The common areas were nice, the reception area was very low key. We took a recommended tour of the city by the Concierge which wasn't great and would have been cheaper booking through a kiosk at Bayside Shopping area. Don't bother with Harbour tour as waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty...just plain dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Marie5285
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty. Straight up and down dirty. The sheets were stained, the ice machines were located in rooms called "the pantry" that were about 1000 degrees and looked like a place a serial killer might dump a body. I was walking down the hall one day to find a HUGE roach crawling down the corridor. Needless to say, I was grossed out. The cleaning ladies obviously don't know how to clean, the tiles in the shower were moldy. I found an ant trail leading into my room one night. The rooftop pool is the only positive thing about this hotel, as well as the location by Cocowalk (lots of restaurants and shops). I got a great deal on this hotel through a package on orbitz.com (less than $70 a night) However, I will deifnitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard the Negative Reviews! This Place is a Hidden Gem!"”
Reviews.Author: JFlow08
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as a 'Name Your Own Price' deal from Priceline so I instantly went to Trip Advisor to check out the reviews. Once I saw all the negative comments and less than stellar rating I was very leery of what we were getting into. Let me say that this hotel was probably the highlight of our trip to South Florida. I guess when you go into something expecting the worse, your expectations are easily exceeded. From the moment we entered the door, the lady at the check-in counter was oh so pleasant and very accommodating to our needs. Then when we got to our room on the 5th floor (the "Stargrass Suite") our jaws dropped when we saw all the amenities. Yes, the flat-screen TV hanging on the wall was nice, but the view from the terrace was great and the room was HUGE. Plenty of room to relax either on the couch, or out on the balcony lounger, or in the queen-sized bed. Plus the bathroom was just as big, plus tastefully appointed. And lets not forget the in-room piano we had. Yes, a PIANO. The novelty of that alone had me sold. Nothing about this room or hotel felt outdated or stale and it didn't have old-building smell. We enjoyed every moment here and looking forward to staying here again. Plus, you really get that Miami feeling when your lounging on the rooftop pool. And no, I'm not some hotel employee placing a fake review to balance out the negative ones. I've never written a review before, but I felt so inclined after reading all the disparaging reviews on this true gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So not happy!!”
Reviews.Author: gapeach1970
Reviews.Content: We travel often to Miami and this is the first and last time we stay here. We checked in and we were put in a king room, 2 adults and 2 kids. The lady told us we were upgraded and at check in we were standing there with our 2 kids,at that point she should have realized we could not all sleep in one bed. It was late we had been driving put the little one in bed with us and we made a sleeping area on the wicker couch for the older one. The pool closed at sunset so we could not even swim. We got all showered and turned on the TV and noticed it was not very cool in the room. I looked at the AC vent and it was molded and that area of the room smelled of must.The road noise alone will keep anyone up bed the bed was like sleeping on the floor....rock hard.

Reviews.Title: “Puzzled. Charming or creepy?”
Reviews.Author: WanderingProfessor
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for two nights through Hotwire. The location is not bad, same for the facade of the hotel, which is quite nice. Our room was big and nice, though wires were crawling from the TV. This is a very original hotel, and a puzzling one. Service is almost non-existent, but some nice things happen there: the pool on top is quite beautiful, the decoration shows effort and we did not pay a lot of money for what is not certainly not a palace, but an upscale hotel in an interesting and walkable area. The impression we got was that the Mayfair was the dream of someone who ran out of money before completion. I am very unsure of the rating I should give this hotel, and I don't know if I would recommend it. It has potential, that's for sure, and will remain a mystery to me. Not a bad experience, and certainly much better than any Hilton. Try it. Let me know what you think.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: docthorn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an online hotel rate company which said I would be in a suite with a kitchenette and separate sleeping/living rooms. WRONG! Because this hotel considers all of their 179 rooms are suites, I was mislead. The room was tiny, couldn't even fit a king size bed in the room. Now the bathrooms are great! But that is the only thing great about this hotel. Upon arrival, I was greeted at the front desk but was turned down for service, he replied " she'll help you next" pointing to the woman to his right behind the desk who was busy with another customer, while he continued to just stand there! This was at 4pm, check in time. The line began to grow behind me as my wait time increased to 20 minutes and the gentlemen still standing behind the counter. When I got into my room (it was tiny of course) it smelled of mold and mildew and the sheets were stained. The decorative pillows were also moldy and I had them quickly removed from the room. Housekeeping was quick to respond. And luckily there was a shopping center across the street where I bought a fragance spray to cover the smell, but it couldn't do anything for my allergies. The internet did not work, it's signal was too low. When I called the front desk, they told me it was my computer. Both my iphone4 and mac picked up a faint signal, not strong enough to work. My purpose of this trip was too take a very important medical exam to further my career and regrettably I picked the wrong place to stay. I had to check out early, due to the paper thin walls and my neighbors TV, and lack of internet use to study. Also, I just received a 90$ bill today from the hotel for Valet, which I only used to check in for one day! That is a very steep price, something must be wrong! But when I called, was told to call back tomorrow because the lady who deals with this is out. If you are allergic to mold and mildew, Don't stay here! If you need internet access, Don't stay here! If you want to rest, Don't stay here. If you want to be charged for services not rendered, DO stay here. P.S. Those buckets they call jacuzzi's are disgusting and very old.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my room!”
Reviews.Author: zeppbabe
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the hotel, itself. The rooms were very spacious, and comfortable. I brought my laptop and had NO trouble, at all, with my internet connection. Unfortunately, I had a broken handle on my sliding glass door, and when I told the desk about it, it had already been taken care of by the time I returned to the room. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. I adored the valet people, as they were the ones that seemed to have the most knowledge of where to go and how to get there. The location is perfect. I respect the fact that there were trellis' with flowers outside the patio. (It's quite obvious that Coconut Grove is not well occupied by stores. By having the patio's blocked you did not have to look at the empty storefronts below. However, the night life is so much fun. I will say that my bathroom could have been cleaner. The walls had some mold on it that could only be seen when you showered. The tile floor also had some definite stains on them. Again, I did not hold this against them. I would like to add that the pancakes were the best I think I've ever had. My other major complaint would be the lack of air conditioning in the elevators, as well as the room a/c not properly working, but cold enough. There was one desk attendant that may have been a little more friendly, but everyone else were super! I would definitely stay here again, if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisey”
Reviews.Author: KPduties
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the mayfair twice this year. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. That said, I will probably never stay there again. The noise from the hotel and the next door cocowalk kept me awake all night. I requested a room change in the morning and never received a call back. Finally as I was packing to check out early, the hotel responded to my third request to move, if only to a downgraded room. At least it was on the secluded side of the hotel. It was not at all the restful getaway I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulrb48
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay at the Mayfair at the end of July. Very nice hotel, the hotel style outdoor atrium looks good and almost everyone was friendly, particularly the pool staff and Nick who I believe is the Manager and greeted everyone as he went about his business. The only people I found to be quite unfriendly were the reception staff, we were checked in in quite a perfunctory way with no smile or welcome, just a debate as to getting bags to the room. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised, but I was surprised to find that english was at best a second language for most of the staff, and for the cleaning staff there was no english spoken at all. We had a couple of questions and it took a few people before we got anyone to understand what we wanted and would answer the question. That said, our requyests were dealt with very quickly and efficiently. We had a suite on the 3rd floor, which was spacious, with nice Bathroom, very large flatscreen TV on the wall, and balcony area with hot tub. The fact that there is a hot tub means that the balcony is screened off from the outside, which I didn't like. I'd have much preferred to sit on the balcony and look out onto Coconut Grove than sit in the semi dark with a large empty hot tub beside me. I found the room to be very dark, even woith the lights on, maybe because of the lack of light from the outside. As with everyone else, the free wifi didn't work in the suite, so wet spent time in the lobby which has plenty of seating for laptop users, of which most gathered in the lobby most days.. There were two late night poolside parties and a wedding whilst we were there, but there were no noise problems at all, and the pool area was pristine first thing the next morning, so no complaints there. Coconut Grove itself very quite and a lot of shops closed, seems like it may be slowly dying away. I hope not, its a lovely area and the Mayfair is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury”
Reviews.Author: Gypsytransplant
Reviews.Content: Mayfair was a lovely experience. I stayed 15 days and had all the space I could ask for. Some rooms have very poor wireless connectivity but the manager, Nicole, and the engineer, Kirk, accomodated us with wired Internet until a room with connectivity became available. The elevators are aging and sometimes the doors stick, but I never did get stuck. Parking is expensive. The rooftop pool is lovely and the cabanas are an option if shade is required/desired. The grill served a very nice buffet breakfast with no wait. The location is ideal and all of the staff ws exceedingly pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of like being in an episode of The Wire”
Reviews.Author: Displaced_City_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Coconut Grove. We love South Beach, but we wanted to visit another area of Miami to see what it had to offer. We heard the Grove was a more chill and relaxing spot and based upon the reviews below, we booked at the Mayfair Resort and Spa. We knew we would miss having the beach nearby, but figured that the rooftop pool would do for our short 48 hour trip. Check-in went smoothly. The property is beautiful and is close to everything that the Grove has to offer. Unfortunately, those are the only positive things I can say about the hotel. In fact, our hotel stay was such a disaster, that we cut our trip short and caught an earlier flight back to New Jersey. Our first day, the TV did not work and we called the front desk who sent an Engineer who never showed up. My husband figured out the problem and was able to fix it. The next day (our first full day) our room was not cleaned until we called the front desk and requested for it to be cleaned. Then, once it was cleaned, they took all of our towels and did not replace them with new ones. Ok, we are easy going folks. No sweat. We just called for more. This is the big problem. When other reviewers noted the 1 AM parties on the rooftop keeping them awake, I think they were just being polite. The Mayfair hosts hip-hop parties for students at a nearby university. According to one of the students, these parties are OFTEN held at the Mayfair. There was a party the night after we arrived, one the following day and one that night (or, maybe it was a continuance of the party that day). The music is loud, ghetto and extraordinarily offensive. The crowd also made me very uncomfortable and before, during and after the parties, they filled up the lounge and the lobby of the hotel. I felt very unsafe. And, this is not a racist comment because I am African-American. There was a wedding going on at the same time as the party on the first night and I overheard four wedding guests complaining about the crowd. After the first night, I thought the party was an anomaly and my husband I went upstairs in our bathing suits the very next morning, with books in tow, looking forward to a drink in the Florida sun. When we got upstairs, the same music was playing and was so offensive that several couples who were also guests of the hotel quickly left. One couple was on the elevator considering checking-out because his fiancÃ© did not feel comfortable at the hotel. We were told we would have to pay a cover charge to stay by the pool. We went downstairs to complain that the rooftop had not been accessible to us the prior day and was, basically, not accessible at that time. The hotel staff was extremely rude and basically had a â€œSo what?â€� attitude. The manager, Nicole, was just as bad. She did, however, give us the option of joining the party. Yes, Nicole, I want to go to the roof, listen to offensive music and fear for my life because of the crowd you have allowed to take over your hotel. Also, all of the seats and lounge chairs were roped off for use by the party goers. So, there was no place to sit. Then to boot, Nicole quickly informed my husband and I that the Cabana we had inquired about (solely because all the lounge chairs were roped off) was â€œ$300 anywayâ€� and â€˜they were not freeâ€� in a manner suggesting that $300 was likely far above our means. So, we should not be bothered by the fact they were all reserved for use by non-hotel guests. Look, talking about money is super passÃ©, but my husband and I do very well for ourselves. I can only assume she thought the $300 was prohibitive because we are a minority couple. Regardless, they never apologized and did not offer up anything to make-up for our gross inconvenience other than the staff rolling their eyes, sucking their teeth and their generally ghetto attitude toward the situation. Regardless, they told us we could access the pool at 3 PM. When we returned to the hotel after 3 PM, the lobby was flooded with men with mouths full of gold teeth, the elevator smelled like vomit, the party was still going on (and would continue into the night) and the hotel staffâ€™s ghetto attitudes were still going as strong as the ghetto party upstairs. Finally, we just paid for a Jacuzzi set up in our room. There is a $30 set-up fee. The $30 set-up includes 2 towels, a bottle of the already-free shower shell and someone coming to turn on the Jacuzzi. The Jacuzzi itself was a breeding ground for fungus (we assumed, incorrectly, that cleaning it was part of the set-up). So, we ended up not using it. On top of all this, there was no Wi Fi access and we saw a very large roach in our hotel room. I have been practicing law for over 10 years, but even if I had not, any layperson can tell you that what the Mayfair is doing is tantamount to fraud. They list amenities on their site. They represent that those amenities will be part of your stay if you book. You book a room based upon their representations. However, when you get there, you learn that the representations are blantantly false. I do not call risking your life to stand by pool (since there are no chairs) as making something accessible. Every hotel has its off weekends. I love the Mondrian and the Tides. Even so, I have had off stays at both, but I never complain because the staff bends over backwards to accommodate you and make up for it, without you having to ask. That attitude is what lets me know I am dealing with a good hotel that is merely having an off weekend and not a bad hotel. The attitude of the staff at the Mayfair demonstrates that it is just a bad hotel. You want to leave feeling like your hard earned cash went to good use. Even though we got the Mayfair at a really cheap price, I still felt like we were robbed of our money. We jumped on an early flight and headed home wishing we had just gone to our normal hotel in South Beach. Maybe we will return to the Grove, but not to the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “They ruined my wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: aneliram
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a romantic place for my wedding anniversary, for the 1st time we can celebrate, we have 2 small kids and is hard to find who takes care of them, but finally this year, we had who can take care of them for the weekend. I found the Mayfair hotel and Spa on the internet and I like the reviews and photos I see on the internet. I went to their website and I saw the Spa spectacular package,(includes the soaking tub set up and 90 min of a massage or a facial massage) the wording on the webpage wasn't clear if the package was for 1 person or for 2.(***Treat yourself and your loved one to a relaxing getaway in one of our luxurious suites, replete with a king size bed and private balcony. Unwind with a soothing soak in your private two person Japanese soaking tub, then wrap yourself in a plush robe and treat yourself to one 90 Minute Service at our lovely Jurlique Spa. A spectacular way to unwind and reconnect: Your Package includes Complimentary Japanese Soaking Set Up and your choice of either of the following: 90 Minute Massage Package or 90 Minute Facial Package***). The advertisement sound like 1 90 massage or 90 facial but doesn't specify for how many people when at the top talk about you and your love one. I call to the hotel to review this information and they told us was for 2 people, and we decide to book. 24 hrs prior to our reservation day, the Spa call to confirm the Massage appointment, he told me was only for 1 people not 2, then Jose Castro call me back and says is only 90 min for 1 person not 2, that is impossible to gave me the 90 min for 2 person.(He offer me 2 30min massage and upgrade to the presidential suite in exchange). We were back and forward with calls, he want the name of the person that we talk on the day of reservation, we didn't remember her name but was their reservation department I even gave the day, time and long of call as I review my phone bill (but even if we remember the name is not going back on what I book for. 30 min for 2 is 60 min total where is the other 30 min? Presidential suite we don't need more space, that not the issue. We were looking for finally celebrate our wedding anniversary in a relax environment, but they kill that feeling already, we cancel and without cancellation fee (hope so, he told us that) The reservation department supposed to know what they are selling or not? I can only say: THANKS FOR RUINED OUR WEDDING ANNIVERSARY.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place..close to great Coconut Grove atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaArmella
Reviews.Content: Best place I've been to lately!..very nicely remodeled old hotel right smack in the middle of Coconut Grove! Close to the coco-walk..restaurants night life and much more!

Reviews.Title: “So great you don't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: icandy93s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best we've ever stayed in and it keeps us coming back. The service is great the rooms are spacious and comfy. The bathroom and balcony is extraordinary and relaxing. Its in a great location, shopping, dining is a 2-minute walk away. At night there is live entertainment and lots of excitement. My family and I always have a great time. I would recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful place for couples”
Reviews.Author: aliean4
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Mayfair I think the rooms are beautiful and the staff is very personable. The whole experience was superb!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at mayfair”
Reviews.Author: rao1
Reviews.Content: just stayed again at the mayfair coconut grove and again really enjoyed the location and service.check-in was fast and the hotel was extremely clean.roof top pool was clean but they might want to pass a pool brush along the side,their was a ring that can be cleaned using some clorine or whatever.i still enjoyed swimming there and my wife had fun too.yes i would stay again,the location is right in the middle of coconut grove and within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- Great price”
Reviews.Author: kywillia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location in Coconut Grove. Everything is in walking distance. We booked a 2 room suite because of our dogs, but the rooms were so big, we didn't need it. A regular suite is large enough. The SPA was fantastic. When you check in to some dog friendly hotels as soon as you walk in the front desk clerk says there is a $150.00 charge for your pet "you know" and check you in. This place, no. When you walk in one of the front desk clerks walks over and offers your dog treats. Amazing.. Your pooch is welcome here. Guess what, its a one time charge of $25.00!! thats it! Marriott, kiss me good bye... The housekeepers were very nice. Check out is a 1PM!! Amazing. Love this place. The roof top bar and pool was nice as well. Customer service was fantastic all across this place. Great TVS. Restaraunt food? Great.. Breakfast with Chicken Sausage...

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: E210
Reviews.Content: I made the hotel reservations for my collegue and I due to bad weather I was delayed 1 night. When I called to ensure I did not loos my reservation I was on hold for 45 min. When I arrived I noticed my room was very small and my collegue's was twice as large and yet I made both reservations. I am currently not impressed to have to pay the same price to stay in a Mayfair room and my collegue stay in an Executive room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: broussyjr14
Reviews.Content: The service at this Hotel is Amazing! The price was very reasonable and the decor and surroundings were very nice. I proposed to my girlfriend on the rooftop of the hotel in the evening, the concierge recommended and booked a great restaurant and they even comped us Champagne after I proposed. All of the staff at this hotel were so helpful and friendly, it made it a trip to remember. I have stayed at many hotels in the Miami area and this was by far the best! You will not get better service then the Mayfair! I will be coming back to this hotel many times in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but everything closes early.”
Reviews.Author: Pepper0916
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and has a great design. One problem, the bars and restaurants close very early. We got in around 9:30 and the hotel was dead! We only had one night to stay so we were bummed. Also, we had a private jacuzzi, but it was so tiny two people would barely fit sitting on top of each other. Plus, they charged a $130 set up fee and set up would take an hour and a half. To and from the airport, for two people it is about a $24 cab ride each way.

Reviews.Title: “I HAD A SUPER TIME !!! A DIFFERENT AND LUXURIOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: happytravler123
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husbant on Sat. night. Got the Florida ackage . What a wonderful time. The room is clean . The receptionist Jennifer was so helpful. The hotel is so different ! It's Florida style tropical. The floors were clean. I checked in right away and they gave us a longer time to check out. The food in there restaurant was fab. I don't know what all the complainning was about ., but no hotel is perfect. I almost did not go because I read so many bad review. I am so happy I did not listen. I have to say I had one of the beat times . I used the soaking tub. I love it !!!! If there is no place like home then stay there . If you want to have a super time get your bags backed and go. I am going to book back in two months. So look for the John and Dawn having a super time. The pool is the best too.

Reviews.Title: “ALL THAT AND MORE”
Reviews.Author: AD6TorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair from June 19th-June 21st 2010 and it was worth every penny that we spent....Everything is exactly as shown on the internet.......Beautiful area in Coconut Grove ....The entire staff was friendly and helpful.....Our room was welcoming and romantic...(it was spotless) the TV in the bathroom gave it that extra touch....The restaurant was a bit pricey but what do you expect in upscale Miami..Overall we had a great time....I am looking forward to my next stay in August.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Coconut Grove!”
Reviews.Author: MiddleburgMonkeys
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel in 2000 and had a great time. So we were a little concerned with some of the less than stellar reviews that had been posted in the last year. Alas, we were not detured and went ahead with our plans. We are so glad we did. The hotel appearance was exactly as we remembered. Very tropical and romantic. The staff we encountered were helpful, friendly and English speaking. Room had plenty of storage, microwave, safe, big-flat screen tv, dvd player. Excellent working air conditioner and tiled floors - no carpet. Might be considered a little sterile to look at, but we like this. This is an open air hotel, thus might explain some of the "smells" that some folks have complained of. Keep an open mind that Miami is a tropical location and this is an open air hotel. The hotel could stand to update the hot-tubs or lose them. Accept them for what they are - aged. Pool was on the smaller side, but great. It is rooftop and it is heated, even in the summer. So swim early am or late pm. Cabanas and fireplace are great to look at. Coconut Grove is easy breezy during the day, but comes to life at night. This includes the Mayfair. You will hear music and bustling in the streets starting around 6pm til ?. This was desired for us, we did not want to drive much. Cocowalk was literally next door and we enjoyed each of our evenings there. We traveled with a 3 year old and a 17 year old. We had a great time with each of them there. We were never concerned with safety. Activities for children are minimum at the hotel, but there are activities, including multiple parks nearby. If you are a walker or jogger, you will enjoy this locale. Parking is at a premium in Miami, especially in Coconut Grove. We chose to use on street parking and parking garages aside from the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful-Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sylvia_suska
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. It was a beautiful hotel, the architect was amazing. The only tiny problem is the elevator has no air circulation, but it doesn't bother us too much. Our room was on the 4th floor. We had a King size bed, the room was huge with a tropical like balcony. Definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lostinlove617
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for just one night, but I have to say that the concierge at this hotel was excellent. I called to request that the hot tub be set up prior to our arrival and requested candles. This little getaway was a suprise for my boyfriend. They even gave us an upgrade! It was a beautiful site. The only complaint was the noise coming from the street and Coco walk but that is expected on a Friday night. We will stay there again! Thank you Mayfair for making it a great memory for my boyfriend and I!

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fran1983
Reviews.Content: When me and my friend arrived we thought the place was beautiful. Walked into our rooms and liked the size and the t.v. in the bathroom. We 1st noticed that we had one king size bed and we order double bed. So we told the front desk and they said they would bring us a pull out bed but, they never did. We asked twice never got it!! Our comfrorter had a blood stain on it. The floor was black in most areas. The hot tub on the patio was nasty and dirty I would not get in that. I spent 270 dollars at the spa and it was terrible. Was not worth it! although, my friend really enjoyed her spa experiance. The walls are paper thin so you can here all the noise going on throughout the horel and outside the hotel. We were their 4 days and saw 3 giant cock roaches ewwww one which had wings and could fly groce!!! We had to call the front desk to send someone up to kill them. Took 30 min for them to come and he didnt even get them all their was still 1 in their after he left! Also the maids do not clean well. it seems like they make up the beds and thats it. They take the used towels but they do not replace them so eventually we ran out and had nothing to shower with. This was the worst hotel I had ever been too.
