It looks pretty until you stay there then u see the real deal. Also hotel staff was very rude when we asked about things to do. Also there free internet SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!! VERY VERY SLOW!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clminraleigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayfair for one evening while on our way to the FL Keys. We arrived in the early evening and had a good experience with the valet service and with checking in. The front desk staff was helpful in giving us written directions to a restaurant that we wanted to try. Our room was clean and well maintained with wonderful amenities. Because our stay was short we did not eat or drink at the hotel and did not utilize the pool area; therefore, we cannot comment on the quality of those. We did enjoy strolling around Cocowalk in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: tgooz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night and it was THE WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. The smell in the room was horrific! It smelled like we were in a dark, dank basement with a definite mold/mildew smell. In addition, we had thought we were going to use the hot tub, but when we saw how dirty and old it was we quickly cancelled that service. The floor in the room was so filthy that my feet were black. There was a Hip Hop Party up on the roof top deck which went until 3 am and we could hear the "music" in our room until everything broke up. In addition, there was a chipped coffee pot and we had to search for a working outlet to plug it into. One positive across the board was that all staff we encountered was very friendly, pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK but no better; creaky elevators and inefficient staff”
Reviews.Author: mathlawguy
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair has an excellent location in the middle of Coconut Grove. The rooms are pleasant and well furnished but a bit small. It would have rated more highly, but ... 1. They were understaffed at 3 p.m. on a weekend resulting in 20 minutes to check in 2. The elevators are spooky, slow and hot 3. The "hot tub" is kind of a joke; for $30 extra they provide actual water, otherwise it is a large mixing bowl Pluses: car valet service worked well; nice plantings and tropical feel; not a bad price for the location

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this is a 4 diamond hotel!”
Reviews.Author: birdy033
Reviews.Content: Hotel is okay, rooms are big, bed is very comfotable but feels old. I had high expectations since this is rated a 4 diamond hotel...I have stayed at nicer Hampton Inns. Service - just okay. Did not go to restaurant or bar. The "japanese spa" on the deck is an old hot tub. Food at conference was poor! The Business Center is barely a kiosk where you pay to use the SLOW computer.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-Star by a long shot...Bad-Bad-Bad”
Reviews.Author: jeng6109
Reviews.Content: We purchased this through Priceline based on a 4-star rating and were very disappointed. The hotel rooms are very, very dated. The walls are like paper and you could hear everything in the hallways, street, and the room next door. They advertise the jacuzzi's on the balcony ($30 to turn it on)..... I wouldn't get in our's if my life depended on it. It was dirty and old... looked like it hadn't been throughly cleaned in quite awhile. We were woken up at 6am by the city employees using a leaf blower to clean the sidewalks. This went on for nearly 2-hours. It was like they were in the room with us and we were on the top floor of the hotel. We voiced our concerns to the front desk and they said and did nothing. It's unfortunate that the hotel was so bad as the area could be alot of fun in the evenings with the restaurants and all.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff, care worn surroundings”
Reviews.Author: khs22
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying here based on all the mixed reviews, but we were part of a wedding and most of the guests booked this hotel. I've traveled the world and stayed in a wide range of places - rough and grungy up to 5 star accommodations. This was just about average. All the hotel staff I encountered were extremely friendly and helpful - even found me a cab when I was off the premises calling in. The interior is a bit dark in places - but there are two open air atria (the rooms are all directly off the atria.) The interior structure definitely needs a re-vamp - a few areas of decaying hardscape in the atria, very beat-up elevator buttons, tired looking lanais. For the rates being charged in this hotel, it is laughable. However, the spa is lovely (ask for Anna if you want a great manicure & pedicure), the Grill is quite good (don't miss the pancakes!) and the rooftop pool area is very nice.) Don't bother ordering up the Japanese hot tub service on the lanai of your room - these babies need to be retired (in a word, eeeew!) Friday night at the hotel was surprisingly quiet, but Saturday night the area clubs were hoppin' and there was lots of noise we could hear from our room (not enough to keep us awake.) The bathroom was huge and had a large, deep soaking tub and all the basic amenities. The ironing board cover was very stained and old, but there is a room safe and microwave as well as the usual mini bar fridge in the room. If you have to stay here, book a spa treatment and be sure to pack earplugs & flip flops for walking around in your room and you should be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “A Two Star Place”
Reviews.Author: Canuck14
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair pics on the website look fantastic. Modern and elegant. In reality, the place once was but is very tired today. You can see the faded character of the building but which have great potential. The front desk, for example, is kind of beat up. The room was decent, but again, tired looking. The floor tiles was quite dirty and my bare feet got black fast. The soak tub is on a balconey with a lot of big trucks and noise outside. Also looked kind of beat up. I was alone on this trip, but there was nothing "romantic" about that tub and its location! The one redeeming factor is the room price. It is very reasonable and accurately reflects what you will be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome/Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diva_NP
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is a beautiful hotel. Highly recommend getting a massage from Candy and pedi from Mrs. Anna. Everyone was helpful and Carmen is the best concierge EVER. Extra comfy beds, loved the balcony with the hot tub and chaise, and had amazing pancakes from room service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: ms_unique3
Reviews.Content: I was recently married at the hotel and the entire experience was awesome. The hotel staff and caterers were very professional and always nearby when needed. The moment we entered the hotel, it felt like a whole new world..... Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “give it a MISS”
Reviews.Author: gtof
Reviews.Content: Big group for a wedding...Promised early check-in refused on arrival; rooms were clean but no towels..waited over an hour to take a shower. Gift bags, arranged beforehand, to be given guests at check-in went undelivered. Later offered a $4 per bag delivery fee. Bridal suite was locked out on second day, requiring a locksmith. This hotel is overwhelmed, overrated and overpriced. Give it a big MISS. Friend?! I wouldn't recommend this dump to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful, miserable front desk service”
Reviews.Author: HAHMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel could easily be five star. It is exquisitely appointed and the architectural design and greenery are very beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous and the private soaking tub on the balcony is so much fun. But.. when we arrived at at 4:15pm and very disinterested clerk told us that our room was not ready. No apology, no drink coupon, just not ready. We left our luggage and cell phone number to be called when our room was ready. Ninety minutes later, we returned (no phone call yet) to the same bored clerk who clearly had no idea who we were or memory of promising to call. During our stay, our room was completely missed by the cleaning staff one day. Then when we left, we asked a different front desk person the best way to the airport. Her answer,"There are many ways to get to the airport." Not a helpful response. Still, the hotel is truely beautiful and the neighborhood is great. Just don't expect decent service from the front desk. The valet and the bell man however were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character, but has a few issues”
Reviews.Author: buglightyear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair for four nights recently and ended up with mixed opinions. On the plus side, I thought it was very pretty - much more interesting architecturally than your standard Hilton/Marriott. The location was good within Coconut Grove - you are in walking distance of lots of good shops/restaurants. Conference facilities were nice; their breakfast / lunch was pretty good too. On the negative side, we must have been right next to a club as we heard people partying until after midnight It was pretty loud, even though we were on the 5th floor. The internet service was very spotty - worked okay for email but Skype was unusable. The hot tub looked pretty old but it worked fine, although it cost $30 to get filled and I had to call downstairs 3 times to get it filled.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. I'd be even more upset if I had had to spend my own money at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kar001
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were spacious, there were some fundamental issues, namely: - we all compared notes and we all agreed they re-use the hotel slippers. Mine were crumpled and one of my colleague's had two left feet - towels would start disappearing after the room was cleaned - all mirrors were in the bathroom (which is fine) except that all visible plugs were in the bedroom (not good if you want to dry your hair with a mirror). Ended up using the reflection of the 50" TV to dry my hair, until someone pointed out to look 'up' in the bathroom where the 'bathroom TV' was plugged in. Ok.... - why a 'bathroom TV' was necessary (with remote) when there's no where you'd actually see the picture from - Noisy Noisy Noisy Noisy. The courtyard amplified noise from everywhere. Sounded like I had a window open (to the point that birds seemed loud). Didn't help when a room in the courtyard had their alarm go off at 5:30am which woke up the whole hotel. - the individual jacuzzi was a bit much. If you lifted the lid... well, better you didn't. And how much water is wasted filling up these individual hot tubs? Note about the food... our chicken wasn't cooked. Cooking for 100 people, this isn't good. Rubber egg' mat' for breakfast was also a favourite. Oh, and although they SAY they have high speed wireless, it kept dropping out in the rooms. Therefore I think that's false advertising - so frustrating to get any connection!!! All in all, a pretty deplorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe our Mayfair experience - Noisy.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorldisme
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Mayfair which was the location of a wedding that we were attending. First the good stuff: The Mayfair is a beautiful and architecturally interesting hotel. It is built around a center courtyard which is open to all floors and to the sky although you never actually have to go out from under cover to get anywhere in the hotel. The check in/ check out process was smooth and easy. We didn't use the concierge service so can't comment on that. We also didn't eat any meals there except at the wedding reception. The location is nice if you want to be in Coconut Grove. But basically the area around the hotel consists of shopping at chain stores (e.g. The Gap), a few local apparel stores, but with a smattering of very good local restaurants. You are one block from multiple Biscayne Bay marinas (but no beach) and a short drive to Vizcaya. But that is it. If you want serious walking you may want to stay on Miami Beach. One of the very basic things that a traveler expects from any hotel is a quiet peaceful room where one can get a decent night of sleep. That thought brings me to the bad stuff: This hotel is neither peaceful nor quiet. First, there is the problem of the beautiful central atrium that I mentioned before. The noise from the atrium basically bounces around, goes down the hallways, through the room door, and into your ears. Why? Because the architecture of the entire hotel is solid surfaces and there is nothing to dampen the noise. We were down the hall from the elevators and could still hear the bell everytime the elevator stopped at our floor. In fact, there is no sound absorbing material anywhere in this hotel which brings me to... Second, the hallway floors are tile. So everytime someone rolls their luggage down the hall (which happened at 1 am our first night), the luggage bounces over the joints in the tile and makes a tremendous racket. Not to mention the housekeeping carts etc during the day. Third, our room faced the Cocowalk (an open air mall) across the street. The balconies are essentially concrete rectangles (including the ceiling) so that noise was funneled right into... you guessed it... our room. That wouldn't be so bad except that there are apparently some open air clubs or restaurants that play loud music until 1 am. Did I mention the 2 am police siren convention on the street? Did I mention that this is a noisy hotel? Did you read some of the previous reviews for this hotel where the guests mentioned that the hotel offered them earplugs? In summary, this is a cool trendy hotel in a nice neighborhood and I would stay there again if they would solve the noise issue. Hey, there's always Ambien.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, blissful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jl1534
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a Venitian Suite for one night right before Christmas and I was completely thrilled with this hotel. The open-air courtyard was gorgeous and very pleasant with December weather. I can imagine that it would be stifling in a Florida summer, but fall through spring would be perfect. We were completely satisified with the room, which was very large with a large in-room hot tub and a large bathroom. Everything was very clean! The rooftop pool was amazing and romanticly lit with candles and torches at night. We walked to a nearby restaurant and bar for dinner and drinks and we were happy with the safety of the neighborhood. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you are looking for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Mialbatross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my adult daughters on our annual "spa trip" after the hoildays. This is a nice hotel in a good location. Pleasant front desk and personnel. Room was fine, nothing special. Called maintainance to deal with a "chirping" smoke detector. He said he "would see if he could find a replacement battery or I'll just take the battery out" Doubt that is up to code! Housekeeping failed to clean coffee maker and replenish coffee. 2 of 3 days housekeeping replaced towels - 2 bath towels, 1 hand towel, no wash cloths for 3 women! Call placed and more towels were sent up with coffee, but I don't think we should have had to make the call! On the plus side, spa services were very nice though the location of the spa is a problem. The lounge area where one is escorted to "relax and transcend" (their words) is adjacent to a banquet area. Lounge has large windows fronting this area though covered with sheer drapery. so while one is "transcending" you are watching and listening to a banquet being either broken down or set up. At leat one of the treatment rooms was rather shabby with soiled stained carpet. Unpleasant. Services are $$$, so we expected better. Another plus - restaurant serves good food and resaonable priced; not the usual outrageous gouging for room service, breakfast, etc. Very nice, congenial servers, bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service. Hot Tub No Good.”
Reviews.Author: JJH3d
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with good service. We only stayed one night. The location is excellent, you can walk throughout all of Coconut Grove and Cocowalk is literally across the street. The rooftop pool bar is very trendy, really great, as is the lobby bar. One negative is the hot tub on the balcony. As a previous review states it should be removed, pretty scary. Our room was a little musty upon entry, but in very humid Miami we didnâ€™t think much of it.

Reviews.Title: “Hot tub heat-up too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: Strombeekasaurus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and our room was large and spacious with a tv in the bathroom even. You get slippers and robes and very comfortable pillows on the bed and around the room. It's near shops and restaurants. We booked this room specifically for the balcony hot tub that turned out to be more trouble than it was worth. It takes an hour and a half to heat up, so unless you're spending the day in the facility, be prepared for hassle around planning when it will be heated up and changing rooms if the tub is broken as ours was. Also, bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper since with only sliding glass doors, the noise from people outside can be disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Different, but dirty”
Reviews.Author: mamma2NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Mayfair in Coconut Grove. Hotel had run out of the room that we requested, but neglected to tell us at the front desk, instead we were given the key and had to discover ourselves that we had been downgraded but were still being charged the same rate. After much discussion with the front desk, we were finally upgraded for the one night but were told we had to pay the additional fifty dollars. After much further discussion, we were finally given the upgrade for one night at no additional cost. The next day our original room was ready which ended up being VERY dark, not too much natural light, VERY dirty, floors were tile, but I don't think ever washed, dust on top of headboard and mold in the bathtub. I actually requested cleaning products from housekeeping to clean the room myself. Our room keys needed to be reactivated several times throughout our stay. The hot tub was dirty and the balcony looked out onto a wall with just a glimmer of sunlight. Did not want to spend one extra minute in the room. Room was bearable at night when it was dark and looked better after a few glasses of wine. Definitely a different type of hotel, very feng shui, nice atrium nice relaxing decor and soothing fountains, not your cookie cutter type, but would not stay here again. Also "free" internet access did not work the entire week.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated, clealiness leaves something to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: mobilecareinc
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in the Mayfair Hotel for a business conference. I found that the accommodations were good with one issue (major for me, maybe minor for others). There was a feeling of a lack of cleanliness...The room was very dusty which was a trigger for my allergies and it just smelled like an old locked away room. This in my opinion is something that the hotel should look to improve on immediately. I was on the 3rd floor in room 332 and while it was very tidy just didn't give me the comfort that I needed to relax in between meetings.

Reviews.Title: “A tired and over rated hotel in need of a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: fjmYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel on a 3 nights for 2 basis, which is just as well or it would have been vastly over priced. The room was defined as an 'Execytive Suite' but seemed pretty average to us, it was quiet dark, made more so by the heavily planted patio which screed the view to the back of another hotel. The room was not very clean and the tiled floor was filthy; we made the mistake of going barefoot one evening and needed a second shower to get rid of the grime. The style of the hotel with rooms leading to indoor walkways overlooking the attrium and other floors meant that there was no way to isolate a very noisy Wedding party. This was made worse when some fools set off sparklers which in turn set off the fire alarms sometime after midnight. Staff were very slow to react and confused guests were left wandering around for some time. Food in the restaurant was pretty good but breakfast was cold and unappetising. We used valet parking ($26) on arrival but self parked the next day in the same car park for considerably less ($15). One lift was still broken (note an earlier review from 2008) and the hotel remains in need of a serious makeover. Sorry overpriced and over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kittylover
Reviews.Content: We very much liked the Mayfair, but could not rank it very high. The people were wonderful, and friendly. Walking into the hotel, you were given illusions of prior grandeur. It is very elegant, but very dated. Our room was big enough, but smelled a bit damp, although it was on the third floor. It was a corner suite, set at an angle. There was a nice patio outside, with a whirlpool spa. But the spa was empty. The bathroom was big enough, but the door got in the way of the toilet. We did not use the pool. The location is right across from the CocoWalk. This mini mall, has some nice restaurants and some noisy bars. Luckily the noise did not bother us, as it did when we stayed at the Sonesta across the street. It must be aimed in a different direction. I would only come back to this hotel if traveling with pets or going to the tennis tournament. They are very pet friendly. I would recommend to friends who were traveling with pets. If you need to be in the area, like for the Sony-Ericssen Tennis Tournament, this hotel is better than the Sonesta

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, but not what it's cracked up to be.”
Reviews.Author: rexsterx
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Mayfair hotel. And although the property is very nice, the hotel overall missed the mark on many things: the room (a "suite") was large but unappealing. The furniture (wicker) was old and a bit beaten. The room was was quite bare with wooden boxes on the wall as "art". Overall the appearance seemed unfinished. The walls were an eggshell color throughout and although I understand the minimalism of Miami, for the 4-star rating I expected a little more effort put into making the room appealing and comfortable. The bed had no bedspread or decor (except for the oversized headboard) but was comfortable. The floors were also dirty, and the sheets were not changed during our 3-night stay. In addition, the housekeeping staff neglected to replace face towels in the bathroom (which was the nicest part of the room). However, even in the bathroom, there was no place to put your towel near the shower (the only hooks were across the room). The room had a wet bar, but there were no glasses, nor a refrigerator to put stuff in. Instead there was a mini-fridge stocked with high-priced items (this was expected). Unfortunately, the mini-fridge was in the closet along with a microwave (useless since there is no where to store cold foods) and a safe. The result was that half of the closet space was taken up by the fridge, worthless microwave, and safe. Upon arrival a light bulb was out (no biggie), except that a staff member came, took the blown-out bulb, said he would return and never did. Beware of the Finch Suite, room 357 (it is booked as one of their Venetian suites). It is directly across the street from Cocowalk and the music and street noise is quite loud in the room until around 3:00 AM. The staff gave us ear plugs. Also, due to the awkward shape of the room (bed was in a triangular area of the room, with the tv on the acute angle) it was uncomfortable t view the TV from either the bed or the small wicker couch because in both cases you had to view the TV from an angle. In addition, the TV cables were visible and made it impossible to close the curtains behind the TV. The in-suite jacuzzi was in another corner of the room with cheap blinds that allowed way too much light in, so be sure to bring eye shades if you want to sleep past sunrise. There was a cheap sony clock radio on an end table, some stationary in a drawer, but no pen. The valet parking is good, except for one night I had to wait over 25 minutes for my car. The reason given was that there was an "event" going on (there were no other people waiting for a car so I assume they had cars to park, not retrieve). We enjoyed the buffet breakfast. Unfortunately all the hot food at the buffet (potatoes, bacon, sausage) was cold. The to-oder omlettes were great, and I suspect that if they kept a closer eye on the buffet, it would be also. Just another case of missing the mark. In addition, gratuity is included in everthing, including bars and the buffet (18%). I typically tip 20%, but I don't like having it automatically added to the bill, especially since there were only two of us, and especially at a buffet, and there is no incentive for good service (although the service itself was fine). On the plus side, the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The grounds were well kept and the property is beautiful. The rooftop pool and bar are quite nice, and the location is great. Overall I would say the Venetian suite we stayed in is not worth more than the $158/night that we paid. (We were "upgraded" because there were no Executive Suites available even though we had reserved one.) Based on this price, I would recommend the Mayfair. If I had to pay much more I would be wary.

Reviews.Title: “Inadequate hotel/spa with misleading photos”
Reviews.Author: sandra8787
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I checked in for a 4 day relaxation oriented spa trip. The positives of the hotel are as follows: adequate location with proximal courtyard style shops/eating, nice spa on site, interesting fusion style ambiance, good food in restaurant, amenities available, and walking distance to the marina. The negatives are as follows: no shuttle/transportation to airport, building is old, the courtyard is too hot for leisure, the ground floor water features are so heavily chlorinated your eyes burn walking through the area, the escalators are so hot your make up melts, the restaurant is staffed so inadequately that you must go into the kitchen to request seating, inadequate hot water supply for greater than 16 hours, coffee packets for the room not available x 48 hours, wash cloths removed by room service without replacement, unclear communication between hotel and spa regarding price discrepancy of service without resolution, dirty glasses in the room, mixed drinks left by guests in the hallway remain abandoned for > 24 hours prior to removal, only 1 electrical outlet available in the bathroom and it is > 6 feet up the wall, mildewed spa tub on the balcony does not inspire one to pay for use, the pool on the roof plays the music so loud that one can't be heard well enough to order a drink at the bar or have an audible conversation anywhere on the roof, expensive manicure given by an employee whom spent the entire hour sharing the detailed woes of her personal life while giving substandard services- split nails with ragged edges and poor polish application... I could go on but to no avail. Upon request of the front desk regarding the quality of our stay, we calmly shared our concerns and received a complimentary 15% off future stays. I left my coupon with them and strongly recommend anyone seeking a spa hotel resort experience stay elsewhere. It is an adequate location for a family not anticipating spa quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Fratla
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Venetian Suite, nice but positioning of room was awful. The bed was to the left corner the tub was in the right corner TV near the tub, making viewing the TV difficult. If you've seen the show Nightline, revisit the segment pertaining to how clean hotel room drinking glasses are. BELIEVE IT. Our bathroom glasses had the remnants Alka Seltzer and right outside our door there was a dead GIANT ROACH my wife asked me not to mention it to the management to see how long it would stay there, we arrived 12 Sept and left 15 Sept with the Roach still there!! The upstairs bar was nice, but times were unpredictable, however the lounge near the lobby was GREAT service was excellent....location to sites couldn't be better. Our group went to Chicago's a restaurant a short walk from the hotel (ask for Carlos or GiGi they worth the trip to the restaurant) ask for the VIP Room itâ€™s on the second floor a large round table in front of a big screen TV. Oh the food is tasty and you definitely get your monies worth. Overall not a bad trip.

Reviews.Title: “Old Florida style hotel....lots of tile and heat...noisier than most....but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: morbegno
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a fixture in Coconut Grove for 25 years....conveniently located across from everything in the Grove. Walking distance to anything important. Once parked for $26/24 hours, you have your choice of entertainment, restaurants, shopping. That said, this hotel is situated with an outdoor atrium...all rooms access the natural air, and in August the atrium was HOT. The elevators were hotter and slow. Not much ambiance in the hotel itself. A small unknown steakhouse is the only restaurant, but none is really needed when the Grove is across the street. There is a small lobby, but nice sitting area on the subsequent floors if you can stand the heat in the hot months. The business office was not much more than a cubby hole with dim lighting, a printer that didn't print out boarding passes. At least this area was air conditioned. There is a service charge of 6.95 for use of the business office internet service. There is a spa with a reputable following and a beautiful rooftop pool. The room was spacious, with floor tile only, no rug, perhaps of the high humidity from the atrium and the balcony? Bathrooms were clean, modern, lighting was too dim for makeup application. Large flat paneled tv, mini-fridge well stocked for your $20 service fee. The balcony was spacious, too hot in August however, with a hottub for and extra $30/day. Cell phone coverage was spotty due to this massive concrete structure. Security is adequate, with only one entrance into the small lobby, almost everyone must pass by the front desk to access the elevators. My only complaint is that the hotel was noisier than most; at 2 am some patrons made noise in the atrium which echoed into our room. At 5am on a monday, garbage trucks moved their way through the small streets and this too echoed up the balcony into the room..... otherwise, for the special price and location it is a beautiful and classic Grove hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wife loved it!”
Reviews.Author: blkfireman38
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the Mayfair Hotel and Spa for her birthday celebration week. We were extremely satisfied with everything the Mayfair had to offer. The room was top notch, very friendly staff, walking distances to everything (Starbuck's, 24 Hour Fitness, Cheesecake Factory, Improv Comedy, shopping, and etc.) I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to get away from the Southbeach hustle. My wife and I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Value”
Reviews.Author: c1paterson
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that crushes you on the extras. It was $26 to park there (as though parking in Miami is as scarce as New York City). It was $110 for two hamburgers and a few drinks. It was $5 for a Snickers bar for gosh sakes! The food at the buffet for the event we attended at the hotel was marginal for the price tag, and you needed a chainsaw to cut the beef. Seriously, my knife could not get through it. Also, the salad dressing was thicker than plaster of paris I will say that the rooms were well appointed, except that, once again, if you wanted to USE the SPA in the room/balcony, it was another $30. That did not include cleaning the crud out of the bottom. If you want to charge high prices then the quality should match the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JandJ468
Reviews.Content: I traveled with extended family. Four of us stayed in the two-bedroom suite at the Mayfair. It was very reasonably price (considering 4 of us were paying) and the amenities were just wonderful. The room was comfortable and very *very* relaxing. The poolside cabanas were a plus.... Location is great -- right outside the hotel are great bars/restaurants/shops. Couldn't have asked for a better location. This was a truly beautiful stay at one of the more beautiful hotels at which I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Girls spa weekend.”
Reviews.Author: GRKerriB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a spa weekend getaway. The overall accommodations to the great location right across the street from Coco Walk went above and beyond my expectations. When we first pulled in from the airport we were immediately greeted with a warm reception and very helpful staff. We were also upgraded to an executive suite room after we requested a quiet location. It was wonderful: ) The room was huge, comfortable beds, flat screen TV, large patio with chaise lounge and Jacuzzi tub, clean modern bathroom. The hotel overall was in excellent shape and very unique. Jurlique spa was a wonderful relaxing experience. The pool was very lovely as well along with the attentive staff. I have nothing negative to say about our stay and Iâ€™m a somewhat critical traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Raqdeb76
Reviews.Content: We stayed there to celebrate New Years Eve and Valentines Day. They deserve the 4 diamond rating!!! Amazing, fantastic service. The rooms were super clean and beautiful - flat screens, in-room jazzuci's, beautiful bathroom. The in -house steak house - Anglos & Maxins - was great service and food. The spa was wonderful and very relaxing. I would highly recommend this hotel over and over again. They have wonderful packages for couples. Also they have the Cabana One club/bar on the rooftop now which is totally cool.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel, great little neighbourhood, good base for a Miami stay”
Reviews.Author: Fikoukla
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times now, on business trips in Miami. I don't know who found the hotel, it's a strange one, but surprisingly nice and I'd definitely recommend it as a good base for a Miami trip (if you don't want to be in South Beach). Inside the rooms surround two Spanish tiled courtyards filled with plants and fountains. The rooms are all called 'suites' and are a decent size. The all seem to have these large terraces with Japanese hot-tubs on them - which they tell you they will get up and running for $30. I've never taken them up on the offer so I can't comment! Quite odd though, as you can see into the windows of the offices across the street. The terraces are screened with bamboo so I don't think they can see in :) There's a pool up on the roof which is a little intimidating with it's mix of the beautiful people hanging out there drinking mojitos. I think the best thing about the hotel is that it's in a really nice little neighbourhood, so you can easily walk out and get a coffee, a meal, watch a film, without having to get a taxi anywhere. There's even a nice independent bookshop - a rariety in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star All the Way!”
Reviews.Author: erin5wilson
Reviews.Content: A Four Star hotel, that truly deserves a solid four stars. 1) This hotel is beautiful. The decor is very modern and tranquil, and I have only good things to say about it. The bathroom also won points for me, because it was HUGE and had a million mirrors... oh, and a flat screen TV. This way I could look at myself while watching a movie - all at the same time. 2) As you may have read in other reviews, each room has a balcony with a hot tub. It would be necessary for me to add that these hot tubs are very outdated and gross, and are not free to use. You are charged $30 for each set-up (for every individual use, lasting 6hrs)... a set-up that you have to call the front desk for, and takes one full hour to prepare. Maybe it's just me, but doesn't that ruin the mood a bit? By the time all that happens, I'm ready for a nap or some pizza. Not worth it. 3) The location is wonderful, and ideal for those wanting to explore Coconut Grove by foot. It's adjacent to what is deemed Restaurant Row, where many charming sidewalk cafes and clothing shops are located. There is also a Starbucks, AMC theater, Chili's and Hooters next door. No need to even use a cab when staying here, because there is so much to do. If you do decide to hop in a cab and make your way to South Beach, note that it's going to cost you $40 to get there ($80 round trip). Not cheap. 4) The noise is an issue with this hotel. Every maid cart and drunken 21 year old that rumbled by the door was heard very distinctly, and successfully interfered in sleepy time. Just be prepared for that.. not ideal for light sleepers. 5) The pool was a bit shady. All the lounge chairs and towels were used up by a bunch of college kids who were friends with the waitress and bartender. They were not guests at the hotel, and it was very annoying and unprofessional. It is a rooftop pool that is fairly nice, however it is very small - there is no room for this kind of child's play. Not cool. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting Coconut Grove because of the decor and location alone. The experience was delightful, and hands down the best place to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair overated”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayfair for 4 nights. Found the best rate on easyclick travel, which the hotel directly would not match which seems a little odd. The location is near to Miami airport and the location is good for restaurants and bars. Parking is very expensive at the hotel and you can find much cheaper parking in the nearby parking garages. The staff were friendly and overall polite, customer focused and friendly. The hotel suites do not live up to the spec or standard on their website and I was slightly disappointed with the room. This hotel did not pass my dust test and the pictures and headboard on the bed had thick dust. The huge TV is great and the balcony with your own hot tub is great apart from you pay an additional $30 to have this filled. Half way through our stay it was emptied and not refilled. We were not left any instructions how to operate this. The linens on the bed are lovely and true quality. The hotel did not replenish the shower gel and I had to ask twice for this. The lighting controls in the room are extremely poor, you can not control most of the lights from a switch. I was on the 5th floor and Wi-Fi was not accessible from the room, you had to either stand outside the room or go into the lobby but they had connection problems and the service was almost nonexistent. I did inform the staff but nothing was done. The roof top bar is very nice however it has strange hours. One night it will close at 3am and then the next by 8pm it closes. Overall I would not personally recommend this hotel for the price paid. If it was a reasonable price I would but I believe for the cost you could find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair just fair!”
Reviews.Author: romeWi_
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa was "just fair". The positives: Maxie's Restaurant (particularly the Ribeye and the "Souffle' for Two"), the location-minutes from shopping/restaurants and nightlife, the room was spacious and Jerry was very helpful with any thing we needed. The negatives: The hot tub in the room was sooo dirty, we didn't even consider using it. The wireless Internet was "spotty" at best. The Cabana One bartender working during the day was clearly "hungover" from the night before. Service during "daylight hours" seemed to be an imposition! They also ran out of towels at the pool on both Friday and Saturday. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!!!!! They also let a group renting a cabana "crank" their own boombox over the "house music". Street noise/hotel noise made sleeping impossible on Friday and Saturday nights!

Reviews.Title: “Want the Hottub- May need to go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Traveler100077
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair location was great. We liked the idea of a romantic time in the outdoor hottub. Well, the hottub did not work (which by the way - they charge you $30 to use). The next morning we were told the hottubs are old and their not working is a common problem - this is a poor excuse. THEY SHOULD NOT ADVERTISE IT AS ONE OF THE AMENITIES. This is one of the reasons were decided to spent my birthday weekend there. Very disappointing and the staff response was not any better. The furniture was also worn and not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, not for relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: Andz123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay here to be close to some friends, and were very excited about the location. Right near downtown Coconut Grove, near shopping, tons of food, book stores, etc. Location CANNOT be beat. However - the first 2 nights of our stay (of 3 nights) the room next door to us decided to stay awake and party the entire night screaming at the top of their lungs. After calling security 4 times each night (which fell on deaf ears), they finally checked out on night 3. At the end of our stay, I negotiated a night off the bill with the manager and was told, "We're not the place to stay for a relaxing weekend." So relaxation-seekers beware...

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: cakins71
Reviews.Content: Mayfair Hotel is pretty decent, but not the best. We got a great deal on this hotel and it had pretty good reviews on here. So here is my list of the best and the worst of the hotel. The Good - Location is cool. Restaurants and Shops within walking distance. The inprov comedy club is right around the corner. cheescake factory, chilis, hooters, johnny rockets, fat tuesdays, bice bistro and plenty of smaller restaurants within short walking distance. The hotel is about 10 minutes from downtown and it is easy to get to highways if you are driving. - Valet service was quick. anybody that has had bad valet service knows this is a true plus. we never waited longer than a few minutes for our car - Hotel amenities (spa and cabana bar). We utilized the spa that was int he hotel. It was great and very nice. Pricey but still worth it. The roof top cabana bar was jumpin on saturday night. It was like a nightclub for real! The music was good and well attended. We wound up going somewhere that was real wack in Northern Miami..when we could have just taken the elevator up to a nice party. - Guest services was prety quick in responding to our request. A couple of times we couldn't get anybody on the phone. I give them a B on this. - Price of the room was pretty reasonable. The room we had was pretty large with a jacuzzi in it. (Website said terrace, butt we didn;t have a terrace at all) - Very nice staff - Very spacious bathroom in our room. - Flat screen in the bathroom. The Not So Good: - No wireless internet or internet in our room!!!!! They had wireless on the first two floors and then the signal dies on the third floor. This is the reason why I wouldn't stay again. I have to have my internet when i'm out of town! - Concierge service was useless. I'm used to going to a hotel where the concierge is very knowledgeable of the area. Maybe the guy was new...i'll give him a benefit of a doubt. - The Bed Sheets/Towels were pretty dingy. The matress had a lot to be desired. The comforter on the matress seemed to always come from user the sheets :( I guess it was how the bed was made up. We saw spots on our sheets the first night. Unfortunately we didn't go to bed until 5am LOL...so we had to call up new sheets and remake the bed ourself. - The room had a distinct odor. It was kind of a closed off smell. The hotel has a open atrium area, so the hotel was very humid, including the inside the room. So i'm guesing that was the reason for the smell. - The rooms are not sound proof at all...you can hear everything in the hallway. Plus if you are light sleeper, weekend nights might be difficult for you if you go to bed early. Street noise and people socializing doesn't bother me at all. Now hallway noise is bothersome cause it sounded like they were knocking on our door LOL. I give the hotel a C-. Pretty much because of the lack of internet in part of the hotel and dingy towels/sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBramble
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gotten some bad reviews, mainly because of the construction and exterior noise. Well, let me assure you that the construction in this hotel is over, and there was no noise from my room. We stayed in the Bridal Suite - room 558 - on Saturday April 4th and my wife stayed there the night before as well. The room was HUGE - 1 large sitting room, 2 full bathrooms and separate HUGE jacuzzi inside just off the Master Bedroom. Everything was clean and nicely appointed. I would suggest that the hotel think about updating some of the furniture (especially in the highend, larger suites). Also, it would be a nice touch to have fresh flowers in the room, especially for a 4 star. We had both our wedding ceremony and reception in the hotel. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel for such an occasion, as it is large enough, well appointed and fairly reasonable for what you get. Ulla is exceptional in her position as Director of Catering. She went out of her way to add a few special touches to our wedding. She even sent complimentary room service to our room after the wedding because she knew we didn't eat very much throughout the night. The only problem the WHOLE evening, was that they didn't refill the Heineken Light often enough at the bars during the reception (not a big deal though). The Valet staff could be friendlier, but when my sister arrived, they called her by name right after they opened her door. She asked "How did you know it was me?" and they told her that they knew when she was flying in and when she would probably arrive at the hotel. That was an excellent touch! Overall a great hotel, but wouldn't recommend for someone that is in bed before 10pm because there is a night club on the roof by the pool and it gets pretty packed on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Really interesting but....”
Reviews.Author: WhyAScreenName
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying in this hotel simply because it truly is a one of a kind place, year ahead of it's time. It felt more like Goudi inspired than Thailand inspired. It was the gem of Miami in the 70's and 80's and obviously suffered from age. However, it recently went through a marvelous transformation and really is very nice. We snagged a great deal from travelzoo.com and got a room for $159 a night for Friday/Saturday. Do not lift the lid of the hottub on your balcony as it is very dated, puke green in color and chipped....not clean looking. They need to just get rid of them all. The pool area is awesome, very south beach-like but not heated. Our room was as far away from the center area because of noise concern but of course, we had a nightclub outside our window and the boom boom started and lasted till the wee-hours. That was replaced with guys yelling and displaying their testosterone as guys who binge drink do. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Very nicely located, exceptionally attentive staff and great deal made our stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “great design for the style savy........”
Reviews.Author: nancylarry
Reviews.Content: We were nervous booking this hotel based on the previous reviews, but we had such a terrific offer on reservetravel.com that we went ahead and booked over the christmas holiday. we were in town to visit family. > > This is one of the most uniquely designed hotels I've ever stayed in. The style is art noveau, with beatiful metal work and sandstone design. I felt like I was in Barcelona. There is an open courtyard in the center and the rooms surround morrocan tiled fountains and tall palms and foliage. > Each hotel room door is carved wood of a different flower, and each room given a name to correspond to the flower. we were upgraded to an executive suite room on the fifth floor at the far end of the hotel. the room was very spacious with a private balcony and tub. the bedding is wonderful egyptian cotton and the bath very spacious with two sinks. the shower and tub are combined, but not a problem for us as the bathroom was open and airy. we had a whole wall of windows which came with black out curtains to keep out the morning sun. > We were very happy with the hotel, staff, condition. Yes, the floors are tiled and my feet got dirty when I walked around the room, but I asked the maid to wash them for us and after that > it was fine. Just wear the slippers they provide - no big deal. > The palm frond brushing against the elevator did NOT ruin my time. > I did have a problem with the musty smell. They need to provide scented candles (i went and bought one) and the street noise can be loud on the weekends. But yes, it is coconut grove, and it's part of the scene. > This is a fun funky hotel - so much more unique than staying at the doubletree or courtyard. Just go for it!!! But be sure to have them wash the floor for you and ask for a quiet room away from the restaurant and rooftop area. by the way, an Angelo's and Maxi's just opened in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Bucking the trend - I liked the Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: seejanework
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Mayfair, including New Year's Eve. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are a good size, modern and clean. We really liked the attached outdoor area, which created more living room space. It's location (especially the proximity to Starbucks) is great. It's a great area in which to walk around - many shops and restaurants. The room rate was very fair. We did not have any noise issues, though some friends did have problems. On New Year's eve, they were pretty much unable to sleep due to the noise from the party at Cabana One.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away loud music from rooftop club till 3 am both nights”
Reviews.Author: melges
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Mayfair on business. The noise from the rooftop club Cabana One keep me up till 3:00am both nights. Staff was pleasant, but could do nothing to help with the loud music from their rooftop club.

Reviews.Title: “Really needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but really showing the signs of its age. Service was good as was the food, but the main areas were in need of a lick of paint. The internal guttering around the courtyard was hanging off. Only one of the two glass elevators was working and was brushing against a palm tree on the way up. The rooms were fine, but again tired. Shower tap wouldnt stay in one position hence the shower would get cold. The bedroom door was very old and whilst you couldn't hear any noise from the rooms either side you could hear everything from the atrium. The doors should be replaced with sound proof doors. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. But they are let down by a hotel which for its catagory star rating falls short due to its age and lack of investment or updating. One real positive was the room pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair Getting Better; Remodeling Almost Done”
Reviews.Author: WillRogers
Reviews.Content: We booked our conference at the Mayfair in 2006. We saw it decline and go through a change of ownership and remodeling and the numerous complaints during this process. We were very nervous bringing in 180 people for a conference for 4 days on 10/08. What was good: . Front desk registration and staff . Meeting ballroom . New pool on the roof - beautiful . Exhibit and eating areas . Close to Grove restaurants, entertainment and shops . Rooms were clean . Staff was responsive. Very good. . The hotel broadcast our DVD conference program in-house on a designated TV channel. What was not good: . They were still 2 weeks away from completing remodeling. Work still being done on entrance, hotel restaurant and stairs. . Elevators were spotty . Food was just average . The hallway floors are tiles and noisy when carts and luggage pulled over them. . Difficulty in getting wash cloths (wash rags) on a daily basis . Food served on the roof for pool is brought up the house elevators from the second floor. Interferes with guest traffic. . Noise from the night spots could ofetn be heard during the night - but that's Coconut Grove. It's party land. Overall, the hotel is bouncing back. By December 1, it should be pretty much finished. Would I go back? Yes, but I would have said NO six months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad...but would not comeback anyway”
Reviews.Author: Marie49125
Reviews.Content: I can easily understand some of the reviews left by fellow tripadvisor community members. The Mayfair probably had its days back in the eighties...it has the style of a "SIAM Hotel in thaildand back in 1982". We changed room several times in 4 days... PROS -Staff is very friendly (reception & cleaning) -Rooms are large and has nice balcony, fridge, coffee maker, robes -Great bathroom & amenities (products) -Proximity of CocoWalk CONS -Pet friendly, smell of dogs and barking dogs -Constuction site (of a very nice cabanas & pools) on rooftop -Open sky hotel so it is always musty, humid an hot in corridors (and I can understand why they could have problem with bedbugs since they have woods everywhere, although we did not have this problem ourselves, but did verify bedding first thing before settling down) -Smell of gaz/carbon from the construction site coming to room -Noise (if room by street/cocowalk) -$30 to use the jaccuzzy Did not use the parking valet as it is expansive, prefered the garage inf front of the hotel. Overall not that bad, but considering a "4 stars & spa" it's not quite you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: onlyonelaw
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I thought I had stayed at a completely different hotel. We chose this place as it was pet friendly and we had our puppy with us. We usually stay at FourSeasons/ Grand Hyatt and other select 5star hotels around the world. However, I wanted to stay in the Grove and away from everything and thought I would give this place a try. Maybe we missed lots of drama and maybe they stepped up their efforts because we arrived to a very polite and attentive reception. They were very informed when it came to giving information. The porter was extremely friendly and spotless room greeted us. We never did use the jacuzzi so can't offer comment on it. We had a supercar with us and were required to park at the front of the hotel, valet conditions. They charged quite a bit more than the usual valet fee, which didn't really make sense the valets never actually drive the car, you just put it in a spot opposite the entrance when you arrive. This was my only complaint, but the car was safe.. and not driven by anyone so I made no fuss. Judging by our experience, I would absolutely stay there again without hesitation. I hope the negative reports on here are a thing of the past.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: JimBriigette
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Mayfair hotel Coconut Grove Miami last year The area was nice and the hotel was exellent,Until we had stayed acouple of nights we noticed, we were being eaten by bed bugs On pulling the covers back we could see them We reported it to front desk ,but a little spray and new sheets will not get rid of them. The Hotel needs Fumigating. Apart from that spoiling our stay ,We could not fault the hotel. James Lindop jimandbrigette@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Mucho grande dissappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: brianrucks
Reviews.Content: Checked in on April 3rd for Sony Ericcson tennis tournament.Staff was dull and unwelcoming. It felt like we were entering a dark, damp, cave. No help with luggage and had to steer around construction workers. Room was poorly lit with huge coffe/urine?stain on wall.TV did not work called front desk (english clearly a foreign language!) floor was gritty and room felt dingy. Left that evening for tennis match only to realize our shuttle driver was clearly intoxicated. Awoke the next morning to the sound of ringing jack hammers outside our front door. After a long hot day of tennis we had hoped for a restfull night sleep- not possible at the Mayfair. Our room vibrated with the sound of music. Finally on day of check out upon retreiving our $30 per day valet parked car we discoverd our daughter Jordan's brand new i pod was stolen from the car. Our calls to the hotel remain unanswered. Needless to say, for us, its hasta la vista Mayfair and shame on Sony Ericcson for their recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Never again - dirty, noisy and not a plesant experience”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_jm_gray
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Mayfair. My friend had stayed there years ago and recomended it. Well - it may have been great 20 years ago - but it certainly isn't now. The floor in our room was so dirty that if you didn't wear anything on your feet, they were black after 5 minutes. The room was quite dark as well. The experience wasn't improved by all the construction noise going on in the pool area. The tap broke off the bath in my hand the first time I used it! In the main, the whole place looked tired. It needs more than a refurb. I would just knock the place down and start again. The plants in the central atrium looked like they were all a bit past their day as well - adding to the whole 'seen better days' impression that the hotel leaves one with. Service was ok - although we didn't eat in the hotel. We had breakfast in the room one day - which was very expensive and pretty mediocre. It also took about 30 minutes to collect our cases from our room when we were leaving for the airport - which was annoying. It wasn't the worst experience ever - but there surely must be much nicer places to stay in Coconut Grove than the Mayfair and I certainly would not ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !!!!”
Reviews.Author: OutsideNycStevie
Reviews.Content: Do I wish I had read about this place before this past weekend...my wife and I were in town for the weekend, and based on location and price selected The Mayfair. When we checked in, we were informed of having the "honeymoon suite" and thought "Great". Well the room was pretty nice with a huge hot tube and living area and dining area as well as a king bed. However, the lack of carpeting made it necessary to always wear socksor slippers due to a grit on the marble, maybe from all the construction. Someone said they have been working on this hotel for over 4 years. The single biggest problem here was the noise. Simply put, our 4th floor room seemed like in the midlle of Times Square. Coconut Grove is a lively place at night with Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights like New Year's Eve, with crowds and noise until 4 AM. My parents were at the Ritz, two blocks away, for this weekend and their room, although not as large and appointed and little more costly, was much much better. Plus, it cost us almost $30 dollars per night to park..something I never budgeted for.

Reviews.Title: “CONSTRUCTION Again!”
Reviews.Author: Spacesales
Reviews.Content: I stay here once in a while because of rates. The rooms 2 years ago were in great shape. The hotel gets dirtier and dirtier by the day. WORSE, is its once again a construction site! Noisy, jack hammering, etc. I guess they are adding some expansion to the roof. its a dust bowl of dirt! There is NO staff??? I dont get it? Wear your shoes and bring something to walk around. its so dirty your feet will feel GROSS. The rooms dont have carpet and still SMELL LIKE MOLD. the glass is paper thin so you hear every car with music turned up. The hot tubs never work. I swear even if $50 room rate I wouldnt stay here anymore. It has gone from bad to worse

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: tripper28
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about staying at this hotel after seeing the pictures. Our first night there, while out late at a club, we were robbed. Someone got into our room and grabbed $1500 worth of jewelry (which I could not put in the safe as it was shut and I was told that there was no technician available to open it at 10 pm when we checked in). There was no sign of forced entry which means this person had easy access. I spent one whole day of my 2 day trip talking to cops. Our neighbor gave testimony that someone walked into their room at 3 am that same night using a key-card but left when he saw them sitting in their beds. Despite all this, the hotel did nothing to compensate us. They flatly said that it was not their responsibility and that we could sue them if we wanted. Terrible terrible experience!! I've been to a Motel 6 that I would rate higher than this piece of junk. Other cons: The hot tub in our balcony did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: SofiaReiziger
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights to attend the Key Biscayne tennis tournament. First the good points: -- Location: very conveniently located within walking distance to all tourist attractions such as malls, restaurants and a book store/coffee shop. No need to rent a car since the parking fee was 25 USD a night. -- Bed & Bath: good mattress with smooth and soft sheets. The bathroom was spacious with first class amenities and thick towels. -- Big screen plasma TV -- Balcony: convenient for smokers since smoking was not allowed inside the room. Now the bad points: Very noisy -- From the construction: workers started around 7:30-8:00 drilling on the rooftop. The hotel information booklet talked about a rooftop swimming pool scheduled to open in 2006! The drilling shook walls and was so loud that at checking counter on the first floor, we could not hear what the clerks said. Guest rooms were on higher floor and we were not the only ones complained. -- From hotel service people: on weekend, the sound of live music from ground floor came up the atrium made it impossible for relaxing or sleeping late. In the morning, cleaning and maintenance folks made ruckus dragging service carts on tiled floor in hallways -- From neighbor apartments/condos and the surrounding malls: people yelling and fighting into wee hours, cars screeching and honking. -- Slow internet connection: the hotel claimed to have wireless connection but the signal was so slow that guests had hard time getting connected. The alternatives were to use the business center computer and got charged by the hour or unplugged the TV, used its hardwire connection and got charged also. Some people took laptops to the lobby but it was very crowded with only a few chairs. Best alternative was taking your laptop to the bookstore next door, their wireless was free and their coffee and pastries were great. --The room we had was so small that it could barely fit a king bed. The hotel may have bigger and quieter rooms but they did not assign those to folks getting rooms through the tennis tournament travel service.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, tired too pricy lacking in promised atmosphere and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chancere
Reviews.Content: Sheets felt inferior, peebly. Duvet and pillows were dingy. Jacuzzi was broken; the chair next to it was dingy. The air conditioning controls were not satisfactory, and I came home with a sinus infection. I doubt that it is a coincidence. The pool was not available. I knew that when I went, but not when I booked. By the time I found out, it was too late to get another hotel. A loud party in the center of the lobby kept us awake. No laundry bags or service were provided. The meal and service in the Ginger Grove Restaurant were great. The computer was down so our credit card was charged for the actual fee plus an additional hold. The telephones for services did not work. One had to call the front desk on speaker phone for services. The wake-up call was pleasantly surprising. A person was on the other end wishing us a good morning. The people at the front desk were very pleasant and competent. Overall, I would not give this hotel above a 3 STAR. It has long ago seen its heyday, and is living on its past laurels. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful piece of serenity in the craziness Miami can be.”
Reviews.Author: EWertz
Reviews.Content: After a very sluggish start to a "Griswoldish" spring break with my wife and two kids. When I had the bright idea to take the family cross country in the family truckster little did I know what was in store. Luckily for us, I had taken the advice of my brother and called the Mayfair at the last minute and were fortunate enough to get a room there without having any reservations. The Mayfair is both sheik and comfortable at the same time. My two children of 11 and 7 enjoyed all the little charms of the hotel. Very clean, super friendly and informative staff, and wonderful little touches that come with really neat hotels. Plasma screen in wonderfully spacious bathroom, great outdoor jacuzzi on the balcony, super beds, great bar, quiet, safe, and more. The only knocks on the Mayfair would be the fact it doesn't have a swimming pool, they are construcing one as I write this. Two, a little pricey with some of the additional fees, parking, and the jacuzzi fee. I'm just not used to these costs being from the Midwest and having everything included when I go places. They weren't excessive just extra. All in all, a great place to stay and relax. Across the street from Coco Walk, and down the road from all Miami has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there! Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_75
Reviews.Content: This is really a tired looking hotel. We had a big room, but really tired looking. The dirty jacuzzy on the balcony is a joke. No one will sit in that! Anyway, most important reasons we will never go back there are: * place is very, very noisy! We wanted to go to bed early to catch an early flight, but we heard very loud music 'till 4 o'clock am. * we had housekeepers yelling at EVERY door at 11 pm (yes, we tried to sleep early) * staff was ok, but not very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful to look at and designed by a famous architect, but it is not functional. The staff can be heard moving furniture and crashing around beginning at 6 am for those rooms surrounding the atrium. You're no better off on the outside of the atrium, as others in our party complained about the partying at the bars across the street that went on until 3 or 4 am. Our tv didn't work, the "jacuzzi" was a joke (soft plastic lining?!), the patio terrace had dead plants and very unattractive. Location was good and bed was comfortable. My nephew was able to get a same-day massage that he said was very good. The board room was exceptional, with a wonderful breakfast for our business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: Simply maginificent hotel located in the middle of Coconut Grove. Doesn't look much from the outside but one you're through the door the rooms, set off two internal atria are spacious and really nice. Felt very pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy late at night and early morning”
Reviews.Author: vedado61
Reviews.Content: Service and overall experience is not up to par with a hotel of this rating. 1)Called guest services four separate times during a two day stay and phone was never answered, had to call the front desk and get them to intervene; still took more than 30 minutes to get request fulfilled 2)lobby bar service is very slow and only bartender left group of guests alone in the bar for more than 15 minutes, had to get the front desk to intervene 3)the noise from the streets is really loud from midnight to 3 a.m. and I was supposedly on the "quiet" side as well as the fact that during the renovations the jack hammers start at 7 a.m. so if you're on vacation...don't expect to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: 2Pets2Travel
Reviews.Content: Touted as one of the "Leading Hotels of the World" it was more than disappointing. The photos on the website don't do justice to the dirty rooms, the dead foliage view from your balcony and most disturbing, the discos across the street that stay open until 2 and 5am respectively. Althought the bedding was clean, the chairs, settee and outdoor patio furniture was stained and very old, completely uninviting. On Sunday morning, the housekeeping staff could be heard at 8am shouting "Housekeeping" from down the hall, walkie-talkie radios blaring. Obviously, the hotel wants you awake and checking out on their schedule, not yours! Finally, beware of the restaurant and bar gratuities automatically included at 18% on your bill, not itemized. We were able to get this adjusted out at check-out after a lengthly discussion. From a pet perspective, our two Coton de Tulears had their own dog bed, water and food bowls and a cookie covered in chocolate that was left on the floor that made them both sick. They tried, but are ovbiously not pet people even though they say they're the most pet friendly hotel around. There's a Starbucks around the corner and lots of shops and restaurants, so you're right in the middle of this under construction area. It was just not worth the stay for the price, I'd consider another property next time - too bad for them!

Reviews.Title: “Glitches are so unnecessary . . . who is paying attention??”
Reviews.Author: Kingpin26
Reviews.Content: Really nice facility, not 5-star, but as expected. High spots were great Coconut Grove location, easily walkable to very good restaurants and shops, lovely setting with tropical atrium and many creative touches and cool internet setup (never seen that one before). Why not perfect? So, so noisy . . . for two very unnecssary reasons. First, meeting rooms surround atrium and their setup begins at 0630, which means 'wake-up time' for anyone staying in the five floors around the atrium. . . carts full of coffee cups and saucer crashing over a Mexican tile floor . . . really a stupid setup. We're talking serious disruption. And, then the three-year-behind rooftop pool construction with (again) 0730 - 0800 start in construction. So, so dumb. Jackahmmers in a luxury hotel at 0800?? And, the last hiccup? a $25.00/day parking charge, which is pure larceny. I liked the good stuff but the bad stuff was really needless and unacceptable. If I was going to stay here again, I would want to make sure the negatives were resolved. At other experiences with LHW Hotels, these things would never happen. Never.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tjtrini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Beautiful rooms, and interior courtyard with zen gardens and sitting areas. My husband and I live in Miami and stayed there on our wedding night. We had an executive suite and it did in fact have a large sitting area big enough to entertain at least 4-5 people. The suite also had a beautiful private patio with chinese a hottub. We had a reservation for one night but we loved the hotel so much that we stayed an additional night. We have reservations to stay there for xmas.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Robert_In_the_City
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Coconut Grove and a really beautiful building, but as previously mentioned in some of the other reviews, the rooms, while spacious and nicely furnished, could have been cleaner and the staff definitely could have been more helpful. We just spent 4 days there and had to ask to get more than two fresh towels per day and the bed linens changed at all, which was unexpected. Housekeeping did the absolute minimum . . . Unfortunately, we had a personal item worth about $30 stolen from the room. It wasn't a big deal but the front desk person got really defensive when I mentioned it. Also, I had difficulty reaching anyone in guest services by phone. All in all I am not sure that we would bother with this one again. I think there are better values for the money in the area. I really wouldn't rate this hotel 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not "Leading Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: onBusiness015
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good location, shopping nearby and 2 blocks from the water. Rooms are nice, spacious, flat TV. Staff is helpful and nice. Food is very good. However, internet connections is painfully slow, breakfast area is not comfortable, and the selection from the breakfast buffet is clear below average. Price/Value is still good, I can recommend the hotel. However, it is below "Leading Hotel" standard.

Reviews.Title: “A Great experience and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: CIP0707
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four days. We absolutely loved it. The room was very spacious, and clean, not to mention the decor was beautiful. The bathroom was very big, and had a romantic setting. Perfect room for romantic nights. We had a balcony/patio with a hottub that could haved used some tweaking. The water only warmed up a little but was fine considering the humidity at the time of our stay. My only complaint would be the hot tub and parking. We opted for valet parking which is $25/day, they are very friendly people. Our first night there, we had very rude and obnoxious people walking around the corridors, drunk and loud. There was a wedding that night, but that was no excuse to be disrespectful. I had to call security twice to shut them up. Its a short drive to the beach and plenty of restuarants just a cross the street. I only regret not staying longer. Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Difference Some Years Can Make”
Reviews.Author: Mari08
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the picture on the internet under Expedia for an Executive Suite is misleading. The Executive Suite does not have a sitting area. We asked to see a suite with a sitting area and the suite smelled horrible, not to mention we would have had to paid additional monies to upgrade. The suites are nice and clean. The bed was not the most comfortable and the pillows were flat and small. The partying noise coming from another suite made it impossible to sleep. Another guest most have complained because about an hour later, the noise subsided. There is no working pool in the hotel, so forget about having a cold drink and reading a nice book next to the pool. We stayed here some years ago the night of our wedding before embarking on our honeymoon to Hawaii. I can honestly tell you that it is not the same Mayfair we used to know and love. Although they did a nice job with the upgrades, the quality has declined immensely. In our suite, although they upgraded, they kept the old antique piano, not sure why, it does not match the decor. The area has lots of restaurant, but nothing extraordinary. It was nice to be able to walk across the street and catch a movie. All-in-all, the quality is definitely not the same and we will not be returning to this hotel anytime soon. We would consider it should the quality improve greatly. For now, we will keep the memories of the Mayfair we knew once upon a time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jettsmommy
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is a beautiful hotel that I would recommend to anyone who is staying in the area. I was there for business and loved my room. It was very clean, exceptionaly maintained and tastefully decorated. The hot tub on the balcony was great after a long day of work.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury pet friendly option”
Reviews.Author: mwinram
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic value last minute deal. Hotel is very definitely a style of its own, and the rooms are dark because of the style, but the standard of our suite was fantastic in terms of decor and fittings. Nice local location although we spent most of our time heading into South Beach, for which you need a car (or to spend a lot on taxis). As a pet friendly but luxurious hotel this was fantastic value - and worth staying out of South Beach for.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: nicole54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our last night back from a cruise for our honeymoon. Room is bery spacious. stayed in a deluxe suite. 3 tv's. one in each room, including the bathroom. Bathroom very large, with double sinks and deep bathtub. rainforest showerhead. very quiet and relaxing. beds very comfortable. balcony did have japanese tub and a hammock. staff were very friendly. we were able to check in around 10am for a $25 fee, which was fine with us. only drawback is the floor. because there are no rugs, dirt gets tracked everywhere. i would recommend taking off your shoes at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: tab00007
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the mixed reviews I was a little unsure about the Hotel, but now realize it was the right choice. What a beautiful Hotel very soothing noise from the serene waterfall noises coming from the atrium in the center of the hotel. My husband and I decided to stay here for our 1yr wedding anniversary. Very close to everything in Coconut Grove, much closer than all other Coconut Grove hotels listed. Room was Big and Comfortable, nice touch with the plasma t.v's in room and bathroom. Balcony was great very hidden with all the trees and palms covering the room from the street. Hotel seems to be maintained nicely. Only thing that could have been better, is the cleaning of the rooms, specifically the bed linens, they seemed to be a little dusty, and bathtub could have been cleaner, only mentioning this because it is not a cheap hotel to stay at for a couple of days, so you do expect a little better than average. Parking tip, if $25 valet parking is to much for you, there is a parking garage two blocks from the hotel, with over night parking for only $9. The one across the street is $17over night, so it is a great savings. Paid the $17 for the first night, not realizing the other parking was cheaper, but now we know for next time. I wil definately pick this hotel for my next visit to coconut grove.

Reviews.Title: “Need Pampering? This is THE Place”
Reviews.Author: SLHGalen
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Miami area 2-3 times a year for medical treatment. This year, have had to visit more often, and discovered the Mayfair: Now, we stay ONLY at the Mayfair and consider it to be the premium hotel in the greater Miami area. The STAFF are absolutely amazing, (on our second visit, we were greeted by them all with "WELCOME BACK" and they knew what we liked and made sure we got exactly that). The rooms are luxury, the bathrooms pure heaven, the beds wonderful and totally comfortable, and the terrace with Japanese Soaking Tub, a wonderful retreat. Cocowalk area, however, CAN be noisy. There may be a party that can be heard into the night: Bring some of your favorite CD's and play some quiet music to block those sounds.
