Whatever you do: ORDER the lemongrass creme brulee (6.00) from room service -- you Will come back for more. The best part of the Mayfair: the people. They are well-trained, attentive and treat even your PETS like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair is a class act”
Reviews.Author: kueric09
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the rooms at this hotel. They were huge with a couple of huge flatscreen TVs (plus one in the bathroom). A private balcony with a little hot-tub made the room that much more personal and individual. It only continued the feel that you expirienced when walking in: a feel of being in a paradise in the middle of the city. The atrium had wonderful plants and flowers all over making it feel more like Hawaii than Miami. I also loved the way they held true to the asian decor, not just in the lobby and front desk, but in the rooms, at the restaurant, etc. A great stay and a great hotel all around. I was very impressed. the only negatives I could muster are that there is no pool (however they are building a rooftop pool right now, but kudos to the management as I heard 0 contstruction during my stay). Also the location is great with SO much to do in a half mile radius.

Reviews.Title: “A nice (but not great) hotel in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I just returned last night from a weekend stay at the Mayfair Hotel & Spa in Coconut Grove, Florida, which is about ten to fifteen minutes south of Miami. The hotel is located right across from Cocowalk, which has some restaurants, shops, and a movie theater and is a popular weekend party spot. There is an Improv comedy club nearby along with a Starbucks, lots of little restaurants, etc.... In the middle of the hotel is an open-air area with lots of plants, trees, vegetation, and fountains and the "hallways" to all the rooms are outside as well. This makes for a beautiful setting but in Miami in the summer I personally would prefer an air-conditioned hallway. Also, these "hallways" and the individual rooms are tile floored and when you are in your room you can hear noise from outside your room. Assuming my room was typical, the rooms are large and have a large, flat-screen television along with a couch, chair, table & chairs, coffee table, and small outdoor patio with a personal jacuzzi and covered couch. The personal jacuzzi is a nice touch, but I really didn't use it very much. The remote to my television for in-room movies didn't work and I called the front desk to have it replaced. Someone from maintenance came up to the room and rather than replacing the remote, tried to fix something on the back side of the TV to get this feature to start working "in about 10 minutes" and left. Watching movies wasn't that much of a priority for me so I didn't call back to say it was still not working, when after 10 minutes it was still not working. The rooms are large, but mine was not a suite. If I had brought my family and had expected/hoped that there would be separate room (like I would get in suite hotels) for my children I would have been disappointed. As a single, business traveler it was fine. I didn't use the restaurant or spa, but otherwise the service was very good. There was an erroneous restaurant charge on my bill that was removed by the front desk person at checkout without any problem. I would certainly recommend this hotel and it is on par with Hilton/Marriott/Doubletree/Hyatt/etc... Finally, there is no pool. I heard that they may be constructing a pool and have been for a while but I have no idea where they would fit a pool and there was no sign of construction going on that I could see.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: JetShopper
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel through a package deal thinking that the Mayfair would be pretty upsale with a nice spa and pool. Unfortunately, we were dissapointed. After checking in at 1AM (our flight was delayed) we were informed by the front desk that room service was closed and the only place to eat would be Johnny Rockets around the corner. That wouldn't have been as dissapointing had we felt more comfortable with the deco/atmosphere to begin with. It's not an unbearable hotel, but if you're used to staying in truely 4 star hotels, then this is cutting it a bit short. We checked out the next day for the Ritz, and ended our stay in Miami on a very high note. Also, I'm not so familiar with Miami, but in my opinion the only place to stay is South Beach if you're looking for some beach and nice shopping. (The Mayfair is a good 20 minute drive costing about $30 to South Beach, and there's no pool)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, convenient location, noisy, ants!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtraveler29
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for this hotel. In some ways they were met, but in others we were dissapointed. We booked a suite because we were traveling with our young son and needed the extra space. The room was nicely remodeled with wicker furniture, plasma tv's (2!), luxury bed linens and a spacious bathroom. The hot tub on the deck was very relaxing at the end of a busy day. We specifically asked for a quiet room after having read previous posts about the noise problems. I honestly don't think the staff could have picked a more noisey room for us. We were directly across from a club in Coco Walk and could hear dance music all night in our living room. Thankfully b/c we had a suite we were able to shut the french doors from the living room to our bedroom and cut off some of the noise... if you're booking a regular room however, beware. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful as are all the fountains. The pool was closed for renovation during our stay so I can't comment on that. Most of the staff we incountered were rude with the expection of one very nice male concierge who very graciously brought our luggage to our room, brought us ice for the ice bucket, recomended restaurants for dinner, etc. Too bad all his female counterparts, as well as the front desk staff, had attitudes. They also could not (or would not) accomodate our many requests for an early check-in. Check-in at this hotel is 4pm which I consider rather late. We have a toddler and our mere presence in the lobby while waiting to get into our room seemed to annoy most of the staff. The biggest issue we incountered were ants in our room. Lots of them! We did have snacks in our room for our son, but we made sure we kept them closed up and off the floor. By the second day we were there, they were everywhere. I know this is the tropics but it's still not an issue you expect to deal with at a "high end" hotel. If you are looking for upscale rooms in the center of Coconut Grove then consider this hotel, just don't expect it to be truly "luxury." By the way, it costs $20 a day to park your car here, even if you're a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Noise not a problem-pleased with hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayfair for 3 nights, April 27, 28, 29, 2007. We got a good deal at Travelocity--$159 per night for the Executive Suite, which is the mid range room. The normal cost for this room is $199 per night. I have posted a lot of photos of the hotel. Before booking I called the Mayfair directly and asked about noise problems, construction, etc. I was told that there was no construction in the hotel at this time, but that there was some construction across the street. I also learned that they assign rooms on the day of arrival and that there are more Exec. Suites than any other type of room so if you want to request a "quiet room" your chances of getting it would be better with the Exec. Suite. Midday on the day of our arrival I called the Mayfair, told them what time we'd be arriving and requested a king room in a quiet part of the hotel and that is exactly what we got. We were put on the 5th floor at the back side of the hotel which is the farthest away from CocoWalk. We had zero problems with noise from either construction or CocoWalk. I was awakened in the middle of one night by some loud people in the hallway outside the room, but they passed by quickly and I was not disturbed again. My husband didn't wake up at all to this. Our room was also at the end of the hall so we only had neighbors on one side, who we did not hear at all. Things we liked about the Mayfair: Room was very elegant , well appointed and clean. Marble floors were nice for us (though I expect they might be a little cold in the winter..no rugs at all.) Bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were high quality. Good pillows. Flat screen TV was good, liked the way it could be tilted in different directions. Nice to have a couch and chair/sitting area as well as a table and chairs. There was a microwave, small fridge and a safe. Lots of lamps and several were on rheostats so you could adjust the lighting. There were wine glasses and real glass coffee mugs and glasses (not just styrofoam or plastic). Complimentary Miami Herald delivered to the door (though not a full edition, it was still nice to have). There are lots of nice details at the hotel...every exterior door has a large carving that is unique and beautiful (see photos). There are plants everywhere and the hotel has a lovely tropical feel. Fun to ride up in the glass elevator and look out on the open air central part of the hotel filled with plants. Problems and small irritations: Biggest drawback was the inablity to get wireless internet on our laptop in the room. The signal was strong in the lobby on the first floor, but was completely absent in the room. The hot-tub was not the experience I'd hoped for..it is small and when both my husband and I got in together it overflowed and sent water cascading off the balcony. That felt embarrassing and I hoped there was nobody on the balcony below! It was OK but not really roomy enough for 2 people to be comfortable and we only used it the first night. We also only got 2 towels and had to ask for more. They came quickly, but I don't know why they couldn't put 4 towels in the room, especially since there is a hot tub that obviously would require a towel. Also, there are no ice machines and you have to call for ice to be delivered to the room. Being on the 5th floor was good for the noise, but all the lower rooms have thick plants that are growing up the wall beside the balcony so you would have the feel that you were in a jungle. The plants don't make it up to the 5th floor so you look out on a bare wall. Not a problem, really, but something to know. Maybe a 4th floor room on that side of the hotel would be quiet AND have the foliage. On the other hand, in a 5th floor room you don't have anybody in the room above you. And of course, there is no pool at the moment. This was well advertised so we were not surprised and I don't count this against the hotel as a "problem" since we knew that going in...I don't know what the hold-up is on the pool as they have been promising one for several years. There must be construction problems. We found the staff to be helpful, generally. The room was made up pretty early. One strange thing was that we followed their instruction to hang up towels if we didn't need them replaced but they always replaced them anyway so we didn't save the environment anything. (With the severe water shortages in Florida we should probably have mentioned this to the front desk.) We had a small problem with an overcharge regarding the valet parking but it was resolved. (We chose to pay $25 for valet parking the first day as we were tired and unloaded our bags and didn't want to hassle with figuring out parking then. The next day we checked out the parking garage across the street and decided to park there for the rest of the time. We were told to tell the valet guys that we were cancelling the service, but this didn't get communicated to the front desk so we were charged for 3 days. My husband dealt with this so I don't know how hard it was to get them to take the charge off, but they did it. ) We didn't eat in the restaurant (Ginger Grove, I think it is called) but some relatives who live in Coconut Grove said that it was very good and they recommend it. I wish we had tried it, but we heard this too late to fit it in. We did try to eat there for breakfast on Monday morning, but they were only serving a $17 buffet which was more than we wanted. We tried the little cafe (not associated with the hotel) directly across the street by the parking garage and didn't like it much. The coffee was terrible and we weren't charged for it. The guy was very apologetic and said we should have complained and he would have made more coffee..that the coffee was usually good so maybe there was a machine malfunction. The food was OK, but everything was on paper plates, paper cups, plastic utensils, etc. and wasn't what we were expecting. Overall, we had a great stay. We thought it was a very romantic spot and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Obscure, Expensive and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: wlf198
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure where some of these reviewers were staying, but I can't imagine I stayed in the same place they did. It is not quite, and certainly not Luxurious. It is acceptable. Not the best bed. The Hot tub is small and takes almost two hours to be usable. I tried getting extra towels( only two in the room), three tries and 24hrs later I got 2extra towels. We did not try the restaurant, but we did try to go to the pool, It was closed for "renovations" but I did not see anybody working on that area. It is in a very good location. Directly across the street from the CocoWalk Shopping center, and walking distance to most of all Coconut groove restaurants and shopping. My wife and I travel extensively, and are fortunate enough to have stayed at some very nice places around the world. This is not one of those. If you have business in the area, stay there, but as a romantic getaway...No way! They call themselves a four star hotel, not in my book! Three at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not as bad as I excepted!”
Reviews.Author: NavyWife007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 nights, (Pre-Cruise -Wednesday & Thursday before Easter) The room was very clean, nicely decorated. The bathroom is awesome; however I was not impressed with the positioning of the tub/shower. The cleaning staff very helpful and accomodating...they really need to switch positions with the front desk clerks. We did not eat at the hotel; however there are many great places to eat just across the street @ the Coconut Walk. One Caution - because Coconut Walk remains open pretty late, they are not open for business until around noon, so don't plan to eat any breakfast there. There is the most wonderful little cafe just across the street from the hotel. Sorry, I forgot the name! The owner and his staff are very friendly and kind...and the food was very tasty! Back to the hotel....I actually read many reviews prior to booking at this hotel and was concerned about the noise, but of course the hubby was all for it! His thought - "It will be loads of fun". I can say our stay at the Mayfair was very pleasant and even with all the activity that goes on across the street, I had no problem sleeping at all. And I am a very light sleeper. Maybe there is not as much noise during the week! Overall the hotel and price were comparable. I am a devote "Westin" or "W Hotel", but if I were in the area I would stay at the Mayfair again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, high price”
Reviews.Author: cs0815
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite. Nice interior design, more flat screen TVs than we needed. The hotel features a very nice architecture in the inner court. Arrival was busy with many cars to be served at the same time. The staff did a great job to stay on top of it. At night some noise due to a nearby party. Overall still a very nice and relaxing experience. The price seemed high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Saipu
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! The hotel service was good. The rooms were clean, smelled good and bed were fabulous. The beds at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa are templates as to how comfortable a bed should be. The access to rooms is nicely designed, where entrance is via balcony with open space in the center. The Jurlique Spa at the Mayfair is also fabulous. The entire staff treated me very good. Also, Mayfair Hotel and Spa is relatively close to CocoWalk, which is the entertainment epicenter of Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: lucho74
Reviews.Content: i've been ther before a cruise in april 2007. Very nice room and amazing bathroom. the jacuzzi on the balcony was ok, but not really necessary and useful. I used it. It's true that it's very warm and it takes 1 hour 1/2 to have it ready, so go out for dinner and use it when you come back as I did ! it's 100 m to cocowalk (many diffÃ©rent restaurants). we had our dinner at the cheesecake factory, which is a classic, and we had our breakfast in an other hotel (sorry I forget the name but it's a a well-known hotel, may be ramada), witch is on the left when you are out of the mayfair,. The restaurant is in a high level of the building with a wonderfull view and a terrace with a pool. We had no problem of noise in the mayfair and enjoyed our stay, even if we can't compare it with some "real" leadings hotels of the world. This one is a good hotel for a reasonnable price(200 $), but it's not luxuous, like a "leading" in Paris for example

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 84chevelle
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect except for our hot tub only having one setting and the hotel phone did not work. Everything else was perfect. Service which is something that a lot of people complain about was a worry but was fine. Room service was fast and China Grove food was real good! Room was extremely clean, very comfortable! The area is also real good. We parked across the street and was way cheaper. Also I had read a review about someone having the maid walk in on them, so when we heard a knock we rushed to the door by that time she had already tried to come in twice but we had the lock chain on the door and she turned away when we told her so. It did not happen again cause we had do not disturb sign on. Bring your own snack they charge $$$ for what they offer. overall it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Overall I'm satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 11-night stay at the Mayfair and overall I was pleased with this hotel. The location is perfect if you want access to a little shopping and great restaurants. I really like the decor and I appreciated that it never felt the hotel was overrun with guests. As a matter of fact, I barely saw guests in the lobby, in the gym or on the elevator. It was as if I had the hotel to myself for 2 weeks. Many have complained of the noise, and although I was on the top floor (5th) and not on the side that's considered the noisiest, I still often heard a lot of commotion outside. I sleep with the television on and even with that I could hear men swearing in the streets and the occasional thump of music. People who have complained of the noise is not exaggerating so be prepared. Strangley enough I chose this hotel to be near the action. Funny how that concept changes when you're longing for some shut eye at 4am! Overall I had a nice stay at the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel ruined by horrible service”
Reviews.Author: danjo70
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and every room has a little two-person Japanese soaker-style hot tub on the balcony. All of the rooms have sort of an Indonesian/Balinese feel to them, and they are all different. They are quite lovely, and this would be a great hotel if it wasn't for... The Eurosnob treatment. I only stayed one night to the tune of $400, and after a long, romantic evening, I had the lovely experience of the maid walking in on my lady and I in the morning--without even knocking. After I had to yell at her (because she spoke NO English), she went on to clean the next room, but she decided to leave the door's hinge lock out to keep the door from closing each time she went in and out. "Bang, Bang, Bang" is all we could hear for the next 20 agonizing minutes, and it was only 9am. When I mentioned this to the management, they really didn't seem to care too much. Basically an "Oh sorry. Too bad for you. Next?" kind of attitude. Actually, every employee I came in contact seemed to have an aire of "I'm too good to be serving you, so you should be lucky that we're letting you stay here." It is a shame, because they lost a lot of potential business from me that day. I will never stay there or recommend it to anyone. Especially not at that price--or any price for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management = Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cruise_Puppies
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel & spa for the spa! We were staying there for one night just before we left on our fantastic Panama Canal 11 night cruise on board the Brilliance of the Seas. We had an unpleasant experience at the Mayfair Hotel & Spa located in the heart of Coconut Grove. We arrived to employees who clearly did not care. I didn't meet one who deserved to even work at a Red Roof Inn let alone a Spa. When we checked in I was excited to have a manicure~ pedicure ~ and massage before we left on our cruise. Guess what? CLOSED! We asked why they didn't notify us when we called to confirm last week. No reason. No answer. So we got to our room --nice bathroom (but hated the 'rain' shower head I like a water pressure) and changed into our swimsuits to use the TINY hot tub on the patio--- It was empty with about a gallon of dirty water in the bottom ...this inclued dead skin floating in it. So we thought we would relax in the pool. Got up to the pool.....you guessed it CLOSED. So we changed and LEFT the hotel for dinner (did not want to press our luck) and went to TUTU Tangos.(we love this place) and enjoyed our evening dining ourside in the warm evening breezes sipping our Coronas.We got back to the room and my huband noticed these tiny bugs crawling on the beautiful countertops in the bathroom. They didn't seem to bother or bite us but just thought you should know....they blended in with the granite so I never noticed them till he said somehting. I was only inspired to write this review after I turned back the sheets and noticed pubic hair in our bed. We had not turned back the bed till 11pm and the staff was beyond rude. I can say that we are well traveled and the service at this establishment needs a 360. I can only imagine they are in finacial trouble. I don't know how folks are giving them rave reviews. It was also VERY NOISY as well. Do your homework. If you are looking for a Spa like atmosphere this is NOT the place to stay. I would not reccomend it for a Honeymoon by any streach. You could get better treatment from Royal Caribbean or even Disney World. If you are young and want to party all night and can pass out when you get to your room & have 300 dollars plus per night to blow then this is the place for you! We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “fine if you are a weekend insomniac... BOOK ELSEWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: thepeacha
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at this hotel, most disappointed. Cannot fathom how it is a member of "Leading Hotels of the World" chain... we felt the only decent service we recieved was from valets! We felt that it was a very poor value indeed. Read it and weep... Check in staff was poor: we had to wait a few minutes while she completed some personal chitchat with another employee before she resigned herself to helping us. When asked a question, she immediately referred us to the concierge... who acted like he had not heard us from two feet away. Reception was not welcoming in the least. The room seemed acceptable at first, although certainly not a suite to my mind- one room, with small rather silly patio with tub that requires serious pre-planning. Room was clean, bathroom generously sized, and although the jagged- wall setup was odd we though we'd be ok. How wrong we were... The hotel is ringed by various nightclubs and parking garages, as well as apartments. I'd read reviews here and knew to ask for a quiet room, which I did. Repeatedly. To no effect. Night #1, 3rd floor facing Virginia St. was serenaded until about 5am by drunkards in the streets, music from various bars and clubs, as well as street traffic. No sleep, to say the least... the poorly sealed sliding glass doors were terrific at allowing every footfall and drunken conversation below to transmit. Called front desk at 7am begging for move to quiet room, was told to call back later, after rooms were cleaned. Customer service? Nope, not here- most unsatisfied. Called at 10, got same girl- my check-in buddy, no doubt!- and was told to call much later so she could "see what she could do." Apology for a lousy night's sleep? No. Assurance of help? No. Finally around 3pm I was given a room change- no offer to help move, and I was assured this one would be quiet. Foolish beliver, I moved into a smaller room and thought all would be well- glad to trade a few square feet for a good night's sleep. Incorrect again, more nighttime fun in store... Room #2, 5th floor facing Florida Ave was worse! Nightclub Cielo was pounding along well past 4 am, packed solid and loud as all get out. More street drunks, and plenty of come-and-go traffic from the garage entrance just below us. My DH got up at 2 to see what the racket was and told me the streets were jam-packed with clubgoers, no end in sight. Let me guess- the hotel had no clue? I was given a smaller room, after a hassle, promised quiet, and got garbage. Blissfully the clubs were much quieter on night #3, a Sunday night- but the garage was still doing booming (literally) business. Bed in room #2 was cheap and squeaky, to add salt to the wound. I was so disappointed- we would have slept better at the nearby Courtyard by Mariott and treated better too, just ridiculous. I was disappointed in most every way here- I expected a lovely gracious small hotel with charm and class, and got a poorly managed hotel that charges gladly but serves unwillingly, only when pressed. Other service lows: -bar served over-warmed red wine (75 degrees) in white wine glass... really now, how hard is it to do this right? -staff was cold and never smiled or greeted you, questions were ignored or answered with a monosyllable -concierge seemed disintersted in directing us to locations, giving maps, etc.- simple requests were poorly managed, what would have happened with a large one? We walked to the Ritz Carlton for drinks one night, they provided another world of service- learned and used our name, greeted us courteously, served us well- we were so impressed we stayed for a marvelous dinner and went back to the Mayfair with deep regrets and that unhappy feeling of "never, ever again!" Now this is not an unfair comparison, the Mayfair was fairly expensive and a LHW member, which promises a certain luxurious level of service. We feel we paid for far more than we recieved- and the service issues were inexcusable for any property boldly proclaiming its LHW status. I've been treated better in Econolodges! The hotel has a few good points, which I will mention: - good internet service -quick and efficient valet service (but at $25/ day I do expect that) -nice ambiance, and very clean -super easy access to CocoWalk- but mind the nightclubs that adjoin it!!! So if you really like to party up your weekends, you can disco to your heart's content and stagger home with no problem here. If you want gracious service and charm, redirect yourself to another property- the Mayfair will charge dearly but not deliver and you will have all night awake to contemplate your unhappy choice. Please learn from my experience and select another hotel- there is a reason why this one is not number one in Coconut Grove and I have certainly learned my lesson!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: azrael765
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Miami, my husband's second, and we decided to stay off South Beach and couldn't be happier about choosing the Mayfair in Coconut Grove. The staff was terrific, the hotal is unique and beautiful, the room was spacious and lovely, the bed was very comfortable, the bath was big and accomodating.....There are may reviews that speak about the noise level and while, yes there is some outside noise, it's mainly because the hotel is located in the heart of downtown Coconut Grove and you can hear the music from the restaurants. I found this to be expected and didn't affect our stay at all. Our room overlooked the entrance to CocoWalk (the shopping/restaurant outdoor mall) and we found the advantage of this location to far exceed the disadvantage of the noise level. We loved the bar in the lobby, and wish we had had a chance to eat at the restaurant. The drive to South Beach was only 20 mins. We would recommend this location for anyone in Miami to have fun and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: japgal
Reviews.Content: I thought "suite" usually has two rooms or at least somewhat devided areas. We got the executive suite and it was just one long weird shaped room. Sure, marble floor is nice, but it causes noise from upstairs and hallways. Insulation was real bad. The elevators were broken and they don't even say sorry. Most stuff were not helpful except a couple guys at night. There is no ice machine for the guest and you have to use one in pantry (old). We were bothered by noise so much we almost canceled three nights to stay somewhere else. We decided not to since it was the day before new year's eve and almost impossible to find a room elsewhere. Overall, I wish I never booked this trip. But I guess you sometimes find out 4 stars could mean nothing. I just want to how they were able to get 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Noise Level Exaggerated”
Reviews.Author: TheAnalyst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair on a Saturday night (Dec 2nd) with my wife and another couple the night before a cruise that left out of the Port of Miami. We were on the third floor in the "Fluffy Ruffle Suite" and our balcony faced Virginia St. between the hotel and the Cocowalk - which I think is what people consider the "loud" side. We were in bed around midnight and had no trouble sleeping. The only noise I heard was the elevator ding in the morning and that was because our room was directly in front of them. I meant to ask for a room away from the elevators, but forgot to. I found our room very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. We did not use the hot tub on the balcony, although if we had more time we definitely would have, and we did not eat in the hotel restaurant. The outdoor atrium was very nice to relax in. The hotel is perfectly situated in the middle of a cozy neighborhood full of boutique shops and restaurants. We ate dinner at our trusty favorite, the Cheesecake Factory, breakfast the next morning at Green Street and bought a few nice bottles of wine to take on our cruise at the Cheese Market on Main Hwy. We flew into Fort Lauderdale and took an airport limo (ask at the limo kiosk outside the terminal) for $76 flat-rate to the hotel. We were glad because there were three separate accidents on the highway and who knows what the cab meter may have been. We took a regular taxi from the hotel to the Port of Miami and it cost $25.

Reviews.Title: “Recent renovationis a step in the right direction”
Reviews.Author: aerofl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa at the end of October. We think this was either our 5th or 6th visit and our first since the hotel has undergone renovation. We booked directly through the hotel and had a rate of $159/nite. On previous stays we had paid upwards of $350/nite. I would guess that the rate we paid was due to one of two factors - the rooftop pool had not been completed at that time (a fact that the hotel website clearly mentioned) or it was a special rate to attract guests during a slower time of year. In any case, the hotel, though hosting at least one wedding, didn't seem to be full. The hotel is located right in the middle of Coconut Grove, close to Biscayne Bay. There are many shops, restaurants, and clubs in the area (the hotel is directly across the street from CocoWalk) and the area becomes very lively on weekend nights. Many students from the University of Miami party here on the weekends, so you might want to take that into consideration. Upon arrival, we valeted the car ($25/nite), but there is a parking garage directly across the street as well as street and lot parking in the area. The valet was always quick to bring the car around - we never had to wait long. Check in was friendly and efficient. Although the structural elements of the hotel remain as before, there was definitely a zen-like updating of the lobby/bar area. The five floors of the hotel are centered around an atrium filled with tropical plants and comfortable seating. We had requested a room on the quiet side of the hotel, away from CocoWalk. Our room on the fifth floor (I believe it was called a junior suite) was very large. Soothing calm colors throughout with tile/stone flooring. Very comfortable king size bed with beautiful bedding, a lovely seating area with upholstered loveseat and chairs, great lighting, side and end tables. Very large flat screen TV which could be seen from the bed or the sitting area. On the small private balcony outside the room was a hot tub and a canopy-covered loveseat. The bellman explained the operation of the hot tub to us (it takes about 15 minutes to fill and about an hour and a half to heat, so plan accordingly). The bathroom was very large, with a separate glass-enclosed shower and soaking tub. Plentiful towels and toiletries along with a small TV above the sinks. The lighting was a bit dingy and as another TA reviewer pointed out, the only outlet is indeed tucked up behind the TV. The requisite coffee maker and hairdryer were also provided. There were a few odd elements left from the pre-renovations rooms - a black headboard that had nothing to do with the decor, very dark woodwork that needs to be refinished and an odd shelf/desk? along a wall on one side of the bed with no light or outlets which we eventually used as a luggage rack. We never saw anyone from housekeeping, but the room was always clean, though not entirely spotless. I think the photos on this website provide a pretty accurate portrayal of the hotel public areas and rooms. When it is reopened, be sure to visit the rooftop pool. We always enjoyed the time we spent up there and the beautiful views of the surrounding area. We didn't use the spa or the hotel restaurant. There is a Starbucks across the street which we used for breakfast. Nearby restaurants we tried were the Cheesecake Factory, the Med Cafe and TuTu Tango. Even at 2:30 in the afternoon there were long waits for a table for lunch, but if you eat on the early side in the evening, there seemed to be no waits at all. What really impressed me this trip was the quality, friendliness and attitude of the staff. From the valet to the front desk to the bartenders to the concierge, each and every staff member was there to make sure our stay was up to our expectations. I've always liked the Mayfair House (its former name), but with the redeisgn of the hotel and what seemed to be much upgraded staff, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair Rooms - Description”
Reviews.Author: crazytravelernyc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mayfair a few times for business and pleasure, most recently last week (on business this time). I also requested a room on the "quiet side", as I have stayed there during the holidays and had to endure a sleepless night as party people made their way out of the restaurants in Coconut Grove. Just beware that some rooms are much better than others. When I asked for a quiet room, I therefore got a small room without any natural light (didn't really matter since I was there on biz). The pros are: Most of the rooms are fully renovated, marble baths with mini-flat screen televisions and Aveda bath products. Great location in the Grove-you can walk to restaurants and shops. The decor is beautiful, the hot tubs are great after a hard day of work or fun Service is very helpful Cons: The one restaurant in the hotel is just okay, not great

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diotima9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for seven nights, and it was wonderful. Based on previous posts regarding noise levels, we requested a room on the quiet side of the hotel. We ended up in a corner of the hotel, which didn't give us much of a view but we had absolutely no problems with noise. The room was very spacious, but the deck was very small. The bed/linens were perfect, and the only complaint we had about the room itself was the damp/humid smell which was likely a product of the open-air concept of the hotel itself. That being said, it didn't bother us to the point of complaint. The few interactions we had with the staff were very positive, and we found that the service was friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is ideal, with Cocowalk across the street and lots of restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood. There is construction going on next door but it did not bother us in the slightest. The valet parking was expensive, so we mostly parked in the Cocowalk parkade which is across the street. There are cheaper open air lots nearby as well. All in all, it was a great experience. We would certainly stay at the Mayfair again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms....”
Reviews.Author: amybojo
Reviews.Content: @ the Mayfair Hotel & Spa. I've stayed in a several hotels for both business and pleasure, in this place has by far one of the most spacious guest suite layouts of any - with the upgrade (be sure to inquire about this @ the front desk when you check in, as we were able to upgrade for a mere $20/night) the rooms are approx. 600 - 800 sq. feet depending on where the room is located. I would have given this hotel a 5 star excellent rating, but am unable to do so based on two things - 1/ the noise and 2/ the service. The noise is terrible @ night - because of the location of the hotel - it's right across from CocoWalk (which houses a Fat Tuesday's bar - which is partially outdoors in the middle atrium portion of the complex , which also has the CheeseCake Factory, and AMC Theater and some other non-chain restaurants and shops - Coyote Ugly bar is coming so it could be potentially louder here). Knowing the noise was going to be a factor didn't deter us from staying here however, as we had read previous traveler's reviews - so we knew to ask to be on a higher floor (it's only 5 floors - so 4-5) away from the noise (primarily two streets are noiser, the one by CocoWalk Complex and the one that is above the comedy club - Shops @ Mayfair and a loud Cuban restaurant /shop that was playing Calypso type music the entire day @ large decibels). The other reason that I wouldn't say this place is Excellent - although it still is above average is the service. The night manager/or on duty desk person was extremely clueless in our opinion and other's opinions, when at 1:30 am in the morning the fire alarm was going off and the annoucement coming over the loudspeakers was for us to get out of the hotel - via the stairs. After traveling down the stairs with other guests in the hotel - everyone dressed in various states of dress because of the time - we saw the man @ the front desk and he looked at us like he had no idea what we were all doing down in the lobby. I asked him if there was still a need to evacuate and he said, "no, false alarm" and that's it....it would have been nice (and really, expected) of him to apologize for the inconvenience and even better, since they had the time to warn us and basically the alarm woke up the entire hotel, they could have sent another message over the loudspeaker informing people that, in fact, it wasn't a false alarm. Other than those couple of examples, the stay was good. The conceriges seem helpful - and they are able to call a cab right away for you - but beware (Diamond Cab was our company) takes you the long way to the airport and doesn't take credit cards - so please plan accordingly if using this cab service. I used it 5 times - since every time the hotel called for the cab it was the same bad driver, poor service available. It comes fast, but you get to your destination slower - as in my opinion, he preys on unsuspecting tourists who don't know the shortest distances or directions etc. Dining tip - The Charthouse -it looks like it's from the same era as the LoveBoat - and you sort of feel like you're on a cruise ship - but the food is wonderful, views amazing - service is so-so, but they still get the crowds because of the view (outside you can sit right overlooking Key Bisaycne Bay).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: clydester
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the may fair oct.28th and only spent one night there ,but we wished we could stay longer. we got a suite on the corner and it was way to noisy (be sure to ask for the quiet side) and i called the front desk and they accomadated us immediatly! no questions asked. the rooms all have hot tubs on the balcony and they are very clean! the area in the atrium is VERY relaxing and you could sit there for hours abd hours.. i would definatly recommend theis hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new Miami home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KenandAimee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for three nights as part of a business trip to Miami. Our stay was wonderful. Great bed, fabulous bathroom, tons of closet space, giant flat screen. Folks at the front desk were friendly and helpful with check in and directions about town. One reason we chose the Mayfair was that we wanted to stay in a walkable neighborhood. It's right in the middle of the Coconut Grove shopping area with lots of restaurants, bars and entertainment. Lots to do right outside the door of your hotel. Noise might be a little bit of an issue on the weekends but our stay was very quiet and restful. Our only complaint was the spa on the patio left a lot to be desired but the incredible soaking tub in the bathroom more than made up for it! Our new place to stay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: dowagerton
Reviews.Content: As noted by the previous reviewer, I was a bit nervous about my upcoming visit to the Mayfair after reading recent reviews on this website. I agree that the secret to success at the Mayfair is to reserve a suite on an upper floor and to keep the door to the bedroom closed at night to buffer exterior noise. We actually had two suites (one for us and one for other family members) and both were outstanding. The entire family was impressed with the size and decor of the rooms. Our younger contingent loved the hottub. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and professional. We did valet the car and it wasn't a problem. We would have had to spend a lot of our short vacation time parking and retrieving the car if we hadn't used the hotel's valet service. This hotel is an excellent value, in our opinions. We look forward to returning to the Mayfair when we're back in the Coral Gables area.

Reviews.Title: “Boy, It Was a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: alwaysmoving
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was checking Tripadvisor daily about this hotel before leaving for two days....had booked in the first place because of a very reasonable price for a two room suite. But the last review I read sent me to the cancellation policy, only to discover that I had missed the window by two hours. My daughter and I were stuck and, man, was I apprehensive. I so thoroughly scrutinized every interaction with staff, every corner of the room, every phone call to the front desk that I was driving myself crazy. And, with the exception of some loud conversation at 4 am the second night, the experience was close to perfect. The room was so unique in design, great beds and linens, terrific bathroom (wonderful Grohe rain showerhead), nice layout, nice hot tub on the balcony, ceiling fans....and the decor of the entire place is unlike anything I've seen before. The center atrium is magical. Our experience started when we registered early, since we had an appointment until 8 pm. When we got back to the hotel, the front desk person knew right away who we were, keys were waiting, and our request for a quiet room had been accommodated. We could not figure out how to fill the hot tub -- our call to the front desk was promptly answered and the man sent to help was at our door within 2 minutes. We were always politely greeted, all questions and phone calls quickly answered. The place overall was immaculate and the staff performed just fine. We took other reviewers' advice and parked elsewhere. While there is a parking garage across the street, there are also a number of open parking lots just a few blocks away that charge between $5 - $6 for overnight. The only catch: you have to be out by 9 am, which was not a problem for us. During the day, throughout Coconut Grove, there are blue parking kiosks that give you a slip for your dashboard noting the length of parking time paid for. It is an easy and efficient system but have lots of change; not all the machines take bills. Now, there are some idiosyncrasies about the hotel that might bother some but which added to the quirkiness for us. Yes, the rooms can be dark but we found it restful. I searched for an outlet in the bathroom (coffee pot and hairdryer both provided, so I knew there had to be one!) and it took a day to discover it high up the wall next to the outlett for the bathroom plasma TV. (We moved the coffee pot to the built in desk nook, no problem). If there was one thing I just didn't like, it is that the balcony faces a very ugly concrete wall and there is no view. I cannot figure out the layout of the rooms in the hotel so I guess this is what you get with a quiet room. About that 4 am conversation -- I awoke thinking "Oh, no, here we go" but realized I had not closed the doors between sitting and bed rooms. That greatly helped the situation but also gave me an understanding of how the noise carried between balconies and through the open atrium areas outside your door. Fortunately, the conversation, while loud, was short and over quickly. And checkout was accurate and so fast, the valet had not finished turning my car around when we arrived with suitcase. Also he was shocked that I still tipped him -- cannot be the same guy an earlier reviewer encountered. The bottom line -- yes, I would stay here again and anticipate another enjoyable visit -- but only in one of their quiet rooms and only in a suite with two rooms separated by a door. Even then, other patrons conversations might be a problem but I think that is an inherrent design flaw in the layout of the entire hotel. I am willing to take the chance. Sorry for the long posting but I spent two nights in the place with writing this review in mind!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: Showed up and the room was amazingly huge! Great accomodations..but thats it. 1. The noise is crazy. 2. Pool what pool? 3. Condos bieng built right next door. 4. Staff must be on some work release program because they honestly dont care about anything. 5. Valet...ok I think they took my car out on a joyride, I had 12000 miles when I checked in and 12098 when I got it back. 6. Valet, again they could not find my car at the end of my stay..I waited for an hour...but was comped a free night on my next visit which will be hmmmmm NEVER!! 7. Hot tub on balcony chock full of large roaches..nice Avoid it. I stay at Kimpton hotels all the time and when I booked this I was unaware Kimpton had dropped this one from its line..now I know why...go to the Sonesta right down the street and stay there..trust me you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you need”
Reviews.Author: Danube
Reviews.Content: The Good: Rooms- Excellent two bedrooms, two baths, 4 plasma tv's, one in bathroom. Nice amenities inside, bed, dressings etc. Location- Outstanding, Coconut Grove has plenty of places to party and is centrally located.25 minutes to South Beach, 25 minutes to Airport. 30 minutes to Orange bowl for the game. 6-7 miles form campus. Party Scene- Very Decent for an off shoot of South beach, nice variety of clubs, sports bars and restaurants. The Bad: Customer Service-Employees were nice but not once in our 4 day stay was the phone answered when we called down for anything(internet service had to be repaired twice). Explanation to this were too many requests, well how does this happen repeatedly for 4 days? Bait and Switch- This Pool thing must end.......it is still not ready do not believe the internet. Pictures posted Hah! Everyone we encountered wondered about this. Overall- Went down with two other buddies and had a great time, happy witht the Hotel overall but the Pool and service definitely could get better. Price was good and the room provided what we needed and the location to fun is just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Just Too Loud”
Reviews.Author: dsagman
Reviews.Content: Too loud. Our first night our room was directly above a bar called "Wet Willies" which features every kind of slushy mixed with alcohol imaginable, as well an outdoor sound system and screaming drunk patrons till 2 in the morning when I could take it no more and got our room switched. The second room was quieter, but there was still plenty of screaming late into the night and we had the pleasure of some drunk teenagers who were looking for a party in a nearby room mistakenly banging repeatedly on our door at 1 am. On the plus side, the hotel is lovely, the staff very helpful (no surprises when we asked to change rooms), and the appointments of the rooms great: plasma TV, robes, individual hot tub in each room. We did have problems with the TV working, but they got it fixed. I ended up buying earplugs just to get through the evening on our three night stay, but I still felt like Elmer Fudd in that cartoon where Daffy Duck is the hotel manager and keeps waking him up. My eyes weren't that bleary, but they were close. To be fair, the neighborhood is not the hotel's fault. Even driving up to get to the valet parking was a scene out of a frat movie with drunken folks wandering in the street. I picked the hotel based on the positive travel reviews on this site, and while I've been very happy with other hotels I found via tripadvisor, this one was a severe disappointment, and I hope that if noise is an issue to you, that you read this review. If you enjoy late night partying every night, then this is a great hotel. If you're older, and just want a quiet nights sleep, do not stay here. The savings are not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet,Comfortable, Romantic....Loved it”
Reviews.Author: trumpcard98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-end at the Mayfair and I have to say it was a delightful surprise. The renovation is complete and the hotel itself is fab and completely modernized. Suites are some of the largest that I have seen and though the housekeeping service was efficicent, I did not see any turn-down service. Overall, a real winner and i would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Htlsnb
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent the weekend at this beautiful hotel recently for a girls weekend. We requested a quiet location based on previous reviews and we were glad we did. Outside the hotel was a little noisy on Saturday, but not so noisy that we were disturbed. The inside of the hotel is so unexpected from the outside. We were surprised at how big the hotel was, but the staff made you feel as if you were at a bed and breakfast. We were both shocked at how beautiful and tranquil the rooms were. Everything seemed so relaxing and peaceful about the room. Very Zen-like. We stayed in a deluxe bedroom which had a beautiful living area in addition to the bedroom and spa like bathroom. There is also a private hot tub on the balcony, but it was too hot outside to make use of the tub. The room has a mini bar and snacks that are the usual over-priced items. In addition there is a microwave which is perfect to accompany movies you bring with you as the room has three (yes, three!) plasma screen tv's and a dvd player. However, the location is right in the middle of Coconut Grove and we enjoyed walking around and window shopping. There are also many restaurants available to choose from. Make use of the concierge for suggestions. The concierge recommended Cafe on the Green for breakfast and it was wonderful. In general the staff was friendly. I had one run in with the bellhop, but this did not mar my overall stay. We did not have time to take advantage of the spa, but when we go back next time we certainly will do so. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: esb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayfair for one night in June and would recommend it highly to anyone. Positives: HUGE room ( I mean really big), jacuzzi on private balcony, comfy beds with nice linens, large flat screen tv, very nice bathroom with Aveda products, excellent location next to CocoWalk, very cool architecture and atmosphere, summer rates are incredible...122 a night. Negatives: Bar prices are SKY HIGH. Being next to CocoWalk it can be a bit noisy I'm told, although we didn't have any problems. Ask for a room on the quiet side. The roll away we had delivered was really, really bad. Despite the short list of negatives, we will definitely be back. We'll just bring our own drinks and one fewer person.

Reviews.Title: “"A lovely stay in a lovely suite"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Mayfair was in winter 2005. When making the reservation we requested a suite. Much to our dismay, when we checked in and went to our suite, it was not a suite, but rather a relatively small room. Needless to say, my husband and I were quite disappointed. Overall, however, our stay was quite nice, despite our perception of what constituted a suite versus that which was advertised as a suite. While we were checking out of the hotel, my husband was chatting with another couple. Somewhat, surprisingly, they were raving about their hotel accommodations. They indicated that they had stayed in a very nice one-bedroom Deluxe suite which turned out to be only marginally more expensive than the room we had stayed in. As we liked the hotel"s ambience, amenities, location, etc., we decided that if we returned to the area we would consider their tip. Well, in late May we came to visit family in the area, and booked a one-bedroom Deluxe suite. As it turned out, this suite was simply lovely and far surpassed our expectations, especially at the price. Once all renovations (e.g., pool) are complete, we certainly would recommend the Mayfair to friends, especially when staying in a Deluxe suite. Finally, I should point out that for a luxury hotel, particularly in Florida, the location is fantastic -- one can walk to anything and everything in seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! After reading postings I was worried. It was absolutely gorgeous in the middle of Coconut Grove. After shopping, etc. it was so nice to go back to the peacefulness of this hotel. The bed was so inviting, the TV was incredible and the total luxury made it hard to believe that we were in the middle of the hectic Grove. The wireless connection was a definate plus. Relaxing in the terrace hot tub while watching the younger crowd walk by was great. We could see them but they couldn't see us. The exotic detail of the resort was breathtaking from the glass elevators to the lush tropical gardens and the detailed woodwork made me feel like I was in Spanish villa ,yet still moments away from CocoWalk. You definately don't need a car. After eating at many restaurants during our stay, the absolute best dining experience was at the Ginger Grove, it's the best kept secret. The food and service was incredible. . We ordered room service one morning and they said it would be 20 minutes and it was delivered it in 10 minutes. The rest of the Grove should learn what service really means. The staff was very attentive from the moment we arrived until the pleasant bell staff bid us farewell. The Spa was heavenly! The only complaint was that my husband thought the Spa robes were much too small. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than many of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Mayfair thru Priceline and got a huge discount on the room. (Not a bad strategy considering there are only a few 4 stars in Coconut Grove- you can't go wrong). Overall, the staff was attentive and I requested a room to the quiet side of the hotel-away from Cocowalk. It does get loud in the Grove but we had no problem sleeping at night. Plasma TV- cool; Hot tub on patio- awesome; staff- was very friendly and attentive. Valet was a little high $ 25 per day but they were very fast retrieving the car and helpful. There is self parking close by.A very enjoyable stay and we enjoyed the local restaurants away from CocoWalk- the choices there seemed very commercial. In closing, the hotel was no where near as bad as some of the posts below .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tqerose
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a suite at the Mayfair from a discount travel website. The decor is gorgeous. The staff we dealt with (front desk, bellman, valets, bartender) were all very welcoming and "at your service" with no attitude. Our suite (and apparently all the suites) had a Japanese soaking tub on the balcony. It was a fun and pleasant extra. Included in the room were these great little rechargeable battery-powered 'candles'. It was a nice touch to be able to take those out on the balcony at night. How nice to have free wireless internet in the room - without the $10 daily charge that seems to be spreading like a plague through the hotel industry nowadays. Luxurious seersucker robes. We ordered a room service breakfast because we felt like being pampered. Though expensive, it was truly delicious. Many nice amenities. We got a bargain because we had gotten a special rate, but we agreed that if we had paid full price we wouldn't have felt gouged. The only thing I could complain about is that some guests nearby were out on their balcony until quite late making a good bit of noise. I was a little worried they would keep us up, but we fell right to sleep. No doubt since the bed and bedding were extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible service when it comes to Wifi, doesn't exist although they claim it does. Nobody wants to take responsiblity for the poor service. Same with their television. Big sets in the rooms but no channels, no VOD

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why all the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: annettemarice
Reviews.Content: A little background: We stayed at the Mayfair for three nights (Sat-Mon). We were in Miami for family, not to "sight see or relax". Bought the 3 night stay on a discount website...(didn't pay full price) We only stay at 4 or 5 star hotels. I consider myself to be high maintenance, but I am also pretty easy going. On to the review: After reading all the reviews we expected the worst and we were throughly impressed. After a couple of polite calls, the front desk agent accomodated our early check in, which after coming in from a red-eye made all the difference in the world. Every staff member we encountered was polite, nice and accommodating. They hesitated to even take a tip. Our room faced the construction going on next door, but it was masked by the bamboo fence growing in the balcony. This allowed for privacy should we have needed it. The balcony had the sauna and a nice reclining/chair thing that looked like it would have been great to sleep on. The room was highly upgraded, the bedding was AMAZING and the flat screen TV was a GREAT thing. The bathroom was nice and roomy (though I prefer to have the toilet behind a closed door). We ordered room service and it was delivered on time and warm. The food was a solid B. I ordered the Eggs Benedict (I try them at every hotel) and it was ok. The coffee was PERFECT. Totally hit the spot. I didn't hear any noise on Sat or Sun night, but I could hear the noise from the construction on Monday. They are supposed to put a pool on the roof and when they do, it will make a good hotel into a great one. The location is right in the middle of Cocowalk and easy to get to. Honestly, I wouldn't pay full price, but for the deal I got, I thought it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Decor”
Reviews.Author: ANYC
Reviews.Content: All in all, I really enjoyed my long weekend at the Mayfair. Location is perfect for exploring Coconut Grove or Miami. I had an executive suite facing a balcony/garden which was very quiet. The decor is very upscale and the rooms well appointed. I think the hotel will only improve as they work out the kinks after renovations and add the pool and roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “Noise! Noise! Noise!”
Reviews.Author: bradowpc
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews after I had already booked my room at this hotel for a Thursday night business stay and quickly called the hotel to request a quiet room. The hotel staff told me upon checkin that they had put me in their "quietest area" in an effort to meet this request. This is not prevent repetitive slamming of our neighbor's door and her loud yelling conversation in Spanish starting around 3AM and lasting until shortly after we called hotel security an hour later. The hotel is generally quite nice... great little hot tub outside on the lanai, nice room layout, luxurious bathroom and amenities, etc. But if you actually want to use the bed to sleep at night, do not stay here. You will get no rest. I will not be staying here again despite the hotel's 600 yard proximity to my client's front door.

Reviews.Title: “You can't expect quiet in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: NancyVermont
Reviews.Content: I mean, we got up at 4 a.m. to get to Miami International and the bars were hopping, cars and people everywhere. No way a hotel can keep you from hearing some of this joviality. The lobby and atmosphere is wonderful and our 2 queen-bed room was very large -- the bathroom was huge and very clean, with another tv. We would stay there again, as with 2 boys, it's important to have a large room, and a couch big enough for one (child) to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton needs to cancel their contract”
Reviews.Author: norcalmama
Reviews.Content: Shoulda paid more attention to the reviews that mentioned noise. We have NEVER experienced such 24 hour noise in any hotel/motel, even including a Motel 6 on a 6-lane highway we got stuck in one holiday. Our last night we got maybe 1 hour sleep; when the shouting stopped after 3 am it was not long before a series of loud car alarms went off. It is unconscionable that they charge over $400 a night and have not done anything about the windows. We were on the 4th floor and it was as if people were partying right outside our room. Or inside, as a matter of fact. If I had been traveling on business I would have been unable to function the next day. And we had one of the suites, too. We did not have the "soundwall" one reviewer mentioned. In fact, our bed was about 2 feet from the window. There were other problems, too. Shower had no hot water the first day and didn't drain right so almost flooded. Bathroom door got stuck on a hump on the floor and also didn't latch. After several calls and a two hour wait I had to go to front desk to get a room service menu. Then the room service tray was not picked up for over 12 hours after we called. I knew the pool was not ready yet - from the looks of things they've not even started so if it matters to you don't go until you've checked. $25/day for valet parking. Not only was the car filthy when we got it back, the valet just stood there staring at my huge suitcase and didn't even offer to put it in the trunk. There's more, but you get the gist. We really aren't especially picky folks but this was the worst hotel we've ever stayed in, especially considering the price. We chose this place despite the mixed reviews because it is a Kimpton hotel. They need to seriously reconsider as having an operation like this will hurt their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Some misses, a lot of hits - I'd stay here again - Good value”
Reviews.Author: thegov
Reviews.Content: I travel for business all the time, and decided to check out this hotel. Many of the other revewis are correct about this hotel, so I am going to summarize my experience. Great Stuff about Mayfair: 1) Atmosphere. This is a very cool hotel with a lot of character. It has a strong Asian/Pacific design with clean lines, nice flooring, cool fixtures, an open air courtyard in the center that flows into other covered spaces, lots of dark hardwoods, and tropical plants. 2) The Staff. Everyone here was very helpful, anticipated my needs, seemed happy to be working here, and delivered great service. The room cleanup/maid service really went the extra mile. 3) The room. A flat screen TV in the bathroom, bedroom, and living room, Aveda bath products, marble floors, comfortable bed, hot tub outside, and large bathroom are some nice touches. 4) Location. The hotel is right in the middle of coconut grove and is within walking distance of all the great restaraunts and shops. Criticisms of Mayfair: 1) Outside noise. The other posts are correct. If you're staying here while the nearby clubs and bars are busy - you will hear it. The hotel has tried to address this by putting a glass and wood divider door between the bedroom and living room, which helps block out about 85% of the noise. I still got a good nights rest. 2) Internet access. It's horrible!! I NEED internet access when I travel, and the only way to get it at the Mayfair is wirelessly. Because the signal did not reach my room, I had to sit in the lounge to do any work. Frustrating. 3) Parking. I come and go throughout the day and prefer to not valet, so I parked in the garage below. The only way to get up to the hotel was through a hot, small staircase that you had to climb at least 4 levels up to get to the hotel. 4) Hotel or condo? It was kind of weird to only have 1 phone in the whole room, and no book that listed hotel services and amenities. I had to call the front desk to even see if they had a gym. You see signs that advertise mayfair condos, so its confusing. Nothing in my room told me how to access the internet, find the gym, order roomservice, etc. (???) Well that's about it. I hope this post is helpful to you. Business travelers might have some difficulty here, but overall its a cool hotel that is a good value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want some sleep”
Reviews.Author: AMP89
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful-but the outside noise is horrible-apparently Miami doesn't close their bars until around 4:00 a.m.-if you enjoy sleeping I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you bring earplugs. Also there is a charge for Internet access for the business center and the printer isn't hooked up-so bring a laptop and don't plan on being able to print anything out.

Reviews.Title: “Every Hotel Tells a Story”
Reviews.Author: macklinhelsi
Reviews.Content: "Every Hotel Tells a Story" goes the Kimpton strapline... and the Mayfair Hotel and Spa tells the story of a cheap renovation, inept management and nonchalant staff. Having recently spent 5 nights at the hotel on a company conference, I fail to see where the much-publicised $10M spent on renovations actually went. Sure the rooms are very nice (good beds, marble flooring, large plasmas etc), but the external fabric of the building, and many of the public areas (e.g. the landings) have not been touched in years! Investing in new glazing would certainly have been a good idea, as this hotel is exceptionally noisy and I would strongly suggest bringing earplugs if you want a good night sleep. Although this is a newly re-opened property, many of the staff appeared to have a "can't care less" attitude. Calls to guest relations went unanswered, breakfast was a disaster area, and at one stage myself and some colleagues were rudely told to "wait in line" by the one person serving at the bar. The hotel management and its employees certainly need to learn a thing or two about Customer Service... This is NOT a 5-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “PLush and comfortable...but not quite a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is tops. The rooms are comfortable and plush. Housekeeping is fine. The place seems to be converting to a condo and normal hotel support services are not present. Only one elevator was operating---slowly. Failed internet access led the concierge to give me an 800 to call. Pool/sundeck signs lead to dead-end corridor...there is no pool or deck. The front desk did not have any listing of hotel amenities or area activities. It is noisy at night, but quiet compared to South beach. Minor repairs needed to door closer and hardware. It all just says that no-one is in charge. Right location...compromised facility.

Reviews.Title: “So close yet so very far away”
Reviews.Author: susan822
Reviews.Content: This place could be a 5 star hotel, yet they let the small stuff bring them way down. No problems checking in the staff was friendly and pleasant. We went to our suite, number 319, which was very nice and had a japanese soaking tub on the terrace. We immediately began filling the tub since it takes about 1 hour for it to heat up. We then checked out the room which was well decorated, very clean, and quiet. We went out to check on the tub, it was leaking all over the terrace. We called the front desk, they first wanted to move us to a smaller room, then they upgraded us to this giant suite overlooking Virginia Ave. Things went downhill from there. The suite had no robes, the safe did not work, the in room jacuzzi was not as clean as it should have been, the plasma tv that should have been in the bathroom was not there and you could hear everything on the street and in the bar across the street. You might as well have had your mattress out on the sidewalk it was so noisy. I do have to say the bed was very comfortable and the linens were great. They also sent us a bottle of wine and some fruit. This nor the upgrade made me feel special when at 2a.m. I had never been able to sleep for the noise. Doors slammed all night long, I don't know if this was the guest room doors or exit doors. Heres a tip for them: buy white noise sound machines, have a music system in the room fix the doors so they do not slam and upgrade your windows. For a place with this much potential I can not believe they have overlooked this. Some other good points were the rechargeable candles, large plasma tv's,lovely courtyard. I have to also mention the Ginger Grove Restaurant, our meal and service were impeccable. This place is so close to five star and yet so very far `away!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took a gamble on this one because of the mixed reviews and concern about construction noise, but I was pleasantly surprised and completely comfortable. I decided to take a chance due to the great rates and the "japanese soaking tub" in each room. My standards are pretty high for strange sleeping quarters and I am fair, but critical. There was significant renovation and construction, but the hotel is absolutely beautiful and enchanting. The front desk staff were somewhat cold, but my room and the great location made up for it! My room was very contemporary with a tropical feel. It was very large and clean. The linens were quite clean and the bed comfortable. There was a large screen plasma TV and a very nice bathroom with marble tile. It is a bit noisy on certain sides of the hotel because it is in the heart of the lively Coconut Grove area. This is great because you are in close proximity (no cab required), but if you wanted to sleep like I did, then earplugs are a must. I would DEFINITELY stay there again, especially if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is wonderful, unless you want to sleep at night!”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Mom
Reviews.Content: Needing some time away, but not too far away we booked 3 nights at the Mayfair. The hotel renovations are wonderful and the room was great. Staff was very ready to please as well. Spa wasn't open yet but I am sure it will be wonderful. We are in Ft. Lauderdale and have spent 3 months completely renovating our home, which can be very stressful--add to that I am pregnant and so my husband and I needed some major rest and relaxation. Everything was great until about 11 pm. It turns out there is a hip hop club right across the street from the hotel that attracts a very low class crowd that gets into screaming and yelling fights every night we were there. Some idiot was resting on his horn for about 15 minutes, then the police arrived and their sirens were blaring. It was a nightmare--did I mention this was from 3:30-5:30 AM!?!? Second night was the same, except no sirens and the cops broke it up and seemed to have sent everyone home around 3 am. I couldn't take it anymore, we were exhausted. I told the management what happened and they were very apologetic and let us check out one night early and they gave us a nice compensation. They told me that they have been battling w/ the city to do something about that club as there are even Coconut Grove residents on the same block that have sold their condos and had to move away. She told me to ask for a "quiet room" next time we stay. So, be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: MemeVirginia
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are stationed in Iraq and we had two weeks R&R to the states. We chose to spend it at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa and we couldn't have made a better decision. As soon as we walked into the hotel lobby you could hear the sounds of relaxation and the greenery with outdoor ceiling fans, big fluffy couches in the lobby sit the mood. When we got to our room it was very spacious with white linen and hard wood floors. The bathroom was marble with a rain down shower head. On our terance we had a jacuzzi with a wall blocking the view so we had the option of getting in the jacuzzi naked! The staff was awsome. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Coconut grove best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: DadeDiva
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel.. The surroundings are beautiful, the staff is excellent. The Valet and Bellman had great knowledge and ideas for what to do in the city. The room is beautiful, the restaurant and bar are almost open and from what I can see they will be beautiful once they are finished. Hurry and stay here now once the renovation is complete the average person will not be able to afford to it.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane relief”
Reviews.Author: Seaoat
Reviews.Content: I live in Coconut Grove and recently stayed at the Mayfair for one night with my 11 year old son. We stayed there because Hurricane Katrina caused our neighborhood to be without electricity for 5 days. On the fifth day, when I realized my son had tired of cold baths and sleeping with windows open under unbearable heat, we retreated to the Mayfair. It was the first time I have ever stayed there and it will not be my last. We had a beautiful suite on the 4th floor with two plasma televisions and a nice size bathroom. We were treated very well. Even though we live nearby, it was like a mini vacation to us. We met several other guests and guess what-they were from Coconut Grove and Coral Gables. I guess I was not the only person escaping the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. I was adequately warned of the renovations, but found that the Hotel has obviously discontinued cleaning and maintaining the public areas during this time. The room had nice furnishings, but was located on the West side of the building, where there is some extremely loud nightlife. For a light sleeper, it is impossible to rest there. I found a huge palmetto roach in the room and the hot tub appeared dirty. The final straw was when I called for an additional package of coffee from housekeeping (there is no room service and the hotel stocks the room with only one cup size pack of decaf and one pack of regular). Three phone calls and 2 hours later - still no coffee. Regardless of renovations, this is not the type of service I expect from a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding gamble paid off”
Reviews.Author: Cason
Reviews.Content: Being from Miami, we were familiar with the Mayfair and booked it for my "bridal escape" and wedding weekend. Imagine my horror when I found out a month before the big day that the hotel was under major renovation! They had failed to inform me, but to their credit, they explicitly warned my dad when he booked rooms a month later that "renovation" meant jackhammers, construction, etc. Since I did not the time or energy to deal with it, I kept the reservation. It was worth it! Sure, there was some concrete dust and missing shrubs, but the concierge was amazing and the staff was wonderful to a stressed out bride. Certain departments (room repair) left much to be desired, and room service was inconsistent...yet the front desk found an electrical strips to accomodate numerous blow dryers for my bridal party. Thank you Mayfair for providing the backdrop for wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “On the works...Quick getaway-”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are stayed there back in 2001 and to our surprise it was undergoing a major renovation (we had to ask and we were informed that it was taking an "Extreme Makeover" of 25 Million!!!!) - we were absolutely impressed and breat taken by this... My husband made the reservations and was informed of the out of order areas, but they offered alternatives if we didn't wish to stay due to the renovation. That didn't bother us since we were out for a getaway on a Wed-Fri, for 129 a night that beats the Sonesta and the Wyndham. The valet was very well suited and there was a greeter that took us to the registration area. They offered a complementary continental breakfast, and as we were checking into the hotel they told us about the DAILY Complementary Wine Hour (not cheap wine either!). Complimentary WiFi but did have difficulty with it at first and they had someone come up to assist (operator error)... Needless to say, there is no lobby, restaurant, lounge, spa or pool. If your looking for all these this - I don't recommend it at least until October. I was really impressed that the staff was so curteous amidst the conditions they had to function in. The check in was remote on their Indoor/Outdoor terrace - the agent was nice but offering water but the concierge also offered wine NICE TOUCH! When we got to the room, my husband mentioned that we were getting away from the kids and the Jacuzzi was turned on for us when we went in it, the water made us sweat too much so we didn't use it for long. Some of the walls were still bland without any picture frames but the Plasma tv in the suite was a nice touch! We immediately called down to advise of the missing items so they wouldn't think that we took them, and they accommodated us by letting us know that it is due to the timing of the renovation, things are still coming in and since they are still running the hotel it makes it difficult to hang things up and decorate as if they were closed it would go much faster. We asked about the noise and they responded that it is not high energy like South Beach but you definitely have nice spots- Wet Willies, Fat Tuesday with the frozen drinks - Great for this summer... Went for dinner at The Knife (AWESOME) you get complimentary wine bottle or 2 beers with dinner and it is served like a Brazilian Rodizio but with an Argentinean Flair- That was great!!! Kudos to them! Lots of shops and boutiques, the atmosphere there compared to the last time we stayed is completely inviting and enjoyable. The following night they were sold out and stayed at the Ritz Carlton around the corner. Not bad, definitely paid too much for a small room. Nice pool area, but seemed understaffed and those who waited on us were not service kind, sort of on the frustration level :(. For now, if you don't mind having a few amenties and all your going to the area for is to relax at night and go out during the day - there is no bother. I definitely recommend a return getaway, but they need to get this place going already! Definite potential for my corporate and social events! I got a picture of the middle of the hotel which is a gorgeous atrium -

Reviews.Title: “Perfect considering conditions”
Reviews.Author: jinsuchung
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay at the Mayfair hotel!! We were given a beautiful renovated suite upon check-in and loved it. The suite was spacious, clean and luxurious. The balcony with the private soaking tub was very nice. The huge flat screen plasma t.v didn't hurt either. They are undergoing renovations at the moment but it is a minor annoyance considering the beautiful rooms and atrium. There is a lot to do in miami, so we were not in the hotel during the day. Thus, we avoided the noise and construction. If you book this hotel knowing that there is rennovations and don't mind a little noise, I think you will be pleasantly surprised. We were very pleased and definitely recommend this hotel.
